TRAINING OF ORGANIZATION DELEGATION AUTHORIZATION UNIT MEMBERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFEB512C8056C4A06993BE139370A293C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Unit member annual ethics training Section 44736 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HC01B2272061E412CAB3279ABBD3EE014" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5B04D83AF6534B9EB6471B01914DA427" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Ethics training requirement for ODA holders <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93400A65A1904A9685BC74B2E594EE84" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall review and ensure each ODA holder authorized by the Administrator under section 44702(d) has in effect a recurrent training program for all ODA unit members that covers— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB7855D2564EA4079A86C6FD29D40FCBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) unit member professional obligations and responsibilities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC92E9371D414CE6BBECD17317B0A71A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the ODA holder’s code of ethics as required to be established under section 102(f) of the Aircraft Certification, Safety, and Accountability Act (49 U.S.C. 44701 note); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H63A98978A8FA4D24AC38782EF70888BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) procedures for reporting safety concerns, as described in the respective approved procedures manual for the delegation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96D415316E124F208619FF5CD9543A56" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the prohibition against and reporting procedures for interference from a supervisor or other ODA member described in section 44742; FAA LEADERSHIP Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A6DC6D9F4CC4F83881DE89BF00225E4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in subsection (a) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Federal and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> In general.—The Federal; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED59564A367448C8A779661A6A226D5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8EBA29800FFD496998192C64E0C68B8E" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCADD28EA98764509AB61E5C294400236" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Administration leadership <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H050221B56999403A8217E6BCD8AA9B18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Administrator <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08E8511A4807408FB720B1A801D49DE8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The head of the Administration is the Administrator, who shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30E8B82745CB4F0C8F7DF0A3CC977298" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 203. PROHIBITION ON CONFLICTING PECUNIARY INTERESTS Section 106(e) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H6E9E42E152DF4DD688A90ADBAF2D90D9" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF46C5C2B1AA4ACF8DC11275C46CB213" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Prohibition on conflicting pecuniary interests <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF03E7CF8C77647B58B714299F9DAC5BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The leadership of the Administration may not have a pecuniary interest in, or hold a financial interest in, an aeronautical enterprise or engage in another business, vocation, or employment. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBB93036F12E401C90EE127D3570955F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Teaching Notwithstanding paragraph (1), the Deputy Administrator may not receive compensation for teaching without prior approval of the Administrator.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCFB857761844CE19C5644FC378B1D3E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Define and document the roles and responsibilities of each office within the FAA that develops, drafts, or reviews each kind of regulatory material in order to ensure that hiring reflects who, where, and how the employees of each such office function in the rulemaking framework. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB1DF63542C14423B15B5154EF2F2D44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Describe any organizational changes or the need to hire additional FAA employees, if necessary, and take into consideration whether current positions are staffed, to reduce delays in publication of regulatory materials. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A96235246FD4F1B8E5A3EA4A5C1481C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) In order to provide the public with detailed information on the progress of the development of regulatory materials, identify reporting mechanisms and develop a template and appropriate system metrics for making publicly available on a website a progress tracker that updates to show the major stages (as determined by the Administrator) of the development of regulatory materials as such materials are initiated, in progress, and completed.

ELIMINATING FAA REPORTING AND UNNECESSARY REQUIREMENTS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8223BC613C6248ACB73C5BC50F53827D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Annual report on aviation activities Section 308 of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD9DAFC1038A44A259F5A4F2795156196" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by striking subsection (b); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA507D924DC8C45609D49B9342F098491" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (b); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H797B9C5596CD4812B7A7BC668C3E6AE5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) by redesignating subsection (e) as subsection (c). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3044B114F68743A2B580D66E2F18BF9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Annual report on the purchase of foreign manufactured articles Section 40110(d) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking paragraph (5). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCFA8CE6ECE3483BACB0EEE8BBD9460B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Annual report on assistance to foreign aviation authorities Section 40113(e) of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4A13DC53639440AB8FDA1A3C9B803525" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by striking paragraph (4); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5414E1A98B914853A962C612C92EFD2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (4).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9614CF8A60AF4A04924ED31EC88CFF9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation If the Administrator determines that telework agreements need to be updated to implement the requirements of subsection (a), the Administrator shall, prior to updating such agreements, consult with— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H905E5D2663554F6C8FF48CD9C16C261F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) exclusive bargaining representatives of air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9337CF3E2D364FAFA5D102977EE973BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) labor organizations certified under such section as the exclusive bargaining representative of airway transportation systems specialists and aviation safety inspectors and engineers of the FAA. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43F2918800AB42F9B96F17E769010200" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 222. REVIEW OF OFFICE SPACE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFFFABDE799C542ACBF89C601F230571B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) FAA review <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4ADF5482FB0F4EDABEBFD9619E718F29" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Initiation of review Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall initiate an inventory review of the domestic office footprint of the Department of Transportation.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H178511185242470B94B9676E8D0D4FA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 4 months after completing the review under subsection (a), the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a final report that proposes opportunities to optimize the domestic office footprint of the FAA (and associated costs). In compiling such final report, the Secretary shall describe opportunities for— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF01D73BB84F74ECA9F56A474BF8E6308" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) consolidation of offices within a reasonable distance, as determined by the Senior Real Property Officer of the Department of Transportation, from one another; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11609DC594B54E89B079EA30A9A04510" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the collocation of regional or satellite offices of separate modes of the Department, including the costs and benefits of shared amenities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11EA993347DF43ABABA06C8E343C1466" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the use of coworking spaces instead of permanent offices. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H59A31CB065134D77AF0C906D934D4C72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Domestic office footprint defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">domestic office footprint means buildings, offices, facilities, and other real property rented, owned, or occupied by the FAA or Department— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H83B99DC87DB14D34BF99AF7735407F37" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in which employees report for permanent or temporary duty that are not FAA Airport Traffic Control Towers, Terminal Radar Approach Control Facilities, Air Route Traffic Control Centers, and Combined Control Facilities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H839C4D1668FF46E6BAC910E6B11C0988" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) which are located within the United States.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H678DBA61B9104447BEBB7C77E2F985BE" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 228. COMMERCIAL PREFERENCE Section 40110(d) of title 49, United States Code, is further amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB314E931DA534BE58D55B3A2D43FCE8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">and implement and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">, implement, and periodically update; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H911AFD52B72C408DAD9221712EC16726" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in paragraph (2) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the new acquisition management system developed and implemented and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the acquisition management system developed, implemented, and periodically updated each place it appears; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD88A8646BD714E9081B59898A37C60D5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) in paragraph (3)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7AB6C5FB0B5E42B09B90F558BDC8B3B3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24F7D2AC49D0460FB9482D20BBF60A2B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">new; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55DCF63C9F664FFDB7874E3858DF0990" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">and implemented and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">, implemented, and periodically updated; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D5668D71FD4155B240951F8B1110C4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in subparagraph (B) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Within and all that follows through <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the Administrator and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Administrator; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09950C59BDCE434CBFD7B4B9F97BFD27" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B9D36459300417C8DFD928A1AAE05CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) by inserting after paragraph (3) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H70A54DF568D34328B0C0310B35EBD61D" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12A3B62F7E6F45AB830246A788C06D99" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Commercial products and services In implementing and updating the acquisition management system pursuant to paragraph (1), the Administrator shall, whenever possible— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE479AA31F8794F809EA8107B757C11F8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) describe the requirements with respect to a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services in terms of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF69B6EB48FD4658961C4A3337645C69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) functions to be performed; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3B744F4D4354878BE26641DEEAE3435" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) performance required; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3F1F0E6C68947CCB50E814D6B66B946" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) essential physical and system characteristics; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB39C4F1A2ED4443B9E69B3662ADD86CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) ensure that commercial services or commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, ensure that nondevelopmental items other than commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75D3EC981A1A47299E25DF666CC9140A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide offerors of commercial services, commercial products, and nondevelopmental items other than commercial products an opportunity to compete in any solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE68C1F74069F45EEA6C6F73275AF47F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) revise the procurement policies, practices, and procedures of the Administration to reduce any impediments to the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5A69A36304049239909DA7089D01DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) ensure that any procurement of new equipment takes into account the life cycle, reliability, performance, service support, and costs to guarantee the acquisition of equipment that is of high quality and reliability resulting in greater performance and cost-related benefits; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H536F913356014123881E3437F22EE422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) ensure that procurement officials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDC3F25E02C548EC8E0027DBE502DEA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) acquire commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products to meet the needs of the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E9ECDAB5251429AA40E6C5FDB8860FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) in a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services, state the specifications for such supplies or services in terms that enable and encourage bidders and offerors to supply commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, to supply nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF1CB7835BDC4B76A0917B30BD5C5F9F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) require that prime contractors and subcontractors at all levels under contracts with the Administration incorporate commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products as components of items supplied to the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H434F4E26849943E996266F7C47474DF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) modify procurement requirements in appropriate circumstances to ensure that such requirements can be met by commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDE0FBCF44D54972AB24871D8A7EA0B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) require training of appropriate personnel in the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services. .

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB2FC9933C95B42D9A16286A7219CBF6B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Remaining recommendations The Administrator shall implement recommendations 1 through 5 and 8 through 12 as set forth in the Government Accountability Office report described in paragraph (1) and, to the extent that rulemaking is necessary to implement such recommendations, issue a notice of proposed rulemaking pursuant to the rulemaking authority of the FAA, on the earlier of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB0330F84EA24125A3CB407339C69253" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date that is 90 days after the date on which the FAA implements the Civil Aviation Registry Electronic Services system; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3F1BDD7AEAC14117A1EBF86F0E94C1E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) January 1, 2026. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H31C02D6D2A90461E82464D5A3F53501F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Reports <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13C1CA5A8BD74C9FB8A850A9AA4D8CE5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Priority recommendations Not later than 60 days after the date on which the Administrator implements the recommendations under subsection (a)(1), the Administrator shall submit to the Committees on the Judiciary and Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committees on the Judiciary and Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives, and the Caucus on International Narcotics Control of the Senate a report on such implementation, including a description of any steps taken by the Administrator to complete such implementation. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4487703E99EC466282BB0A39C012CFDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Remaining recommendations Not later than 60 days after the date on which the Administrator implements the recommendations under subsection (a)(2), the Administrator shall submit to the Committees on the Judiciary and Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committees on the Judiciary and Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives, and the Caucus on International Narcotics Control of the Senate a report on such implementation, including a description of any steps taken by the Administrator to complete such implementation.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDE4301E0F4C44D093A5101C6809D42F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 311. USE OF ADVANCED TOOLS AND HIGH-RISK FLIGHT TESTING IN CERTIFYING AEROSPACE PRODUCTS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7D0D6465C40443D493B00D74DD8F10F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Assessment Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall complete an assessment of the use of advanced tools during the testing, analysis, and verification stages of aerospace certification projects to reduce the risks associated with high-risk flight profiles and performing limit testing. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDA6787744D8D4B4BAB7B8EB5FF7B289A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Considerations In carrying out the assessment under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consider— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C168E3ED82A400D8959C5D4ADD68A44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) instances in which high-risk flight profiles and limit testing have occurred in the certification process and the applicability of the data produced by such testing for use in other aspects of flight testing; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE0461B4433FA47B1AD416DB8AB8E16A8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the safety of pilots during such testing; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48604548B5CD45439006A1600F464A9B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the value and accuracy of data collected using the advanced tools described in subsection (a); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6B9C13DFB7CD4BE1823C1222A2617A2D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the ability to produce more extensive data sets using such advanced tools; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD21175B4758F44D3998737E0E40F04B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) any aspects of such testing for which the use of such advanced tools would not be valuable or applicable; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H64A64A6D5CA1499D9CCCB4FF562635B3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) the cost of using such advanced tools; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBE6C777A0E1C42ADBA4456DA31A332C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) the best practices of other international civil aviation authorities that permit the use of advanced tools during aerospace certification projects.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H95BA8DA81EA845E1A855C705747DBCE5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) $13,055,000,000 for fiscal year 2025; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H053FBFE9B63648EC998176415BC8D06F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) $13,354,000,000 for fiscal year 2026; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02AA05AC3B99465AB30F3741EBC9CD70" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) $13,650,000,000 for fiscal year 2027; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA79755BD9EE64058804979CA0B7C529D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) $13,954,000,000 for fiscal year 2028. . <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC9FB89FCC784DF7B87C5015A8326A8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Authorized expenditures Section 106(k)(2)(D) of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45899468D8CC4558A4FD8080FE01A82C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by striking clauses (i) through (v); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6253089E7B3243A0A3CCDD7C16EC5D6D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by redesignating clause (vi) as clause (i); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H91D2E7D0574246DEA8EB361AD83E6B4A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H684A2DBB93424ADD8D1964742A5EC0DB" style="OLC"> <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19AD72469B5A42BFB25F8D06ED4FC5E9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) $42,018,000 for fiscal year 2024.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45ECB5D179AE44E8B394340F55B14DC9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Action plan The Administrator shall develop and transmit to the appropriate committees of Congress an action plan to implement, as appropriate, the recommendations developed by the review team. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H105B874354924DF3907BBE6FE6B6379B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Deadlines The requirements of this section shall be subject to the following deadlines: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0F056B5C3E4420A93A23E0D573F28EF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this section, the review team shall complete the evaluation required under paragraph (1) and submit to the Administrator the report of the review team on such evaluation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF07AEF7E1641436F8416C6D6031D67B0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Not later than 30 days after the date on which the review team submits the report under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall develop and publish the action plan under paragraph (4).

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8BECAA315CB5411AB5C55368FB512579" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) The additional amount of funds recommended in connection with such objective. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4439A74E5D274CAE9E55E15B7AF4A275" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) The Budget Line Item Program and Budget Line Item number associated with such unfunded capital investment need, as applicable. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F0EEC2BC0F436496FA33DC3FA05049" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) Any statutory requirement associated with such unfunded capital investment need, as applicable.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8238422F516B479A9425F60D550E21D9" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 216. PEER REVIEW OF OFFICE OF WHISTLEBLOWER PROTECTION AND AVIATION SAFETY INVESTIGATIONS Section 106(t) of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2DDB27A3FC6F4B4BB948714A8B3763E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by striking paragraph (7); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD87F371BE8A94394ACA0D4FC651DDA69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by inserting after paragraph (6) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H1A1D0DECB211431CA80DCF1509A36A4D" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2E78903346DE44C6A9F9F0F84E5595E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Department of Transportation Office of the Inspector General peer review <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H980676F0EA694F49982CA60FF505A891" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, and every 5 years thereafter, the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall perform a peer review of the Office of Whistleblower Protection and Aviation Safety Investigations. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD33DFA790514A7A8E53D32B25C11CEF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Peer review scope In completing the peer reviews required under this paragraph, the inspector general shall, to the extent appropriate, use the most recent peer review guides published by the Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency Audit Committee and Investigations Committee.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD33DFA790514A7A8E53D32B25C11CEF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Peer review scope In completing the peer reviews required under this paragraph, the inspector general shall, to the extent appropriate, use the most recent peer review guides published by the Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency Audit Committee and Investigations Committee. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6BEBD057F9D47FD956AAA3B57B49097" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Reports to congress Not later than 90 days after the completion of a peer review required under this paragraph, the inspector general shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a description of any actions taken or to be taken to address the results of the peer review. ; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2A91280B374C41DEBDE7BCFD07384A19" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) in paragraph (8)(B) by striking the comma.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1EABBE302C449ABB69172C9B46A45D3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Completion of review Not later than 30 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall complete the inventory review required under paragraph (1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC090106A4E214E8F8E794B3EFAE88282" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Contents of review In completing the review under subsection (a), the Secretary shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE49B9D38A0954C8484A1DA1854CD7204" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) delineate the domestic office footprint, as determined appropriate by the Secretary; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB14636635D8E46A1B133401DB7FA6C05" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) determine space adequacy related to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF0E5B0F8CCB4D7BB5C84784B5889741" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Architectural Barriers Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 4151 et seq.)

In compiling such final report, the Secretary shall describe opportunities for— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF01D73BB84F74ECA9F56A474BF8E6308" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) consolidation of offices within a reasonable distance, as determined by the Senior Real Property Officer of the Department of Transportation, from one another; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11609DC594B54E89B079EA30A9A04510" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the collocation of regional or satellite offices of separate modes of the Department, including the costs and benefits of shared amenities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11EA993347DF43ABABA06C8E343C1466" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the use of coworking spaces instead of permanent offices. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H59A31CB065134D77AF0C906D934D4C72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Domestic office footprint defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">domestic office footprint means buildings, offices, facilities, and other real property rented, owned, or occupied by the FAA or Department— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H83B99DC87DB14D34BF99AF7735407F37" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in which employees report for permanent or temporary duty that are not FAA Airport Traffic Control Towers, Terminal Radar Approach Control Facilities, Air Route Traffic Control Centers, and Combined Control Facilities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H839C4D1668FF46E6BAC910E6B11C0988" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) which are located within the United States. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7938B151E9B54C909E6A9D67E88409EC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 223.

RESTORATION OF AUTHORITY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46D103F488CB418CACC18566F0873C32" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Chapter 401 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 40118 the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H3A8522C9FE554F2B8911F7C94D2744D3" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF6F18ABBC7F4FBE904CAC17EFF639C4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 40119. SENSITIVE SECURITY INFORMATION <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5EA13201AF2E444C88F3286BF95C10A1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Disclosure <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9FD7E7F4D5784289BC1CC3CCA99C2D2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Regulations prohibiting disclosure Notwithstanding the establishment of a Department of Homeland Security, the Secretary of Transportation, in accordance with section 552(b)(3)(B) of title 5, shall prescribe regulations prohibiting disclosure of information obtained or developed in ensuring security under this title if the Secretary of Transportation decides disclosing the information would— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3EABB91A54C408D82F59473A042CD5D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) be an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H511D8FB9F535441DB1A8416CB2CB8844" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reveal a trade secret or privileged or confidential commercial or financial information; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEE7762280674425C80AEFEB566E6CBC1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) be detrimental to transportation safety. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2BAB4B814EB64057B4ADFB988E44CC54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Disclosure to congress Paragraph (1) shall not be construed to authorize information to be withheld from a committee of Congress authorized to have such information.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2BAB4B814EB64057B4ADFB988E44CC54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Disclosure to congress Paragraph (1) shall not be construed to authorize information to be withheld from a committee of Congress authorized to have such information. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55E5AF307FE84A7588CE7295E13FCF7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Rule of construction Nothing in paragraph (1) shall be construed to authorize the designation of information as sensitive security information (as such term is defined in section 15.5 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations) to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2752B1EA2E7C4B2C991AB63728338EF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conceal a violation of law, inefficiency, or administrative error; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0FD2518FE14E4E93B7FA18037337D29F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) prevent embarrassment to a person, organization, or agency; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2C6AA63C822049CC8FA4F971D778DB6E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) restrain competition; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE8E8B7449977415E8D187402948BC84A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) prevent or delay the release of information that does not require protection in the interest of transportation security, including basic scientific research information not clearly related to transportation security. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04CEA0406D64427AA780B1BECA1A90A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Law enforcement disclosure Section 552a of title 5 shall not apply to disclosures that the Administrator may make from the systems of records of the Federal Aviation Administration to any Federal law enforcement, intelligence, protective service, immigration, or national security official in order to assist the official receiving the information in the performance of official duties.

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79BD5D01A19044269B4721BEB66D60C4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Effective date The amendments made by this section shall be effective as of October 5, 2018, and all authority restored to the Secretary and the FAA under this section shall be treated as if such authority had never been repealed by the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H757E762CDBC0441193783ACFCFEE3CBF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Conforming amendment The analysis for chapter 401 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 40118 the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HF49FC7BC5FFF4607872C10394BA86534" style="OLC"> 40119.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0CAEA5E64BD44D09812D22A3F145297A" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 224. FAA PARTICIPATION IN INDUSTRY STANDARDS ORGANIZATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78961843C9344229AECD8ECA5A1800DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator shall encourage the participation of employees of the FAA, as appropriate, in the activities of recognized industry standards organizations to advance the adoption, reference, and acceptance rate of standards and means of compliance developed by such organizations by the Administrator. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H986205D181754E038AFA1E10E436395D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Participation An employee of the FAA directed by the Administrator to participate in a working group, task group, committee, or similar body of a recognized industry standards organization shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46CBB9C7D7004CB2AD21EF5583050F0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) actively participate in the discussions and work of such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H304F4223EE51404FBC85910F2A703D12" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) accurately represent the position of the Administrator on the subject matter of such discussions and work; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96405EF22BC6450B8823981DAD87CED5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) contribute to the development of work products of such organization, unless determined to be inappropriate by such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E55A864BE7D4F99A9B81B4410A19ACF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) make reasonable efforts to identify and make any concerns of the Administrator relating to such work products known to such organization, including through providing formal comments, as may be allowed for under the procedures of such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49EA1BAFD08F4A03BD24B265BC77DAF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) provide regular updates to other FAA employees and management on the progress of such work products; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8A82205B2361430EBCC0FC65F323930F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) seek advice and input from other FAA employees and management, as needed.

. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E25B840BAAE4648A1C521B6602076A7" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 229. ADVANCED AVIATION TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION STEERING COMMITTEE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD30F76420EF74CE398E741AF9C029D7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an Advanced Aviation Technology and Innovation Steering Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Steering Committee) to assist the FAA in planning for and integrating advanced aviation technologies.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E25B840BAAE4648A1C521B6602076A7" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 229. ADVANCED AVIATION TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION STEERING COMMITTEE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD30F76420EF74CE398E741AF9C029D7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an Advanced Aviation Technology and Innovation Steering Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Steering Committee) to assist the FAA in planning for and integrating advanced aviation technologies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE76F6CDBCAF04E32815D9B0FEBEBDDEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Purpose The Steering Committee shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H187DA3B67F5546C5906E6C439CBCD5C0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) create and regularly update a comprehensive strategy and action plan for integrating advanced aviation technologies into the national airspace system and aviation ecosystem; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12C5D8FB9C394111A4D99ECE9AC2EAFF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) provide direction and resolution for complex issues related to advanced aviation technologies that span multiple offices or lines of business of the FAA, as needed.

ADVANCED AVIATION TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION STEERING COMMITTEE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD30F76420EF74CE398E741AF9C029D7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an Advanced Aviation Technology and Innovation Steering Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Steering Committee) to assist the FAA in planning for and integrating advanced aviation technologies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE76F6CDBCAF04E32815D9B0FEBEBDDEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Purpose The Steering Committee shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H187DA3B67F5546C5906E6C439CBCD5C0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) create and regularly update a comprehensive strategy and action plan for integrating advanced aviation technologies into the national airspace system and aviation ecosystem; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12C5D8FB9C394111A4D99ECE9AC2EAFF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) provide direction and resolution for complex issues related to advanced aviation technologies that span multiple offices or lines of business of the FAA, as needed. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00B9C0982FD44BB28B5C797F4483E77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Chair The Deputy Administrator of the FAA shall serve as the Chair of the Steering Committee.

ADVANCED AVIATION TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION STEERING COMMITTEE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD30F76420EF74CE398E741AF9C029D7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an Advanced Aviation Technology and Innovation Steering Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Steering Committee) to assist the FAA in planning for and integrating advanced aviation technologies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE76F6CDBCAF04E32815D9B0FEBEBDDEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Purpose The Steering Committee shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H187DA3B67F5546C5906E6C439CBCD5C0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) create and regularly update a comprehensive strategy and action plan for integrating advanced aviation technologies into the national airspace system and aviation ecosystem; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12C5D8FB9C394111A4D99ECE9AC2EAFF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) provide direction and resolution for complex issues related to advanced aviation technologies that span multiple offices or lines of business of the FAA, as needed. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00B9C0982FD44BB28B5C797F4483E77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Chair The Deputy Administrator of the FAA shall serve as the Chair of the Steering Committee.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3116208CD0784FF2B5F17B485976D83C" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 307. CONTINUED OVERSIGHT OF FAA COMPLIANCE PROGRAM Section 122 of the Aircraft Certification, Safety, and Accountability Act (Public Law 116–260) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H669C74FC1A314D39962BA2A71E305D7B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in subsection (b) by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H1B9F9164C1FE4B2191FD4D211A6206D9" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF1428D4419914C4C8FC6D6811048E895" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) conduct an annual agency-wide evaluation of the Compliance Program through fiscal year 2028 to assess the functioning and effectiveness of such program and to assess— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD1B83226CF34007822D41068FD4E32A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the need for long-term metrics that, to the maximum extent practicable, apply to all program offices, and use such metrics to assess the effectiveness of the program; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9601D64242CC4A21A6A970ED9F646202" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) if the program ensures the highest level of compliance with safety standards; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12B92B671F9F46EFB357D2D78C92EC43" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) if the program has met its stated safety goals and purpose; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H570EFEB85A1B42B59EF0083EDAAC33AD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) FAA employee confidence in the program. ; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9CDCBB31EF3740DAB8D3773F4728F8D4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in subsection (c)(4) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">2023 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">2028; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAEF768B698254F0A9520A34077166DA8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) in subsection (d) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">2023 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">2028.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3116208CD0784FF2B5F17B485976D83C" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 307. CONTINUED OVERSIGHT OF FAA COMPLIANCE PROGRAM Section 122 of the Aircraft Certification, Safety, and Accountability Act (Public Law 116–260) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H669C74FC1A314D39962BA2A71E305D7B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in subsection (b) by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H1B9F9164C1FE4B2191FD4D211A6206D9" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF1428D4419914C4C8FC6D6811048E895" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) conduct an annual agency-wide evaluation of the Compliance Program through fiscal year 2028 to assess the functioning and effectiveness of such program and to assess— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD1B83226CF34007822D41068FD4E32A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the need for long-term metrics that, to the maximum extent practicable, apply to all program offices, and use such metrics to assess the effectiveness of the program; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9601D64242CC4A21A6A970ED9F646202" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) if the program ensures the highest level of compliance with safety standards; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12B92B671F9F46EFB357D2D78C92EC43" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) if the program has met its stated safety goals and purpose; SCALABILITY OF SAFETY MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS In conducting any rulemaking to require, or implementing a regulation requiring, a safety management system, the Administrator shall consider the scalability of such safety management system requirements, to the full range of entities in terms of size or complexity that may be affected by such rulemaking or regulation, including— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90A8181FB3FA4E30B10A5F76A0308C18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) how an entity can demonstrate compliance using various documentation, tools, and methods, including, as appropriate, systems with multiple small operators collectively monitoring for and addressing risks; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H70BD14E941DB496CB53EDDD09900A28A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a review of traditional safety management techniques and the suitability of such techniques for small entities; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAFD9F22FB9294FCD8452DB0CE131FECC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the applicability of existing safety management system programs implemented by an entity; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD044957343154FD5B74EAE6D14F7CB8B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the suitability of existing requirements under part 5 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, for small entities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5099280596034BB6B8826801C6E14170" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) other unique challenges relating to small entities the Administrator determines appropriate to consider. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H178D4F98AC424F54A3E755655C1CF3C9" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 309. FAA LEADERSHIP Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A6DC6D9F4CC4F83881DE89BF00225E4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in subsection (a) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Federal and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> In general.—The Federal; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED59564A367448C8A779661A6A226D5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8EBA29800FFD496998192C64E0C68B8E" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCADD28EA98764509AB61E5C294400236" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Administration leadership <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H050221B56999403A8217E6BCD8AA9B18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Administrator <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08E8511A4807408FB720B1A801D49DE8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The head of the Administration is the Administrator, who shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDB16542E5B649CCB259AE45AC18BD32" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Qualifications The Administrator shall— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9792E0575D0C47AA919ECF544CA48E37" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) be a citizen of the United States; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD9293BBB91384D819B5EDE73B8A1554B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not be an active duty member of the Armed Forces; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7483CB604B314E7C9BC23D2AEF61B707" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) not have retired from the Armed Forces within the 7 years preceding nomination; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC03069DAD8894659A9E6D105F5CCCFE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCE7CE5A6D26B475EA4054E5BF57D4708" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Fitness In appointing an individual as Administrator, the President shall consider the fitness of such individual to carry out efficiently the duties and powers of the office.

; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30239F7F92FD4131A3A2018AD904D907" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in subsection (c) by striking the first sentence and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Service on an agent designated under this section shall be made at the office or usual place of residence of the agent or at the electronic or facsimile address designated by the agent.. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H10C037202EE74ADF9FCCA8FD7D7DCA20" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 220. SAFETY AND EFFICIENCY THROUGH DIGITIZATION OF FAA SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77D4BBCAD2C1475D895B001E54143392" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0D40531819F74D2D914B9C0258F13BDC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) identify, at the discretion of the Administrator, not less than 3 processes of the FAA that result in a certification and require paper-based information exchange between external entities and the FAA or offices within the FAA (such as an aircraft certification, aircraft registration, or airmen certification) or authorization, an exemption, or a letter of authorization; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2F288AF632C44994802AE1B8DA0ED522" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) initiate the digitization of such processes. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBBA622650B6741D8A968D09B1F801382" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Requirements In carrying out the digitization required under subsection (a), the Administrator shall ensure that the digitization of any process allows for— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9676EBB79D68400098B26605C74D9026" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) an applicant to track the application of such applicant throughout the period of submission and review of such application; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB44B3CBAA6964691BCF1B12686CE1B64" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the status of the application to be available upon demand to the applicant, as well as FAA employees responsible for reviewing and making a decision on the application.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7F514BC8778B491DB22403CB09BB4046" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Briefing to Congress Not later than 2 years after the date on which the Administrator initiates the digitization under subsection (a)(2), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the progress of such digitization. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD1B6231DDC1A40AD8B3718DD6A8E82C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definition of digitization In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">digitization means the transition from a predominantly paper-based system to a system centered on the use of a data management system and the internet. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2CB4204E698F4CD59246F7DE13CFB8EB" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 221.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB264BB642D6D414CA25B4A772F9B4C6B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Composition In addition to the Chair, the Steering Committee shall consist of the Assistant or Associate Administrator, or the designee of such Administrator, of each of the following FAA offices: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78C1D70A9CB8449B885361905662ACEB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Office of Aviation Safety. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB112959EE1E54516918397315ECAAB07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Air Traffic Organization. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA243D013CCE5458BA42AE9760F89D320" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Office of Airports.

DEFINITIONS In this Act: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H355C8F9993FD49C991344D10A911A100" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Administrator Unless otherwise specified, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Administrator means the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0B514F4E2A2B419C944DD0559C28DE26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Appropriate committees of Congress The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">appropriate committees of Congress means the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B9E6DD8C3A044C3A0A18DEECFEDA9E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Comptroller General The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Comptroller General means the Comptroller General of the United States.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B9E6DD8C3A044C3A0A18DEECFEDA9E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Comptroller General The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Comptroller General means the Comptroller General of the United States. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55A039BC685B4699864A1EE4781FD4EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) FAA The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">FAA means the Federal Aviation Administration. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0155B99BFB24191A503757DF8950E93" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) NextGen The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">NextGen means the Next Generation Air Transportation System.

and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC03069DAD8894659A9E6D105F5CCCFE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation.
