FAA LEADERSHIP Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A6DC6D9F4CC4F83881DE89BF00225E4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in subsection (a) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Federal and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> In general.—The Federal; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED59564A367448C8A779661A6A226D5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8EBA29800FFD496998192C64E0C68B8E" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCADD28EA98764509AB61E5C294400236" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Administration leadership <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H050221B56999403A8217E6BCD8AA9B18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Administrator <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08E8511A4807408FB720B1A801D49DE8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The head of the Administration is the Administrator, who shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDB16542E5B649CCB259AE45AC18BD32" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Qualifications The Administrator shall— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9792E0575D0C47AA919ECF544CA48E37" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) be a citizen of the United States; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD9293BBB91384D819B5EDE73B8A1554B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not be an active duty member of the Armed Forces; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7483CB604B314E7C9BC23D2AEF61B707" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) not have retired from the Armed Forces within the 7 years preceding nomination; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC03069DAD8894659A9E6D105F5CCCFE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCE7CE5A6D26B475EA4054E5BF57D4708" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Fitness In appointing an individual as Administrator, the President shall consider the fitness of such individual to carry out efficiently the duties and powers of the office.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1239C5F151554E4784B6A2E882E2B41A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) Reporting chain Except as provided in subsection (f) or in other provisions of law, the Administrator reports directly to the Secretary of Transportation. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H279D0DA452BA4611A9A846A36EE88510" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Deputy Administrator <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1CD25C1BFE924AB787B200B4A047104A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The Administrator has a Deputy Administrator, who shall be appointed by the President. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6099CCF3FC249F49EDDCE23488498A5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Qualifications The Deputy Administrator shall— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC2FD6E987A124ABC85939A310478ED69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) be a citizen of the United States; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7DA736C34CFD46B7A835870F6FC24A19" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H279D0DA452BA4611A9A846A36EE88510" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Deputy Administrator <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1CD25C1BFE924AB787B200B4A047104A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The Administrator has a Deputy Administrator, who shall be appointed by the President. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6099CCF3FC249F49EDDCE23488498A5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Qualifications The Deputy Administrator shall— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC2FD6E987A124ABC85939A310478ED69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) be a citizen of the United States; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7DA736C34CFD46B7A835870F6FC24A19" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H603F281CFEAE42719C6B0BBD049BF622" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Fitness In appointing an individual as Deputy Administrator, the President shall consider the fitness of the individual to carry out efficiently the duties and powers of the office, including the duty to act for the Administrator when the Administrator is absent or unable to serve, or when the office of Administrator is vacant.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6099CCF3FC249F49EDDCE23488498A5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Qualifications The Deputy Administrator shall— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC2FD6E987A124ABC85939A310478ED69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) be a citizen of the United States; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7DA736C34CFD46B7A835870F6FC24A19" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H603F281CFEAE42719C6B0BBD049BF622" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Fitness In appointing an individual as Deputy Administrator, the President shall consider the fitness of the individual to carry out efficiently the duties and powers of the office, including the duty to act for the Administrator when the Administrator is absent or unable to serve, or when the office of Administrator is vacant. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H608C867F9EDF48838E08F50B493941C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Reporting chain The Deputy Administrator reports directly to the Administrator.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8B295995708F4CAD945C559ACA376087" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) Duties The Deputy Administrator shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Administrator. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED975EAB84BC49C198C4D40FADAB0C79" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) Compensation <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H58AF39B7FBE84B68925D21B1E22A1187" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Annual rate of basic pay The annual rate of basic pay of the Deputy Administrator shall be set by the Secretary but shall not exceed the annual rate of basic pay payable to the Administrator. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H71182F8C33444ACBB4A23D08B7BF8E48" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Exception A retired regular officer of the Armed Forces serving as the Deputy Administrator is entitled to hold a rank and grade not lower than that held when appointed as the Deputy Administrator and may elect to receive— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA46AB1BC07A24CDAB2D89E618768B2AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) the pay provided for the Deputy Administrator under clause (i); or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5777A7AAAF9942C2A4171E67AA17DB95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the pay and allowances or the retired pay of the military grade held.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED975EAB84BC49C198C4D40FADAB0C79" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) Compensation <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H58AF39B7FBE84B68925D21B1E22A1187" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Annual rate of basic pay The annual rate of basic pay of the Deputy Administrator shall be set by the Secretary but shall not exceed the annual rate of basic pay payable to the Administrator. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H71182F8C33444ACBB4A23D08B7BF8E48" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Exception A retired regular officer of the Armed Forces serving as the Deputy Administrator is entitled to hold a rank and grade not lower than that held when appointed as the Deputy Administrator and may elect to receive— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA46AB1BC07A24CDAB2D89E618768B2AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) the pay provided for the Deputy Administrator under clause (i); or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5777A7AAAF9942C2A4171E67AA17DB95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the pay and allowances or the retired pay of the military grade held. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A49748CD1EC4A11BB62EB80B2CA3C02" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Reimbursement of expenses If the Deputy Administrator elects to receive compensation described in clause (ii)(II), the Administration shall reimburse the appropriate military department from funds available for the expenses of the Administration.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED975EAB84BC49C198C4D40FADAB0C79" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) Compensation <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H58AF39B7FBE84B68925D21B1E22A1187" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Annual rate of basic pay The annual rate of basic pay of the Deputy Administrator shall be set by the Secretary but shall not exceed the annual rate of basic pay payable to the Administrator. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H71182F8C33444ACBB4A23D08B7BF8E48" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Exception A retired regular officer of the Armed Forces serving as the Deputy Administrator is entitled to hold a rank and grade not lower than that held when appointed as the Deputy Administrator and may elect to receive— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA46AB1BC07A24CDAB2D89E618768B2AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) the pay provided for the Deputy Administrator under clause (i); or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5777A7AAAF9942C2A4171E67AA17DB95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the pay and allowances or the retired pay of the military grade held. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A49748CD1EC4A11BB62EB80B2CA3C02" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Reimbursement of expenses If the Deputy Administrator elects to receive compensation described in clause (ii)(II), the Administration shall reimburse the appropriate military department from funds available for the expenses of the Administration.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A49748CD1EC4A11BB62EB80B2CA3C02" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Reimbursement of expenses If the Deputy Administrator elects to receive compensation described in clause (ii)(II), the Administration shall reimburse the appropriate military department from funds available for the expenses of the Administration. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6593673AB0724DE09732F7EF8E792AA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Leadership of the Administration defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">leadership of the Administration means— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8D3027FB496455EA30EED77BC9F661A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Administrator under paragraph (1); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1FED9216255C4651BAAC3B612E215912" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the Deputy Administrator under paragraph (2). .

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2EDE47B9A1304F61AF127798CCEC0CEA" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 202. ASSISTANT ADMINISTRATOR FOR RULEMAKING AND REGULATORY IMPROVEMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F452B6AB1444810948FE3E59BADA4CA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by striking subsections (c) and (d) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCA97F33FE50842889A327D2AF0F81624" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE858B253D9E14C28BDD9B960B478553E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement There is an Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement who shall be appointed by the Administrator and shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7234ABAB3F941DE8CC0E8FD146B7506" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) be responsible for developing and managing the execution of a regulatory agenda for the Administration that meets statutory and Administration deadlines, including by— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24CE8775DFD0488CA6C2F27756750475" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) prioritizing rulemaking projects that are necessary to improve safety; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBE0E21EA1244D09A0B75564E788033D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) establishing the regulatory agenda of the Administration; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD82375A465634BD58D6BC3D505AE43EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) coordinating with offices of the Administration, the Department, and other Federal entities as appropriate to improve timely feedback generation and approvals when required by law; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC6CE4CD564094D6BBFC734D1C6BFB99F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) not delegate overall responsibility for meeting internal timelines and final completion of the regulatory activities of the Administration outside the Office of the Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H42E863EFAA814EAD94F502868E9D8B65" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) on an ongoing basis, review the regulations of the Administration in effect to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2468C94C6A34D228073DEBB34FB5BF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) improve safety; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3CC0E9643EBE43438DEB8CA511356213" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reduce undue regulatory burden; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE9072B71D1CE470F9AB5D5A08F02DD44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) replace prescriptive regulations with performance-based regulations, as appropriate; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9613DF6388AF4D018A2E0809E7591CE1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) prevent duplicative regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1225D7E692D34631B1CFB3AB68DA4EEF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) increase regulatory clarity and transparency whenever possible; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13AE1BAD764B44158D14E275E045783B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) make recommendations for the review of the Administrator under subsection (f)(3)(C)(ii); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E2136A156C4CAEB29A9C05B115BA75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) receive, coordinate, and respond to petitions for rulemaking and for exemption as provided for in subpart A of part 11 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and provide an initial response to a petitioner not later than 30 days after the receipt of such a petition— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6F9DCB13F4E4E75BF39CA1D7D4F6072" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) acknowledging receipt of such petition; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94C3339358884EC0A00E30B21479F842" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) confirming completeness of such petition; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0AD2E2E2B0484FF0AAE17434D6D54186" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) providing an initial indication of the complexity of the request and how such complexity may impact the timeline for adjudication; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B513E6F3D144A258181DD03F277CAF4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) requesting any additional information, as appropriate, that would assist in the consideration of the petition; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD63B673422794FA4A13EEBEA8BE7ADF4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) track the issuance of exemptions and waivers by the Administration to sections of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and establish a methodology by which to determine if it would be more efficient and in the interest of the public to amend a rule to reduce the future need of waivers and exemptions; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H631AEF6F6AF744238468FD77B83E83AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) promulgate regulatory updates as determined more efficient or in the best interest of the public under paragraph (6). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6E6C118475144D58B0D9CB1B856FB0B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) [Reserved].

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2EDE47B9A1304F61AF127798CCEC0CEA" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 202. ASSISTANT ADMINISTRATOR FOR RULEMAKING AND REGULATORY IMPROVEMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F452B6AB1444810948FE3E59BADA4CA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by striking subsections (c) and (d) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCA97F33FE50842889A327D2AF0F81624" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE858B253D9E14C28BDD9B960B478553E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement There is an Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement who shall be appointed by the Administrator and shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7234ABAB3F941DE8CC0E8FD146B7506" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) be responsible for developing and managing the execution of a regulatory agenda for the Administration that meets statutory and Administration deadlines, including by— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24CE8775DFD0488CA6C2F27756750475" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) prioritizing rulemaking projects that are necessary to improve safety; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBE0E21EA1244D09A0B75564E788033D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) establishing the regulatory agenda of the Administration; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD82375A465634BD58D6BC3D505AE43EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) coordinating with offices of the Administration, the Department, and other Federal entities as appropriate to improve timely feedback generation and approvals when required by law; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC6CE4CD564094D6BBFC734D1C6BFB99F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) not delegate overall responsibility for meeting internal timelines and final completion of the regulatory activities of the Administration outside the Office of the Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H42E863EFAA814EAD94F502868E9D8B65" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) on an ongoing basis, review the regulations of the Administration in effect to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2468C94C6A34D228073DEBB34FB5BF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) improve safety; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3CC0E9643EBE43438DEB8CA511356213" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reduce undue regulatory burden; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE9072B71D1CE470F9AB5D5A08F02DD44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) replace prescriptive regulations with performance-based regulations, as appropriate; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9613DF6388AF4D018A2E0809E7591CE1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) prevent duplicative regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1225D7E692D34631B1CFB3AB68DA4EEF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) increase regulatory clarity and transparency whenever possible; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13AE1BAD764B44158D14E275E045783B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) make recommendations for the review of the Administrator under subsection (f)(3)(C)(ii); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E2136A156C4CAEB29A9C05B115BA75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) receive, coordinate, and respond to petitions for rulemaking and for exemption as provided for in subpart A of part 11 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and provide an initial response to a petitioner not later than 30 days after the receipt of such a petition— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6F9DCB13F4E4E75BF39CA1D7D4F6072" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) acknowledging receipt of such petition; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94C3339358884EC0A00E30B21479F842" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) confirming completeness of such petition; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0AD2E2E2B0484FF0AAE17434D6D54186" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) providing an initial indication of the complexity of the request and how such complexity may impact the timeline for adjudication; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B513E6F3D144A258181DD03F277CAF4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) requesting any additional information, as appropriate, that would assist in the consideration of the petition; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD63B673422794FA4A13EEBEA8BE7ADF4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) track the issuance of exemptions and waivers by the Administration to sections of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and establish a methodology by which to determine if it would be more efficient and in the interest of the public to amend a rule to reduce the future need of waivers and exemptions; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H631AEF6F6AF744238468FD77B83E83AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) promulgate regulatory updates as determined more efficient or in the best interest of the public under paragraph (6). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6E6C118475144D58B0D9CB1B856FB0B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) [Reserved].

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD63B673422794FA4A13EEBEA8BE7ADF4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) track the issuance of exemptions and waivers by the Administration to sections of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and establish a methodology by which to determine if it would be more efficient and in the interest of the public to amend a rule to reduce the future need of waivers and exemptions; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H631AEF6F6AF744238468FD77B83E83AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) promulgate regulatory updates as determined more efficient or in the best interest of the public under paragraph (6). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6E6C118475144D58B0D9CB1B856FB0B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) [Reserved].

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2EDE47B9A1304F61AF127798CCEC0CEA" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 202. ASSISTANT ADMINISTRATOR FOR RULEMAKING AND REGULATORY IMPROVEMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F452B6AB1444810948FE3E59BADA4CA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by striking subsections (c) and (d) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCA97F33FE50842889A327D2AF0F81624" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE858B253D9E14C28BDD9B960B478553E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement There is an Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement who shall be appointed by the Administrator and shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7234ABAB3F941DE8CC0E8FD146B7506" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) be responsible for developing and managing the execution of a regulatory agenda for the Administration that meets statutory and Administration deadlines, including by— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24CE8775DFD0488CA6C2F27756750475" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) prioritizing rulemaking projects that are necessary to improve safety; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBE0E21EA1244D09A0B75564E788033D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) establishing the regulatory agenda of the Administration; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD82375A465634BD58D6BC3D505AE43EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) coordinating with offices of the Administration, the Department, and other Federal entities as appropriate to improve timely feedback generation and approvals when required by law; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC6CE4CD564094D6BBFC734D1C6BFB99F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) not delegate overall responsibility for meeting internal timelines and final completion of the regulatory activities of the Administration outside the Office of the Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H42E863EFAA814EAD94F502868E9D8B65" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) on an ongoing basis, review the regulations of the Administration in effect to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2468C94C6A34D228073DEBB34FB5BF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) improve safety; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3CC0E9643EBE43438DEB8CA511356213" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reduce undue regulatory burden; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE9072B71D1CE470F9AB5D5A08F02DD44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) replace prescriptive regulations with performance-based regulations, as appropriate; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9613DF6388AF4D018A2E0809E7591CE1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) prevent duplicative regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1225D7E692D34631B1CFB3AB68DA4EEF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) increase regulatory clarity and transparency whenever possible; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13AE1BAD764B44158D14E275E045783B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) make recommendations for the review of the Administrator under subsection (f)(3)(C)(ii); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E2136A156C4CAEB29A9C05B115BA75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) receive, coordinate, and respond to petitions for rulemaking and for exemption as provided for in subpart A of part 11 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and provide an initial response to a petitioner not later than 30 days after the receipt of such a petition— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6F9DCB13F4E4E75BF39CA1D7D4F6072" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) acknowledging receipt of such petition; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94C3339358884EC0A00E30B21479F842" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) confirming completeness of such petition; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0AD2E2E2B0484FF0AAE17434D6D54186" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) providing an initial indication of the complexity of the request and how such complexity may impact the timeline for adjudication; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B513E6F3D144A258181DD03F277CAF4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) requesting any additional information, as appropriate, that would assist in the consideration of the petition; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD63B673422794FA4A13EEBEA8BE7ADF4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) track the issuance of exemptions and waivers by the Administration to sections of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and establish a methodology by which to determine if it would be more efficient and in the interest of the public to amend a rule to reduce the future need of waivers and exemptions; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H631AEF6F6AF744238468FD77B83E83AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) promulgate regulatory updates as determined more efficient or in the best interest of the public under paragraph (6). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6E6C118475144D58B0D9CB1B856FB0B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) [Reserved].

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3D6425E2C1F74861A2E85FEF4C54F67F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Systemically addressing need for exemptions and waivers Not later than 30 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement of the FAA shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives on the methodology developed pursuant to section 106(c)(6) of title 49, United States Code (as added by this section). <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30E8B82745CB4F0C8F7DF0A3CC977298" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 203.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30E8B82745CB4F0C8F7DF0A3CC977298" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 203. PROHIBITION ON CONFLICTING PECUNIARY INTERESTS Section 106(e) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H6E9E42E152DF4DD688A90ADBAF2D90D9" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF46C5C2B1AA4ACF8DC11275C46CB213" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Prohibition on conflicting pecuniary interests <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF03E7CF8C77647B58B714299F9DAC5BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The leadership of the Administration may not have a pecuniary interest in, or hold a financial interest in, an aeronautical enterprise or engage in another business, vocation, or employment. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBB93036F12E401C90EE127D3570955F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Teaching Notwithstanding paragraph (1), the Deputy Administrator may not receive compensation for teaching without prior approval of the Administrator.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30E8B82745CB4F0C8F7DF0A3CC977298" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 203. PROHIBITION ON CONFLICTING PECUNIARY INTERESTS Section 106(e) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H6E9E42E152DF4DD688A90ADBAF2D90D9" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF46C5C2B1AA4ACF8DC11275C46CB213" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Prohibition on conflicting pecuniary interests <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF03E7CF8C77647B58B714299F9DAC5BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The leadership of the Administration may not have a pecuniary interest in, or hold a financial interest in, an aeronautical enterprise or engage in another business, vocation, or employment. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBB93036F12E401C90EE127D3570955F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Teaching Notwithstanding paragraph (1), the Deputy Administrator may not receive compensation for teaching without prior approval of the Administrator.

PROHIBITION ON CONFLICTING PECUNIARY INTERESTS Section 106(e) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H6E9E42E152DF4DD688A90ADBAF2D90D9" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF46C5C2B1AA4ACF8DC11275C46CB213" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Prohibition on conflicting pecuniary interests <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF03E7CF8C77647B58B714299F9DAC5BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The leadership of the Administration may not have a pecuniary interest in, or hold a financial interest in, an aeronautical enterprise or engage in another business, vocation, or employment. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBB93036F12E401C90EE127D3570955F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Teaching Notwithstanding paragraph (1), the Deputy Administrator may not receive compensation for teaching without prior approval of the Administrator. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79F96C3F1E704F65846D4F6678AF9122" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Financial interest defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">financial interest— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2E74625D545A4BE39C6A121E0737EEDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) means— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CACE108F4AE4C27BC9D81296FD31760" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) any current or contingent ownership, equity, or security interest; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7E793F74DCCE400D9E0B4944578D5959" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) any indebtedness or compensated employment relationship; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB69B673F88B64CE2BC9877F4FBCED967" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) any right to purchase or acquire any such ownership, equity, or security interest, including a stock option; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC4BD847BC325452A9B97DBD0B624E3D5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not include securities held in an index fund.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBB93036F12E401C90EE127D3570955F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Teaching Notwithstanding paragraph (1), the Deputy Administrator may not receive compensation for teaching without prior approval of the Administrator. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79F96C3F1E704F65846D4F6678AF9122" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Financial interest defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">financial interest— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2E74625D545A4BE39C6A121E0737EEDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) means— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CACE108F4AE4C27BC9D81296FD31760" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) any current or contingent ownership, equity, or security interest; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7E793F74DCCE400D9E0B4944578D5959" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) any indebtedness or compensated employment relationship; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB69B673F88B64CE2BC9877F4FBCED967" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) any right to purchase or acquire any such ownership, equity, or security interest, including a stock option; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC4BD847BC325452A9B97DBD0B624E3D5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not include securities held in an index fund. .

and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74A490C5D5F94EE2BAB1255586BF6FB3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) by striking subparagraphs (B) and (C) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H3C17212916014A6597C80D6E7534187D" style="OLC"> <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84CE890E4B68485884961B06E04A9F05" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Approval of Secretary of Transportation <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A426B2E514B4F599D51D77F4F6AB894" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) In general The Administrator may not issue, unless the Secretary of Transportation approves the issuance of the regulation in advance, a proposed regulation or final regulation that— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD20A92FE8F4B4A9DBD21481DACDE0DDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) is likely to result in the expenditure by State, local, and Tribal governments in the aggregate, or by the private sector, of $250,000,000 or more (adjusted annually for inflation beginning with the year following the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024) in any year; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6CF905C46B904E36AB1AED8113195CB3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) is significant. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H47EFA767861E43A1A4AB11A8A162D945" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Significant regulations For purposes of this paragraph, a regulation is significant if the Administrator, in consultation with the Secretary (as appropriate), determines that the regulation— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3811529FE95A4909BD4E3F770F2030C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) will have an annual effect on the economy of $250,000,000 or more (adjusted annually for inflation beginning with the year following the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024); <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE61527A5F57430F84CD39202C9C484E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) raises novel or serious legal or policy issues that will substantially and materially affect other transportation modes; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93E4A55C7B7047D6A99834E7CAA480F0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (III) adversely affects, in a substantial and material way, the economy, a sector of the economy, productivity, competition, jobs, the environment, public health or safety, or a State, local, or Tribal government or community. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4DEAEA21410E4708A111E8CD1519F136" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Emergency regulation <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A37B3C9AE214ED9816C56D49F907434" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) In general In an emergency as determined by the Administrator, the Administrator may issue a final regulation described in clause (i) without prior approval of the Secretary.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4DEAEA21410E4708A111E8CD1519F136" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Emergency regulation <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A37B3C9AE214ED9816C56D49F907434" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) In general In an emergency as determined by the Administrator, the Administrator may issue a final regulation described in clause (i) without prior approval of the Secretary. <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1604E005B93D48E2AD39E814BB337088" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) Objection If the Secretary objects to a regulation issued under subclause (II) in writing not later than 5 days (excluding Saturday, Sundays, and legal public holidays) after the issuance, the Administrator shall immediately rescind such regulation. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE48489BD41F4D2C8BB6B4E333E1C46B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) Other regulations The Secretary may not require that the Administrator submit a proposed or final regulation to the Secretary for approval, nor may the Administrator submit a proposed or final regulation to the Secretary for approval, if the regulation— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0012BD44AF184899A5DC5BC850374953" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) does not require the approval of the Secretary under clause (i) (excluding a regulation issued under clause (iii)); or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE665813A379C4C4D980522CB3276E461" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) is a routine or frequent action or a procedural action.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H460D804DB6C441DBA6BBCA48203FE71E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) Timeline The Administrator shall submit a copy of any proposed or final regulation requiring approval by the Secretary under clause (i) to the Secretary, who shall either approve the regulation or return the regulation to the Administrator with comments not later than 30 days after receiving the regulation. If the Secretary fails to approve or return the regulation with comments to the Administrator not later than 30 days after receiving such regulation, the regulation shall be deemed to have been approved by the Secretary. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA586FCADBC634F63A7E33FD80BF7D5E7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Periodic review <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1D632D860DCB4BFAB405B3BDF1214280" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) In general For any significant regulation issued after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, in addition to the review requirements established under section 5.13(d) of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, the Administrator shall review any significant regulation 3 years after the effective date of such regulation.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDBA317B56FE54CF0BFD313EE8A5979D9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Discretionary review The Administrator may review any regulation that has been in effect for more than 3 years. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA7B792A2E8B45C0BA56F58437504481" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Substance of review In performing a review under clause (i) or (ii), the Administrator shall determine if— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC0469ABE5D7C491FBA2BAB3C7A9D6C06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) the cost assumptions supporting the regulation were accurate; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5C9315B717FE4D0984490687DFB596D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the intended benefit of the regulation is being realized; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCBCA0F2B48CF45AEB51B323B3F2D0217" qb-display-quote="yes"> (III) the need remains to continue such regulation as in effect; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8706A4011E6B48D88770BDA909067949" qb-display-quote="yes"> (IV) the Administrator recommends updates to such regulation based on the review criteria specified in section 5.13(d) of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9BB14008A8B45D3B124FE08BE859979" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) Review management Any periodic review of a regulation under this subparagraph shall be managed by the Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement, who may task an advisory committee or the Management Advisory Council established under subsection (p) to assist in performing the review.

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA917474174D24E17BD84BE0BFF2632D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Conforming amendment Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (g) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HDC6ACDA7AA30440BB89E39FB5487E7E9" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B36A95A786A40568F95BE826E3E493F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) [reserved]. .

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFADCA90B765D43E6AA888107CB6D4C33" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Preservation of existing authority Nothing in this section or the amendments made by this section shall be construed to restrict any authority vested in the Administrator by statute or by delegation that was in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of this Act. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7B284C5EF2894CAC9158A71FCDE7BDCF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 205.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFADCA90B765D43E6AA888107CB6D4C33" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Preservation of existing authority Nothing in this section or the amendments made by this section shall be construed to restrict any authority vested in the Administrator by statute or by delegation that was in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of this Act. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7B284C5EF2894CAC9158A71FCDE7BDCF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 205. REGULATORY MATERIALS IMPROVEMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F090A15861E4C5683A7A620CA6ADBDC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Internal regulatory process review <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6B3C5DFB3B964FEFAA2D602C20BF36ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H87ECAF35EA314C1382EAC8F87919809E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Review team The Administrator shall establish a regulatory process review team (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">review team) comprising of FAA employees and individuals described in paragraph (2) to develop recommendations to improve the timeliness, performance, and accountability of the development and promulgation of regulatory materials.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7B284C5EF2894CAC9158A71FCDE7BDCF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 205. REGULATORY MATERIALS IMPROVEMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F090A15861E4C5683A7A620CA6ADBDC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Internal regulatory process review <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6B3C5DFB3B964FEFAA2D602C20BF36ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H87ECAF35EA314C1382EAC8F87919809E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Review team The Administrator shall establish a regulatory process review team (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">review team) comprising of FAA employees and individuals described in paragraph (2) to develop recommendations to improve the timeliness, performance, and accountability of the development and promulgation of regulatory materials. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF622AA34190045DC9836B48E15F2BE4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Report The review team shall submit to the Administrator a report with recommendations in accordance with the deadlines specified in paragraph (5).

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7B284C5EF2894CAC9158A71FCDE7BDCF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 205. REGULATORY MATERIALS IMPROVEMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F090A15861E4C5683A7A620CA6ADBDC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Internal regulatory process review <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6B3C5DFB3B964FEFAA2D602C20BF36ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H87ECAF35EA314C1382EAC8F87919809E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Review team The Administrator shall establish a regulatory process review team (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">review team) comprising of FAA employees and individuals described in paragraph (2) to develop recommendations to improve the timeliness, performance, and accountability of the development and promulgation of regulatory materials. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF622AA34190045DC9836B48E15F2BE4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Report The review team shall submit to the Administrator a report with recommendations in accordance with the deadlines specified in paragraph (5).

REGULATORY MATERIALS IMPROVEMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F090A15861E4C5683A7A620CA6ADBDC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Internal regulatory process review <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6B3C5DFB3B964FEFAA2D602C20BF36ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H87ECAF35EA314C1382EAC8F87919809E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Review team The Administrator shall establish a regulatory process review team (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">review team) comprising of FAA employees and individuals described in paragraph (2) to develop recommendations to improve the timeliness, performance, and accountability of the development and promulgation of regulatory materials. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF622AA34190045DC9836B48E15F2BE4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Report The review team shall submit to the Administrator a report with recommendations in accordance with the deadlines specified in paragraph (5). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6CC01E1402347AA857981D4C72279D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Other members; consultation <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFBCAA8CBA7D84AAEB2A470AA7CA2DDDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The review team shall include at least 3 outside experts and or academics with relevant experience or expertise in aviation safety and at least 1 outside expert with relevant experience or expertise in improving the performance, accountability, and transparency of the Federal regulatory process, particularly as such process relates to aviation safety.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF622AA34190045DC9836B48E15F2BE4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Report The review team shall submit to the Administrator a report with recommendations in accordance with the deadlines specified in paragraph (5). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6CC01E1402347AA857981D4C72279D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Other members; consultation <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFBCAA8CBA7D84AAEB2A470AA7CA2DDDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The review team shall include at least 3 outside experts and or academics with relevant experience or expertise in aviation safety and at least 1 outside expert with relevant experience or expertise in improving the performance, accountability, and transparency of the Federal regulatory process, particularly as such process relates to aviation safety. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H934223EEDC084CB5BE31D27DAC3DDD8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Consultation The review team may, as appropriate, consult with industry stakeholders.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF622AA34190045DC9836B48E15F2BE4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Report The review team shall submit to the Administrator a report with recommendations in accordance with the deadlines specified in paragraph (5). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6CC01E1402347AA857981D4C72279D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Other members; consultation <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFBCAA8CBA7D84AAEB2A470AA7CA2DDDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The review team shall include at least 3 outside experts and or academics with relevant experience or expertise in aviation safety and at least 1 outside expert with relevant experience or expertise in improving the performance, accountability, and transparency of the Federal regulatory process, particularly as such process relates to aviation safety. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H934223EEDC084CB5BE31D27DAC3DDD8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Consultation The review team may, as appropriate, consult with industry stakeholders.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H934223EEDC084CB5BE31D27DAC3DDD8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Consultation The review team may, as appropriate, consult with industry stakeholders. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5CA39CAC9C2403786C9F83411C9FEBE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Contents of review In conducting the review required under paragraph (1), the review team shall do the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBCF9A40FA4141718CFA71B9AB9B3668" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Develop a proposal for rationalizing processes and eliminating redundant administrative review of regulatory materials within the FAA, particularly when FAA-sponsored rulemaking committees and stakeholders have collaborated on the proposed regulations. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05DEC323439A46649739A838526F3D95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) With respect to each office within the FAA that reviews regulatory materials, assess— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23935AEC51AB4B3491DF48A0E831841E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the timeline assigned to each such office to complete the review of regulatory materials; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBEEDB39A86D74AC4BC9A156A1D3E6336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the actual time spent for such review; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H055808870BAC45FC845B747C4B5EEE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) opportunities to reduce the actual time for such review; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A31E797F9C544C68AC43FE42B157165" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) whether clear roles, responsibilities, requirements, and expectations are clearly defined for each office required to review the regulatory materials.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H934223EEDC084CB5BE31D27DAC3DDD8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Consultation The review team may, as appropriate, consult with industry stakeholders. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5CA39CAC9C2403786C9F83411C9FEBE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Contents of review In conducting the review required under paragraph (1), the review team shall do the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBCF9A40FA4141718CFA71B9AB9B3668" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Develop a proposal for rationalizing processes and eliminating redundant administrative review of regulatory materials within the FAA, particularly when FAA-sponsored rulemaking committees and stakeholders have collaborated on the proposed regulations. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05DEC323439A46649739A838526F3D95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) With respect to each office within the FAA that reviews regulatory materials, assess— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23935AEC51AB4B3491DF48A0E831841E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the timeline assigned to each such office to complete the review of regulatory materials; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBEEDB39A86D74AC4BC9A156A1D3E6336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the actual time spent for such review; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H055808870BAC45FC845B747C4B5EEE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) opportunities to reduce the actual time for such review; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A31E797F9C544C68AC43FE42B157165" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) whether clear roles, responsibilities, requirements, and expectations are clearly defined for each office required to review the regulatory materials.

citations.text: title VIII of division J of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58
citations.context: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5CA39CAC9C2403786C9F83411C9FEBE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Contents of review In conducting the review required under paragraph (1), the review team shall do the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBCF9A40FA4141718CFA71B9AB9B3668" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Develop a proposal for rationalizing processes and eliminating redundant administrative review of regulatory materials within the FAA, particularly when FAA-sponsored rulemaking committees and stakeholders have collaborated on the proposed regulations. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05DEC323439A46649739A838526F3D95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) With respect to each office within the FAA that reviews regulatory materials, assess— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23935AEC51AB4B3491DF48A0E831841E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the timeline assigned to each such office to complete the review of regulatory materials; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBEEDB39A86D74AC4BC9A156A1D3E6336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the actual time spent for such review; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H055808870BAC45FC845B747C4B5EEE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) opportunities to reduce the actual time for such review; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A31E797F9C544C68AC43FE42B157165" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) whether clear roles, responsibilities, requirements, and expectations are clearly defined for each office required to review the regulatory materials. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCFB857761844CE19C5644FC378B1D3E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Define and document the roles and responsibilities of each office within the FAA that develops, drafts, or reviews each kind of regulatory material in order to ensure that hiring reflects who, where, and how the employees of each such office function in the rulemaking framework.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCFB857761844CE19C5644FC378B1D3E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Define and document the roles and responsibilities of each office within the FAA that develops, drafts, or reviews each kind of regulatory material in order to ensure that hiring reflects who, where, and how the employees of each such office function in the rulemaking framework. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB1DF63542C14423B15B5154EF2F2D44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Describe any organizational changes or the need to hire additional FAA employees, if necessary, and take into consideration whether current positions are staffed, to reduce delays in publication of regulatory materials. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A96235246FD4F1B8E5A3EA4A5C1481C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) In order to provide the public with detailed information on the progress of the development of regulatory materials, identify reporting mechanisms and develop a template and appropriate system metrics for making publicly available on a website a progress tracker that updates to show the major stages (as determined by the Administrator) of the development of regulatory materials as such materials are initiated, in progress, and completed.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6BB9248B840437888F28A349CF60103" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) Consider changes to the best practices of the FAA under rules governing ex parte communications, including communications with international validating authorities, and with consideration of the public interest in transparency, to provide flexibility for FAA employees to discuss regulatory materials, particularly for such regulatory materials related to enhancing aviation safety and the aviation international leadership of the United States. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H837E496FA17A4EA8965327CD01622BE6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) Recommend methods by which the FAA can incorporate research funded by the Department of Transportation, in addition to consensus standards and conformance assessment processes developed by recognized industry standards organizations into regulatory materials, to keep pace with rapid changes in aviation technologies and processes. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H657BCAE3E56748C58727FAC58F7C8792" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) Recommend mechanisms to optimize the roles of the Office of the Secretary of Transportation and the Office of Management and Budget, with the objective of improving the efficiency of regulatory activity.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H837E496FA17A4EA8965327CD01622BE6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) Recommend methods by which the FAA can incorporate research funded by the Department of Transportation, in addition to consensus standards and conformance assessment processes developed by recognized industry standards organizations into regulatory materials, to keep pace with rapid changes in aviation technologies and processes. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H657BCAE3E56748C58727FAC58F7C8792" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) Recommend mechanisms to optimize the roles of the Office of the Secretary of Transportation and the Office of Management and Budget, with the objective of improving the efficiency of regulatory activity. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45ECB5D179AE44E8B394340F55B14DC9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Action plan The Administrator shall develop and transmit to the appropriate committees of Congress an action plan to implement, as appropriate, the recommendations developed by the review team.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45ECB5D179AE44E8B394340F55B14DC9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Action plan The Administrator shall develop and transmit to the appropriate committees of Congress an action plan to implement, as appropriate, the recommendations developed by the review team. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H105B874354924DF3907BBE6FE6B6379B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Deadlines The requirements of this section shall be subject to the following deadlines: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0F056B5C3E4420A93A23E0D573F28EF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this section, the review team shall complete the evaluation required under paragraph (1) and submit to the Administrator the report of the review team on such evaluation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF07AEF7E1641436F8416C6D6031D67B0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Not later than 30 days after the date on which the review team submits the report under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall develop and publish the action plan under paragraph (4).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H105B874354924DF3907BBE6FE6B6379B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Deadlines The requirements of this section shall be subject to the following deadlines: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0F056B5C3E4420A93A23E0D573F28EF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this section, the review team shall complete the evaluation required under paragraph (1) and submit to the Administrator the report of the review team on such evaluation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF07AEF7E1641436F8416C6D6031D67B0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Not later than 30 days after the date on which the review team submits the report under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall develop and publish the action plan under paragraph (4). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H15CD8F9FD41B4E79AD1568188943C17D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Sunset The review team shall terminate upon completion of the requirements under paragraph (5).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H105B874354924DF3907BBE6FE6B6379B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Deadlines The requirements of this section shall be subject to the following deadlines: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0F056B5C3E4420A93A23E0D573F28EF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this section, the review team shall complete the evaluation required under paragraph (1) and submit to the Administrator the report of the review team on such evaluation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF07AEF7E1641436F8416C6D6031D67B0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Not later than 30 days after the date on which the review team submits the report under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall develop and publish the action plan under paragraph (4). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H15CD8F9FD41B4E79AD1568188943C17D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Sunset The review team shall terminate upon completion of the requirements under paragraph (5).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF07AEF7E1641436F8416C6D6031D67B0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Not later than 30 days after the date on which the review team submits the report under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall develop and publish the action plan under paragraph (4). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H15CD8F9FD41B4E79AD1568188943C17D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Sunset The review team shall terminate upon completion of the requirements under paragraph (5). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C7570166911475298ACC7D890030440" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Administrative procedure requirements inapplicable The provisions of subchapter II of chapter 5, and chapter 7, of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Administrative Procedure Act) shall not apply to any activities of the review team in carrying out the requirements of this section.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H15CD8F9FD41B4E79AD1568188943C17D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Sunset The review team shall terminate upon completion of the requirements under paragraph (5). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C7570166911475298ACC7D890030440" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Administrative procedure requirements inapplicable The provisions of subchapter II of chapter 5, and chapter 7, of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Administrative Procedure Act) shall not apply to any activities of the review team in carrying out the requirements of this section. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2839A224237D4A409993480B24EA1BAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) Regulatory materials defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">regulatory materials means rules, advisory circulars, statements of policy, and other materials related to aviation safety regulations, as well as other materials pertaining to training and operation of aeronautical products.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H15CD8F9FD41B4E79AD1568188943C17D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Sunset The review team shall terminate upon completion of the requirements under paragraph (5). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C7570166911475298ACC7D890030440" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Administrative procedure requirements inapplicable The provisions of subchapter II of chapter 5, and chapter 7, of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Administrative Procedure Act) shall not apply to any activities of the review team in carrying out the requirements of this section. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2839A224237D4A409993480B24EA1BAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) Regulatory materials defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">regulatory materials means rules, advisory circulars, statements of policy, and other materials related to aviation safety regulations, as well as other materials pertaining to training and operation of aeronautical products.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C7570166911475298ACC7D890030440" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Administrative procedure requirements inapplicable The provisions of subchapter II of chapter 5, and chapter 7, of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Administrative Procedure Act) shall not apply to any activities of the review team in carrying out the requirements of this section. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2839A224237D4A409993480B24EA1BAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) Regulatory materials defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">regulatory materials means rules, advisory circulars, statements of policy, and other materials related to aviation safety regulations, as well as other materials pertaining to training and operation of aeronautical products. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE407C4CC3FC4214A9A0484F71A73ADA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Review of non-regulatory materials <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D2D93CA80B4BDD8B45326E6CC2B4E7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall review the coordination and approval processes of non-regulatory materials produced by the FAA to improve the timeliness, transparency, development, and issuance of such materials.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C7570166911475298ACC7D890030440" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Administrative procedure requirements inapplicable The provisions of subchapter II of chapter 5, and chapter 7, of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Administrative Procedure Act) shall not apply to any activities of the review team in carrying out the requirements of this section. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2839A224237D4A409993480B24EA1BAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) Regulatory materials defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">regulatory materials means rules, advisory circulars, statements of policy, and other materials related to aviation safety regulations, as well as other materials pertaining to training and operation of aeronautical products. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE407C4CC3FC4214A9A0484F71A73ADA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Review of non-regulatory materials <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D2D93CA80B4BDD8B45326E6CC2B4E7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall review the coordination and approval processes of non-regulatory materials produced by the FAA to improve the timeliness, transparency, development, and issuance of such materials.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2839A224237D4A409993480B24EA1BAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) Regulatory materials defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">regulatory materials means rules, advisory circulars, statements of policy, and other materials related to aviation safety regulations, as well as other materials pertaining to training and operation of aeronautical products. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE407C4CC3FC4214A9A0484F71A73ADA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Review of non-regulatory materials <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D2D93CA80B4BDD8B45326E6CC2B4E7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall review the coordination and approval processes of non-regulatory materials produced by the FAA to improve the timeliness, transparency, development, and issuance of such materials. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2C148871C18402493DB830AE322932A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Contents of review In conducting the review under paragraph (1), the inspector general shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84132688DF5445F7915CBFE43BEB2800" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) provide recommendations for improving processes and eliminating non-value-added reviews of non-regulatory materials within the FAA and Department of Transportation, in consideration of the authority of the Administrator under section 106 of title 49, United States Code, and other applicable laws; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A93399121884B54A84001AF35FF4F1D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) consider, with respect to each office within the FAA and the Department of Transportation that reviews non-regulatory materials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H27652362E83D4681A0F0292D2CBCBC5C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the timeline assigned to each such office to complete the review of such materials; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB118C9108CB046A59CCD4632E1B50D9C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the actual time spent for such review; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE22FACA303004F1381999A110479778A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) opportunities to reduce the actual time spent for such review; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E83999C9D8B45A4B316C81060C88314" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) describe any organizational changes and additional resources that the Administrator needs, if necessary, to reduce delays in the development and publication of proposed non-regulatory materials; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6874EA5877FE4996AF7444312F2AE18C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) consider to what extent reporting mechanisms and templates could be used to provide the public with more consistent information on the development status of non-regulatory materials; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE3CBAEF1210543A3B5E30465A592794C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) consider changes to the application of rules governing ex parte communications by the Administrator to provide flexibility for employees of the FAA to discuss non-regulatory materials with aviation stakeholders and foreign aviation authorities to promote United States aviation leadership; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DA78787AE4045138BE554CCE5900896" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) recommend methods by which the Administrator can incorporate standards set by recognized industry standards organizations, as such term is defined in section 224(c), into non-regulatory materials to keep pace with rapid changes in aerospace technology and processes; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H71DBAC7F4684460BA392143F38ED4428" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) evaluate the processes and best practices other civil aviation authorities and other Federal departments and agencies use to produce non-regulatory materials, particularly the processes of entities that produce such materials in an expedited fashion to respond to safety risks, incidents, or new technology adoption.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2839A224237D4A409993480B24EA1BAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) Regulatory materials defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">regulatory materials means rules, advisory circulars, statements of policy, and other materials related to aviation safety regulations, as well as other materials pertaining to training and operation of aeronautical products. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE407C4CC3FC4214A9A0484F71A73ADA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Review of non-regulatory materials <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D2D93CA80B4BDD8B45326E6CC2B4E7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall review the coordination and approval processes of non-regulatory materials produced by the FAA to improve the timeliness, transparency, development, and issuance of such materials. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2C148871C18402493DB830AE322932A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Contents of review In conducting the review under paragraph (1), the inspector general shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84132688DF5445F7915CBFE43BEB2800" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) provide recommendations for improving processes and eliminating non-value-added reviews of non-regulatory materials within the FAA and Department of Transportation, in consideration of the authority of the Administrator under section 106 of title 49, United States Code, and other applicable laws; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A93399121884B54A84001AF35FF4F1D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) consider, with respect to each office within the FAA and the Department of Transportation that reviews non-regulatory materials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H27652362E83D4681A0F0292D2CBCBC5C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the timeline assigned to each such office to complete the review of such materials; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB118C9108CB046A59CCD4632E1B50D9C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the actual time spent for such review; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE22FACA303004F1381999A110479778A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) opportunities to reduce the actual time spent for such review; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E83999C9D8B45A4B316C81060C88314" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) describe any organizational changes and additional resources that the Administrator needs, if necessary, to reduce delays in the development and publication of proposed non-regulatory materials; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6874EA5877FE4996AF7444312F2AE18C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) consider to what extent reporting mechanisms and templates could be used to provide the public with more consistent information on the development status of non-regulatory materials; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE3CBAEF1210543A3B5E30465A592794C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) consider changes to the application of rules governing ex parte communications by the Administrator to provide flexibility for employees of the FAA to discuss non-regulatory materials with aviation stakeholders and foreign aviation authorities to promote United States aviation leadership; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DA78787AE4045138BE554CCE5900896" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) recommend methods by which the Administrator can incorporate standards set by recognized industry standards organizations, as such term is defined in section 224(c), into non-regulatory materials to keep pace with rapid changes in aerospace technology and processes; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H71DBAC7F4684460BA392143F38ED4428" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) evaluate the processes and best practices other civil aviation authorities and other Federal departments and agencies use to produce non-regulatory materials, particularly the processes of entities that produce such materials in an expedited fashion to respond to safety risks, incidents, or new technology adoption.
