<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE407C4CC3FC4214A9A0484F71A73ADA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Review of non-regulatory materials <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D2D93CA80B4BDD8B45326E6CC2B4E7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall review the coordination and approval processes of non-regulatory materials produced by the FAA to improve the timeliness, transparency, development, and issuance of such materials. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2C148871C18402493DB830AE322932A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Contents of review In conducting the review under paragraph (1), the inspector general shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84132688DF5445F7915CBFE43BEB2800" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) provide recommendations for improving processes and eliminating non-value-added reviews of non-regulatory materials within the FAA and Department of Transportation, in consideration of the authority of the Administrator under section 106 of title 49, United States Code, and other applicable laws; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A93399121884B54A84001AF35FF4F1D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) consider, with respect to each office within the FAA and the Department of Transportation that reviews non-regulatory materials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H27652362E83D4681A0F0292D2CBCBC5C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the timeline assigned to each such office to complete the review of such materials; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E83999C9D8B45A4B316C81060C88314" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) describe any organizational changes and additional resources that the Administrator needs, if necessary, to reduce delays in the development and publication of proposed non-regulatory materials; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4BB47BA9CCBA4A51A02BB85C28BDD75A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Consultation In conducting the review under paragraph (1), the inspector general may, as appropriate, consult with industry stakeholders, academia, and other individuals with relevant background or expertise in improving the efficiency of Federal non-regulatory material production. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0748CA52DF774A7EB9AD3769BFE25115" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Report Not later than 1 year after the inspector general initiates the review under paragraph (1), the inspector general shall submit to the Administrator a report on such review. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCA29C1447BEB466C9C01868D33C45765" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Action plan <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA14A7C254A034B80A02AAF420F69530A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The Administrator shall develop an action plan to implement, as appropriate, the recommendations contained in the report submitted under paragraph (4).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCA29C1447BEB466C9C01868D33C45765" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Action plan <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA14A7C254A034B80A02AAF420F69530A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The Administrator shall develop an action plan to implement, as appropriate, the recommendations contained in the report submitted under paragraph (4). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H18DB7D65CE884DB99E41609AFECE9080" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Briefing Not later than 90 days after receiving the report under paragraph (4), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on such plan. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0D59D8A504FA417FB51F488B68CA5EA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Non-regulatory materials defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">non-regulatory materials means orders, statements of policy, guidance, technical standards, and other materials related to aviation safety, training, and operation of aeronautical products.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H18DB7D65CE884DB99E41609AFECE9080" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Briefing Not later than 90 days after receiving the report under paragraph (4), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on such plan. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0D59D8A504FA417FB51F488B68CA5EA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Non-regulatory materials defined In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">non-regulatory materials means orders, statements of policy, guidance, technical standards, and other materials related to aviation safety, training, and operation of aeronautical products. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE461137FF6DD4ACDBF14A9CA71158DDE" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 206.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA792AFC757C540E6937EE9B7908D2585" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Office termination The NextGen Office of the FAA shall terminate on December 31, 2025. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E8C4150ADAE4C6A94D64B2F5B0F67CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Transfer of residual NextGen implementation functions If the Administrator does not complete the air traffic modernization project known as the NextGen program by the deadline specified in subsection (a), the Administrator shall transfer the residual functions for completing the NextGen program to the Airspace Modernization Office of the FAA established under section 207. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0DF3FF42C35F45EDBD659D211E9834D4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Transfer of NextGen Advisory Committee Not later than December 31, 2025, management of the NextGen Advisory Committee shall transfer to the Chief Operating Officer of the air traffic control system.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0DF3FF42C35F45EDBD659D211E9834D4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Transfer of NextGen Advisory Committee Not later than December 31, 2025, management of the NextGen Advisory Committee shall transfer to the Chief Operating Officer of the air traffic control system. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H73DF9AE836E2419FB58091634F92B7B3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Transfer of advanced air mobility functions Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, any advanced air mobility relevant functions, duties, and responsibilities of the NAS Systems Engineering and Integration Office or other offices within the Office of NextGen of the FAA shall be incorporated into the Office of Aviation Safety of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB5E7DBFF55D94826BF7AFAE865CAC44B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Remaining activities In carrying out subsection (a), and after implementing subsections (c) through (e), the Administrator shall transfer any remaining duties, authorities, activities, personnel, and assets managed by the Office of NextGen of the FAA to other offices of the FAA, as appropriate.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB5E7DBFF55D94826BF7AFAE865CAC44B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Remaining activities In carrying out subsection (a), and after implementing subsections (c) through (e), the Administrator shall transfer any remaining duties, authorities, activities, personnel, and assets managed by the Office of NextGen of the FAA to other offices of the FAA, as appropriate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE3777EDB2CBE49FDA7C263EC1D5260CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Technical center for advanced aerospace Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by striking subsection (h) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCDED00322EE742BE88537688ECDB0519" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC0B6CD19E2304227B096A5CC8F561810" qb-display-quote="yes"> (h) Technical center for advanced aerospace <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H800A63FA65B240E98E80E9503D09DE42" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general There is established within the Administration a technology center to support the advancement of aerospace safety and innovation which shall be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">William J. Hughes Technical Center for Advanced Aerospace (in this subsection referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Technical Center) that shall be used by the Administrator and, as permitted by the Administrator, other governmental entities, academia, and the aerospace industry. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H743AF0BD6FCD4250A79A8DEB09136A71" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Management The activities of the Technical Center shall be managed by a Director.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H743AF0BD6FCD4250A79A8DEB09136A71" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Management The activities of the Technical Center shall be managed by a Director. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H88908EC587734855A5D497EA756DDD45" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Activities The activities of the Technical Center shall include— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBC8BB3AABE2B47EEBDF1CEB45A4BDA14" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) developing and stimulating technology partnerships with and between industry, academia, and other government agencies and supporting such partnerships by— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77B444A2C2994BB49FD6F4E2948EF055" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) liaising between external persons and offices of the Administration interested in such work; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE9DBEB4167FA41169FE1405D24F17AD6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) providing technical expertise and input, as appropriate; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF31581C06D8445608278E8C949E6F03C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) providing access to the properties, facilities, and systems of the Technical Center through appropriate agreements; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE8E42C307274F838A440EF536D4C5A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) managing technology demonstration grants awarded by the Administrator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1D12D5288214B448EEAB7CD8004A82A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) identifying software, systems, services, and technologies that could improve aviation safety and the operations and management of the air traffic control system and working with relevant offices of the Administration to consider the use and integration of such software, systems, services, and technologies, as appropriate; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H913DA56866BF4B5EA7B1190F072F74F9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) supporting the work of any collocated facilities and tenants of such facilities, and to the extent feasible, enter into agreements as necessary to utilize the facilities, systems, and technologies of such collocated facilities and tenants; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FE1118187E84E37B4140FFF2F50C456" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) managing the facilities of the Technical Center; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF468BDD14C7D4BCE9F6480B8B72D8DAF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) carrying out any other duties as determined appropriate by the Administrator. .

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB14F9ECF4D314613880382921A53762E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (h) Conforming amendment Section 44507 of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7CC6B53811A437B877B547FE9CFC94F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> (a) Civil Aeromedical Institute and all that follows through <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Civil Aeromedical Institute established and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Civil Aeromedical Institute established; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H513823B72DEA4783B664091BBDFFACBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by striking subsection (b). <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEEA52B7E12DA4287956E199CABEE2D74" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 207.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEEA52B7E12DA4287956E199CABEE2D74" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 207. AIRSPACE MODERNIZATION OFFICE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA96E1F6D1E6D483787003DE71F25273C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF9520537C9C44ECAFFAFD881C2649A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general On January 1, 2026, the Administrator shall establish within the FAA an Airspace Modernization Office (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Office). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCEEB8041CB548FE8326457A04E2445D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Placement The Administrator may task an existing office of the FAA with the functions of the Office.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEEA52B7E12DA4287956E199CABEE2D74" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 207. AIRSPACE MODERNIZATION OFFICE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA96E1F6D1E6D483787003DE71F25273C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF9520537C9C44ECAFFAFD881C2649A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general On January 1, 2026, the Administrator shall establish within the FAA an Airspace Modernization Office (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Office). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCEEB8041CB548FE8326457A04E2445D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Placement The Administrator may task an existing office of the FAA with the functions of the Office.

AIRSPACE MODERNIZATION OFFICE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA96E1F6D1E6D483787003DE71F25273C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF9520537C9C44ECAFFAFD881C2649A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general On January 1, 2026, the Administrator shall establish within the FAA an Airspace Modernization Office (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Office). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCEEB8041CB548FE8326457A04E2445D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Placement The Administrator may task an existing office of the FAA with the functions of the Office. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB07A0ADEF10544A490F58C9A4DCB155B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Duties The Office shall be responsible for— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB259697E9834340AABB927AE350CB8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the research and development, systems engineering, enterprise architecture, and portfolio management for the continuous modernization of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDACF2C0DF8344CA59B6D3C9C466B1512" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the development of an information-centric national airspace system, including digitization of the processes and technology that supports such system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H56A46FA967BF4CCA923699C188AFAB4E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) improving the interoperability of FAA systems and third-party systems that support safe operations in the national airspace system; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H99DAAC4B3A254CA78DC13F00A20162A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) developing and periodically updating an integrated plan for the future state of the national airspace system in coordination with other offices of the FAA.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCEEB8041CB548FE8326457A04E2445D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Placement The Administrator may task an existing office of the FAA with the functions of the Office. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB07A0ADEF10544A490F58C9A4DCB155B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Duties The Office shall be responsible for— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB259697E9834340AABB927AE350CB8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the research and development, systems engineering, enterprise architecture, and portfolio management for the continuous modernization of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDACF2C0DF8344CA59B6D3C9C466B1512" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the development of an information-centric national airspace system, including digitization of the processes and technology that supports such system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H56A46FA967BF4CCA923699C188AFAB4E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) improving the interoperability of FAA systems and third-party systems that support safe operations in the national airspace system; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H99DAAC4B3A254CA78DC13F00A20162A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) developing and periodically updating an integrated plan for the future state of the national airspace system in coordination with other offices of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H270773524E9A4BBCA2BEFE2B4402DAF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Integrated plan requirements The integrated plan developed by the Office shall be designed to ensure that the national airspace system meets future safety, security, mobility, efficiency, and capacity needs of a diverse and growing set of airspace users.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCEEB8041CB548FE8326457A04E2445D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Placement The Administrator may task an existing office of the FAA with the functions of the Office. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB07A0ADEF10544A490F58C9A4DCB155B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Duties The Office shall be responsible for— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB259697E9834340AABB927AE350CB8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the research and development, systems engineering, enterprise architecture, and portfolio management for the continuous modernization of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDACF2C0DF8344CA59B6D3C9C466B1512" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the development of an information-centric national airspace system, including digitization of the processes and technology that supports such system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H56A46FA967BF4CCA923699C188AFAB4E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) improving the interoperability of FAA systems and third-party systems that support safe operations in the national airspace system; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H99DAAC4B3A254CA78DC13F00A20162A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) developing and periodically updating an integrated plan for the future state of the national airspace system in coordination with other offices of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H270773524E9A4BBCA2BEFE2B4402DAF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Integrated plan requirements The integrated plan developed by the Office shall be designed to ensure that the national airspace system meets future safety, security, mobility, efficiency, and capacity needs of a diverse and growing set of airspace users.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB07A0ADEF10544A490F58C9A4DCB155B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Duties The Office shall be responsible for— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB259697E9834340AABB927AE350CB8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the research and development, systems engineering, enterprise architecture, and portfolio management for the continuous modernization of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDACF2C0DF8344CA59B6D3C9C466B1512" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the development of an information-centric national airspace system, including digitization of the processes and technology that supports such system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H56A46FA967BF4CCA923699C188AFAB4E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) improving the interoperability of FAA systems and third-party systems that support safe operations in the national airspace system; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H99DAAC4B3A254CA78DC13F00A20162A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) developing and periodically updating an integrated plan for the future state of the national airspace system in coordination with other offices of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H270773524E9A4BBCA2BEFE2B4402DAF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Integrated plan requirements The integrated plan developed by the Office shall be designed to ensure that the national airspace system meets future safety, security, mobility, efficiency, and capacity needs of a diverse and growing set of airspace users. The integrated plan shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5C0C523153754742BA0475C9B512C0F8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) A description of the demand for services that will be required of the future air transportation system, and an explanation of how the demand projections were derived, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4CF6335707494E2FA96CFE973B668692" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the most likely range of average annual resources required over the duration of the plan to cost effectively maintain the safety, sustainability, and other characteristics of national airspace operation and the mission of the FAA; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H807675A0B8364A6BA942230739C37E79" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) an estimate of FAA resource requirements by user group, including expectations concerning the growth of new entrants and potential new users.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H270773524E9A4BBCA2BEFE2B4402DAF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Integrated plan requirements The integrated plan developed by the Office shall be designed to ensure that the national airspace system meets future safety, security, mobility, efficiency, and capacity needs of a diverse and growing set of airspace users. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H916EF32992E540ADB29CD573FFB9F621" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) A description of the operational concepts to meet the system performance requirements for all system users and a timeline and anticipated expenditures needed to develop and deploy the system. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBD0DDBE53515442BAA52D9E4DF2B1A10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) A description of the management of the enterprise architecture framework for the introduction of any operational improvements and to inform FAA financial decision-making. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74C4203194414847ABF087E2FAE91CC9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) A justification for the operational improvements that the Office determines will need to be developed and deployed by 2040 to meet the needs of national airspace users, including the benefits, costs, and risks of the preferred and alternative options.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74C4203194414847ABF087E2FAE91CC9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) A justification for the operational improvements that the Office determines will need to be developed and deployed by 2040 to meet the needs of national airspace users, including the benefits, costs, and risks of the preferred and alternative options. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B7ED09C4DD74E2EA78670E364C12EBD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Considerations In developing an initial integrated plan required under subsection (b) and carrying out such plan, the Office shall consider— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H279AA660A1F246E290723AB425D4DFFA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the results and recommendations of the independent report on implementation of the NextGen program under section 603; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90EFF98B914C40EE812CA7A1FD825495" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the status of the transition to, and deployment of, trajectory-based operations within the national airspace system; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7D9D9CAC58A04E948E23A70DE7FFCBE4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the findings of the audit required by section 622, and the resulting plan to replace or enhance the identified legacy systems within a reasonable timeframe. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0578E4B6C7134025A349432472E03238" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Consultation In developing and carrying out the integrated plan, the Office shall consult with the NextGen Advisory Committee of the FAA.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0578E4B6C7134025A349432472E03238" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Consultation In developing and carrying out the integrated plan, the Office shall consult with the NextGen Advisory Committee of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB07B9FF2A04F441794B0D654919DFF85" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Plan deadline; briefings <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDE563F81B75439A81DC5E659B4FC306" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Plan deadline Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate, the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives, the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives, and the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives an initial integrated plan required under subsection (a)(3)(D). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2D6B821BDC3F45D8B03AFDAFC2553886" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Annual briefings The Administrator shall provide the committees of Congress specified in paragraph (1) with an annual briefing describing the progress in carrying out the integrated plan required under subsection (a)(3)(D), including any changes to the plan, through 2028.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2D6B821BDC3F45D8B03AFDAFC2553886" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Annual briefings The Administrator shall provide the committees of Congress specified in paragraph (1) with an annual briefing describing the progress in carrying out the integrated plan required under subsection (a)(3)(D), including any changes to the plan, through 2028. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE3FC8ADD8C524B81AC67E0CCA3E81F9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) DOT inspector general review Not later than 180 days after submission of the initial integrated plan under subsection (e)(1), the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall begin a review of the integrated plan and submit to the committees of Congress specified in subsection (e)(1) a report that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H011ACA2532824B5DA3FEF88D10BD22AD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) assesses the justification for the integrated plan; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02E6D73CFF9C4571A1013749E058939E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) provides any recommendations for improving the integrated plan; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H281A294DCDF3439DACAAEC32F0914531" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) includes any other information that the inspector general determines appropriate. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD38069A96F5C4FD492F15F0DFF5DAAE4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 208.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD38069A96F5C4FD492F15F0DFF5DAAE4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 208. APPLICATION DASHBOARD AND FEEDBACK PORTAL <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB283281F588F4614A62345F877707B39" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Deputy Administrator of the FAA shall determine whether a publicly facing dashboard that provides applicants with the status of an application before the FAA would be— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0A15E5AE43C54301B01F41F055C70938" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) beneficial to applicants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2A63F0121CA3486BA8EA2115921A03F0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an efficient use of resources to build, maintain, and update; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H908836AFFA044B038B372BA9E029A656" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) duplicative with other efforts of the FAA to streamline and digitize paperwork and certification processes to provide an applicant with a greater awareness of the status of an application before the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0AC06BA168EB4988AAF1410ABBD66471" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Recommendation Not later than 30 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Deputy Administrator shall provide to the Administrator a recommendation regarding the need for or benefits of a dashboard or other means by which to track an application status.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3EF4A4A124274B919BCE4FDF8A79B1A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) FAA feedback portal <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFED6E8E32EAB434F9AFC3B31960A436B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Deputy Administrator shall determine whether a publicly facing portal on the website of the FAA through which the public may provide feedback to the Administrator about experiences individuals have working with personnel of the FAA would be beneficial. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19BD7D12F23046ABB9841C0C23CFC6FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements The Deputy Administrator shall ensure any portal established under this subsection asks questions that seek to gauge any shortcomings the FAA has in fulfilling the mission of the FAA or areas where the FAA is succeeding in meeting the mission of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F70983028545ECA6568B9CAA08D6B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Application This section shall apply to applications relating to— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0242AAA00D94386839316003C2B2CF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) an aircraft, aircraft engine, propeller, or appliance certification; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H25BC2D9CAC724792A99237E25FBED87F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an airman or pilot certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB8C20EDA5AE4FC8BF0AF56A5AAD4916" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a medical certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F02A76E402C4C11B205A2A25CCD458A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) an operator certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C85D57E668242BD93C391CFFFA6B911" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) when authority under chapter 509 of title 51, United States Code, is explicitly delegated by the Secretary to the Administrator, a license or permit issued under such chapter; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CB27E7FA47643868DF9DC04A3608AEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) an aircraft registration; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H769A176A674947C0BE9FC6909759786F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an operational approval, waiver, or exemption; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05EBF26D0C194EC2912785F3FBA34FF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) a legal interpretation; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCAD0AF6ABAE44FE2B58AEB785AD360A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) an outstanding agency determination; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBD706DA3B4FB444797090880B9A2E95B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) any certificate not otherwise described in this subparagraph that is issued pursuant to chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19BD7D12F23046ABB9841C0C23CFC6FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements The Deputy Administrator shall ensure any portal established under this subsection asks questions that seek to gauge any shortcomings the FAA has in fulfilling the mission of the FAA or areas where the FAA is succeeding in meeting the mission of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F70983028545ECA6568B9CAA08D6B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Application This section shall apply to applications relating to— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0242AAA00D94386839316003C2B2CF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) an aircraft, aircraft engine, propeller, or appliance certification; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H25BC2D9CAC724792A99237E25FBED87F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an airman or pilot certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB8C20EDA5AE4FC8BF0AF56A5AAD4916" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a medical certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F02A76E402C4C11B205A2A25CCD458A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) an operator certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C85D57E668242BD93C391CFFFA6B911" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) when authority under chapter 509 of title 51, United States Code, is explicitly delegated by the Secretary to the Administrator, a license or permit issued under such chapter; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CB27E7FA47643868DF9DC04A3608AEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) an aircraft registration; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H769A176A674947C0BE9FC6909759786F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an operational approval, waiver, or exemption; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05EBF26D0C194EC2912785F3FBA34FF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) a legal interpretation; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCAD0AF6ABAE44FE2B58AEB785AD360A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) an outstanding agency determination; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBD706DA3B4FB444797090880B9A2E95B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) any certificate not otherwise described in this subparagraph that is issued pursuant to chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E90ECA6403445778A00541C8E3565B2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 209.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19BD7D12F23046ABB9841C0C23CFC6FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements The Deputy Administrator shall ensure any portal established under this subsection asks questions that seek to gauge any shortcomings the FAA has in fulfilling the mission of the FAA or areas where the FAA is succeeding in meeting the mission of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F70983028545ECA6568B9CAA08D6B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Application This section shall apply to applications relating to— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0242AAA00D94386839316003C2B2CF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) an aircraft, aircraft engine, propeller, or appliance certification; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H25BC2D9CAC724792A99237E25FBED87F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an airman or pilot certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB8C20EDA5AE4FC8BF0AF56A5AAD4916" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a medical certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F02A76E402C4C11B205A2A25CCD458A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) an operator certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C85D57E668242BD93C391CFFFA6B911" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) when authority under chapter 509 of title 51, United States Code, is explicitly delegated by the Secretary to the Administrator, a license or permit issued under such chapter; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CB27E7FA47643868DF9DC04A3608AEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) an aircraft registration; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H769A176A674947C0BE9FC6909759786F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an operational approval, waiver, or exemption; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05EBF26D0C194EC2912785F3FBA34FF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) a legal interpretation; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCAD0AF6ABAE44FE2B58AEB785AD360A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) an outstanding agency determination; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBD706DA3B4FB444797090880B9A2E95B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) any certificate not otherwise described in this subparagraph that is issued pursuant to chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E90ECA6403445778A00541C8E3565B2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 209.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19BD7D12F23046ABB9841C0C23CFC6FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements The Deputy Administrator shall ensure any portal established under this subsection asks questions that seek to gauge any shortcomings the FAA has in fulfilling the mission of the FAA or areas where the FAA is succeeding in meeting the mission of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F70983028545ECA6568B9CAA08D6B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Application This section shall apply to applications relating to— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0242AAA00D94386839316003C2B2CF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) an aircraft, aircraft engine, propeller, or appliance certification; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H25BC2D9CAC724792A99237E25FBED87F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an airman or pilot certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB8C20EDA5AE4FC8BF0AF56A5AAD4916" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a medical certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F02A76E402C4C11B205A2A25CCD458A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) an operator certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C85D57E668242BD93C391CFFFA6B911" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) when authority under chapter 509 of title 51, United States Code, is explicitly delegated by the Secretary to the Administrator, a license or permit issued under such chapter; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CB27E7FA47643868DF9DC04A3608AEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) an aircraft registration; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H769A176A674947C0BE9FC6909759786F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an operational approval, waiver, or exemption; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05EBF26D0C194EC2912785F3FBA34FF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) a legal interpretation; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCAD0AF6ABAE44FE2B58AEB785AD360A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) an outstanding agency determination; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBD706DA3B4FB444797090880B9A2E95B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) any certificate not otherwise described in this subparagraph that is issued pursuant to chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E90ECA6403445778A00541C8E3565B2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 209.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E90ECA6403445778A00541C8E3565B2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 209. SENSE OF CONGRESS ON FAA ENGAGEMENT DURING RULEMAKING ACTIVITIES It is the sense of Congress that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF3FC303AAA548C7B6D9A1478D0B938C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Administrator should— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB618FAAC5E149A397A6BBECC6D06852" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) engage with aviation stakeholder groups and the public during pre-drafting stages of rulemaking activities and use, to the greatest extent practicable, properly docketed ex parte discussions during rulemaking activities in order to— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB8781836EA304038A1C6D1BCD4201D54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) inform the work of the Administrator; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D6392519F5B4E5F910F7C6C6582BEF9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) assist the Administrator in developing the scope of a rule; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FA4F47902454B96BC5B59768A507DED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) reduce the timeline for issuance of proposed and final rules; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB22F89D01CE34F96905CE8350D5704A2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) rely on documented data and safety trends when determining whether or not to proceed with a rulemaking activity; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB598A60622CF4A7AA571299AE9FF8635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) not consider a rulemaking activity required in statute, for the purposes of ex parte communications, as having been established on the date of enactment of the related public law, but rather upon obtainment of a regulation identifier number; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H01D3DCFD8C984E97BCA5AC8AF720D729" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) when it would reduce the time required for the Administrator to adjudicate public comments, the Administrator should publicly provide information describing the rationale behind a regulatory decision included in proposed regulations in order to better allow for the public to provide clear and informed comments on such regulations. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCE6AE9D632C042F19C4C288AC3B3CEF8" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 210.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E90ECA6403445778A00541C8E3565B2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 209. SENSE OF CONGRESS ON FAA ENGAGEMENT DURING RULEMAKING ACTIVITIES It is the sense of Congress that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF3FC303AAA548C7B6D9A1478D0B938C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Administrator should— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB618FAAC5E149A397A6BBECC6D06852" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) engage with aviation stakeholder groups and the public during pre-drafting stages of rulemaking activities and use, to the greatest extent practicable, properly docketed ex parte discussions during rulemaking activities in order to— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB8781836EA304038A1C6D1BCD4201D54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) inform the work of the Administrator; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D6392519F5B4E5F910F7C6C6582BEF9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) assist the Administrator in developing the scope of a rule; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FA4F47902454B96BC5B59768A507DED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) reduce the timeline for issuance of proposed and final rules; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB22F89D01CE34F96905CE8350D5704A2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) rely on documented data and safety trends when determining whether or not to proceed with a rulemaking activity; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB598A60622CF4A7AA571299AE9FF8635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) not consider a rulemaking activity required in statute, for the purposes of ex parte communications, as having been established on the date of enactment of the related public law, but rather upon obtainment of a regulation identifier number; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H01D3DCFD8C984E97BCA5AC8AF720D729" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) when it would reduce the time required for the Administrator to adjudicate public comments, the Administrator should publicly provide information describing the rationale behind a regulatory decision included in proposed regulations in order to better allow for the public to provide clear and informed comments on such regulations. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCE6AE9D632C042F19C4C288AC3B3CEF8" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 210.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE822A9FC08E242E3B2BDB97213EC0D30" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 211. MANAGEMENT ADVISORY COUNCIL Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09747A53DFE6474DBC84E86F173EC77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by transferring paragraph (8) of subsection (p) to subsection (r) and redesignating such paragraph as paragraph (7); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB727E129A3C8450181C55E85630A93F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by striking subsection (p) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H12821348650E4AE6B58D9878B3F115DE" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF26CEE6F277645818D54BD9B7367ED59" qb-display-quote="yes"> (p) Management advisory council <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7873C8FE879A4E3E98287C5ACD10DFDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Establishment The Administrator shall establish an advisory council which shall be known as the Federal Aerospace Management Advisory Council (in this subsection referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Council). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF20BC5BC8A02433180EEC8843C557514" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Membership The Council shall consist of 13 members, who shall consist of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA4FC8B6F707C4B01AA4F6680A432C7EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a designee of the Secretary of Transportation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2C975F07332A40008A8338F83448A17E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a designee of the Secretary of Defense; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66152D5E1AA343B68DD654C525E03F60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) 5 members representing aerospace and technology interests, appointed by the Administrator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F1160076F644CD7B75608261E72E6CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) 5 members representing aerospace and technology interests, appointed by the Secretary of Transportation; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEB7A1021953042A5A9DCD65EF3A3E05C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) 1 member, appointed by the Secretary of Transportation, who is the head of a union representing air traffic control system employees.

MANAGEMENT ADVISORY COUNCIL Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09747A53DFE6474DBC84E86F173EC77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by transferring paragraph (8) of subsection (p) to subsection (r) and redesignating such paragraph as paragraph (7); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB727E129A3C8450181C55E85630A93F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by striking subsection (p) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H12821348650E4AE6B58D9878B3F115DE" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF26CEE6F277645818D54BD9B7367ED59" qb-display-quote="yes"> (p) Management advisory council <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7873C8FE879A4E3E98287C5ACD10DFDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Establishment The Administrator shall establish an advisory council which shall be known as the Federal Aerospace Management Advisory Council (in this subsection referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Council). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF20BC5BC8A02433180EEC8843C557514" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Membership The Council shall consist of 13 members, who shall consist of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA4FC8B6F707C4B01AA4F6680A432C7EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a designee of the Secretary of Transportation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2C975F07332A40008A8338F83448A17E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a designee of the Secretary of Defense; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66152D5E1AA343B68DD654C525E03F60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) 5 members representing aerospace and technology interests, appointed by the Administrator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F1160076F644CD7B75608261E72E6CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) 5 members representing aerospace and technology interests, appointed by the Secretary of Transportation; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEB7A1021953042A5A9DCD65EF3A3E05C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) 1 member, appointed by the Secretary of Transportation, who is the head of a union representing air traffic control system employees. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1164B30F11C3463AA09928E6B3C73AC8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Qualifications No officer or employee of the Federal Government may be appointed to the Council under subparagraph (C) or (D) of paragraph (2).

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E16A8B79DE54CAFA9737962988522E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Resource The Council shall function as an oversight resource for management, policy, spending, and regulatory matters under the jurisdiction of the Administrator. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE24894FE2EB64F739D14C0D49A5D542B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Submissions to administration With respect to Administration management, policy, spending, funding, data management and analysis, safety initiatives, international agreements, activities of the International Civil Aviation Organization, and regulatory matters affecting the aerospace industry and the national airspace system, the Council may— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA050C3ED879F48BD86D0BF7330899436" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) regardless of whether solicited by the Administrator, submit comments, recommended modifications, proposals, and supporting or dissenting views to the Administrator; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE5DDCA7A38041E1A02BAB84021D993F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) request the Administrator include in any submission to Congress, the Secretary, or the general public, and in any submission for publication in the Federal Register, a description of the comments, recommended modifications, and dissenting or supporting views received from the Council under subclause (I). <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H492EB9DA8724456EB4A565DA8066D3E4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) Reasoning Together with a Council submission that is published or described under clause (iii)(II), the Administrator may provide the reasons for any differences between the views of the Council and the views or actions of the Administrator.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E16A8B79DE54CAFA9737962988522E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Resource The Council shall function as an oversight resource for management, policy, spending, and regulatory matters under the jurisdiction of the Administrator. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE24894FE2EB64F739D14C0D49A5D542B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Submissions to administration With respect to Administration management, policy, spending, funding, data management and analysis, safety initiatives, international agreements, activities of the International Civil Aviation Organization, and regulatory matters affecting the aerospace industry and the national airspace system, the Council may— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA050C3ED879F48BD86D0BF7330899436" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) regardless of whether solicited by the Administrator, submit comments, recommended modifications, proposals, and supporting or dissenting views to the Administrator; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE5DDCA7A38041E1A02BAB84021D993F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) request the Administrator include in any submission to Congress, the Secretary, or the general public, and in any submission for publication in the Federal Register, a description of the comments, recommended modifications, and dissenting or supporting views received from the Council under subclause (I). <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H492EB9DA8724456EB4A565DA8066D3E4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) Reasoning Together with a Council submission that is published or described under clause (iii)(II), the Administrator may provide the reasons for any differences between the views of the Council and the views or actions of the Administrator.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E16A8B79DE54CAFA9737962988522E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Resource The Council shall function as an oversight resource for management, policy, spending, and regulatory matters under the jurisdiction of the Administrator. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE24894FE2EB64F739D14C0D49A5D542B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Submissions to administration With respect to Administration management, policy, spending, funding, data management and analysis, safety initiatives, international agreements, activities of the International Civil Aviation Organization, and regulatory matters affecting the aerospace industry and the national airspace system, the Council may— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA050C3ED879F48BD86D0BF7330899436" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) regardless of whether solicited by the Administrator, submit comments, recommended modifications, proposals, and supporting or dissenting views to the Administrator; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE5DDCA7A38041E1A02BAB84021D993F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) request the Administrator include in any submission to Congress, the Secretary, or the general public, and in any submission for publication in the Federal Register, a description of the comments, recommended modifications, and dissenting or supporting views received from the Council under subclause (I). <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H492EB9DA8724456EB4A565DA8066D3E4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) Reasoning Together with a Council submission that is published or described under clause (iii)(II), the Administrator may provide the reasons for any differences between the views of the Council and the views or actions of the Administrator.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE2ED19423A6A4F95B1A7132EF622F97D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Meetings The Council shall meet not less than 3 times annually or at the call of the chair or the Administrator. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB1C4F22A3CD4CCFA467B6BC09B4E634" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Access to documents and staff The Administrator may give the Council appropriate access to relevant documents and personnel of the Administration, and the Administrator shall make available, consistent with the authority to withhold commercial and other proprietary information under section 552 of title 5 (commonly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Freedom of Information Act), cost data associated with the acquisition and operation of air traffic service systems. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAED00BA4C39B4B15A0FE05E461684A7D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Disclosure of commercial or proprietary data Any member of the Council who receives commercial or other proprietary data as provided for in this paragraph from the Administrator shall be subject to the provisions of section 1905 of title 18, pertaining to unauthorized disclosure of such information.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE2ED19423A6A4F95B1A7132EF622F97D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Meetings The Council shall meet not less than 3 times annually or at the call of the chair or the Administrator. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB1C4F22A3CD4CCFA467B6BC09B4E634" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Access to documents and staff The Administrator may give the Council appropriate access to relevant documents and personnel of the Administration, and the Administrator shall make available, consistent with the authority to withhold commercial and other proprietary information under section 552 of title 5 (commonly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Freedom of Information Act), cost data associated with the acquisition and operation of air traffic service systems. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAED00BA4C39B4B15A0FE05E461684A7D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Disclosure of commercial or proprietary data Any member of the Council who receives commercial or other proprietary data as provided for in this paragraph from the Administrator shall be subject to the provisions of section 1905 of title 18, pertaining to unauthorized disclosure of such information.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB1C4F22A3CD4CCFA467B6BC09B4E634" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Access to documents and staff The Administrator may give the Council appropriate access to relevant documents and personnel of the Administration, and the Administrator shall make available, consistent with the authority to withhold commercial and other proprietary information under section 552 of title 5 (commonly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Freedom of Information Act), cost data associated with the acquisition and operation of air traffic service systems. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAED00BA4C39B4B15A0FE05E461684A7D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Disclosure of commercial or proprietary data Any member of the Council who receives commercial or other proprietary data as provided for in this paragraph from the Administrator shall be subject to the provisions of section 1905 of title 18, pertaining to unauthorized disclosure of such information. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3E4BB88B9994025B520486289AE5D52" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Application of chapter 10 of title 5 Chapter 10 of title 5 does not apply to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H325AC8FEC1B74C07818084C3EC927C36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Council; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF197614EBD1F48328A648A72ADAF53A6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) such aviation rulemaking committees as the Administrator shall designate; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC618DE87589548599612ABC9AE931D01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) such aerospace rulemaking committees as the Secretary shall designate.

citations.text: section 155.7 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations
citations.context: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3AB4E3154D44F1495E9C6A23DE79BFB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Continuation in office A member of the Council whose term expires shall continue to serve until the date on which the successor of the member takes office. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDDFBF04C3418409886EA8CB93BFBAE6D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) Removal Any member of the Council appointed under paragraph (2) may be removed for cause by whomever makes the appointment. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H47C862E0D1E044F7A0C164D71370AECF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) Chair; vice chair The Council shall elect a chair and a vice chair from among the members appointed under subparagraphs (C) and (D) of paragraph (2), each of whom shall serve for a term of 1 year.

The vice chair shall perform the duties of the chair in the absence of the chair. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H86B9B42FA33E4C4094CD51C0AFB91EFF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) Travel and per diem Each member of the Council shall be paid actual travel expenses, and per diem in lieu of subsistence expenses when away from the usual place of residence of the member, in accordance with section 5703 of title 5. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE46060742B094A5AB506A5A059AB62F6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) Detail of personnel from the administration The Administrator shall make available to the Council such staff, information, and administrative services and assistance as may reasonably be required to enable the Council to carry out the responsibilities of the Council under this subsection.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H86B9B42FA33E4C4094CD51C0AFB91EFF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) Travel and per diem Each member of the Council shall be paid actual travel expenses, and per diem in lieu of subsistence expenses when away from the usual place of residence of the member, in accordance with section 5703 of title 5. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE46060742B094A5AB506A5A059AB62F6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) Detail of personnel from the administration The Administrator shall make available to the Council such staff, information, and administrative services and assistance as may reasonably be required to enable the Council to carry out the responsibilities of the Council under this subsection. .

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84141548EDCB43829C997478BC2F6A5B" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 212. CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER Section 106(r) of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBC8FBF1E497B4C2D8B1DC2111D9FF4AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in paragraph (1)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA1731AD7097B41D8892F9FD11C5673DD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HF7BFC6D266D94F9E9FEA3217E8BD73BF" style="OLC"> <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B33B6B17D6A434F84FE5EAE4D3703A5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Appointment There shall be a Chief Operating Officer for the air traffic control system who is appointed by the Administrator and subject to the authority of the Administrator. ; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66D2E895CB1B46CCA1D96206EB489042" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in subparagraph (E) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">shall be appointed for the remainder of that term and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">may be appointed for either the remainder of the term or for a full term; <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48D9026C3B4A4C68A53DDFC825A0DC56" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 213. REPORT ON UNFUNDED CAPITAL INVESTMENT NEEDS OF AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL SYSTEM Section 106(r) of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCA6441E1CD494CAB893345AE5C6B8FDC" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02AE162856074788859BFB9C63269876" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Unfunded capital investment needs report <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2A70DBF8617A451DB326B77AB362BE97" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 10 days after the date on which the budget of the President for a fiscal year is submitted to Congress pursuant to section 1150 of title 31, the Administrator shall submit to the Secretary, the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives, and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a report on any unfunded capital investment needs of the air traffic control system. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC359ABE4B641491C9AFBDC56D3D12DE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Contents of briefing In providing the report under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall include, for each unfunded capital investment need, the following: <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6937B53128F04220AD6716FE2A9E3FC4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) A summary description of such unfunded capital investment need.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48D9026C3B4A4C68A53DDFC825A0DC56" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 213. REPORT ON UNFUNDED CAPITAL INVESTMENT NEEDS OF AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL SYSTEM Section 106(r) of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCA6441E1CD494CAB893345AE5C6B8FDC" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02AE162856074788859BFB9C63269876" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Unfunded capital investment needs report <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2A70DBF8617A451DB326B77AB362BE97" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 10 days after the date on which the budget of the President for a fiscal year is submitted to Congress pursuant to section 1150 of title 31, the Administrator shall submit to the Secretary, the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives, and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a report on any unfunded capital investment needs of the air traffic control system. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC359ABE4B641491C9AFBDC56D3D12DE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Contents of briefing In providing the report under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall include, for each unfunded capital investment need, the following: <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6937B53128F04220AD6716FE2A9E3FC4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) A summary description of such unfunded capital investment need.

REPORT ON UNFUNDED CAPITAL INVESTMENT NEEDS OF AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL SYSTEM Section 106(r) of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCA6441E1CD494CAB893345AE5C6B8FDC" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02AE162856074788859BFB9C63269876" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Unfunded capital investment needs report <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2A70DBF8617A451DB326B77AB362BE97" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 10 days after the date on which the budget of the President for a fiscal year is submitted to Congress pursuant to section 1150 of title 31, the Administrator shall submit to the Secretary, the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives, and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a report on any unfunded capital investment needs of the air traffic control system. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC359ABE4B641491C9AFBDC56D3D12DE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Contents of briefing In providing the report under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall include, for each unfunded capital investment need, the following: <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6937B53128F04220AD6716FE2A9E3FC4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) A summary description of such unfunded capital investment need. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1ED27252A31F4EA9BBA6B75182F49747" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) The objective to be achieved if such unfunded capital investment need is funded in whole or in part.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8BECAA315CB5411AB5C55368FB512579" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) The additional amount of funds recommended in connection with such objective. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4439A74E5D274CAE9E55E15B7AF4A275" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) The Budget Line Item Program and Budget Line Item number associated with such unfunded capital investment need, as applicable. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F0EEC2BC0F436496FA33DC3FA05049" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) Any statutory requirement associated with such unfunded capital investment need, as applicable.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4439A74E5D274CAE9E55E15B7AF4A275" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) The Budget Line Item Program and Budget Line Item number associated with such unfunded capital investment need, as applicable. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F0EEC2BC0F436496FA33DC3FA05049" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) Any statutory requirement associated with such unfunded capital investment need, as applicable. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA63AE901892D41FD85B4A9802FF32EFC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Prioritization of requirements The briefing required under subparagraph (A) shall present unfunded capital investment needs in overall urgency of priority.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F0EEC2BC0F436496FA33DC3FA05049" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) Any statutory requirement associated with such unfunded capital investment need, as applicable. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA63AE901892D41FD85B4A9802FF32EFC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Prioritization of requirements The briefing required under subparagraph (A) shall present unfunded capital investment needs in overall urgency of priority. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA8CF06D1F20479CA046706E798C4403" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Unfunded capital investment need defined In this paragraph, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">unfunded capital investment need means a program that— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5B1D7620C19B4204848BD71F8DAB2469" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) is not funded in the budget of the President for the fiscal year as submitted to Congress pursuant to section 1105 of title 31; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H114AD6DEC7E24E9D9CDA5C17CD948E5C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) is for infrastructure or a system related to necessary modernization or sustainment of the air traffic control system; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E4BA7E697114D50A32EB49C386A0422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) is listed for any year in the most recent National Airspace System Capital Investment Plan of the Administration; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H398EB8D085BB4E64830B2D048D942AAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) would have been recommended for funding through the budget referred to in subparagraph (A) by the Administrator if— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE1B41759C5A4AE096F805AD1D659832" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) additional resources had been available for the budget to fund the program, activity, or mission requirement; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBFC8E07225C540BDB1143778C6C451A9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the program, activity, or mission requirement has emerged since the budget was formulated.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA63AE901892D41FD85B4A9802FF32EFC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Prioritization of requirements The briefing required under subparagraph (A) shall present unfunded capital investment needs in overall urgency of priority. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA8CF06D1F20479CA046706E798C4403" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Unfunded capital investment need defined In this paragraph, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">unfunded capital investment need means a program that— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5B1D7620C19B4204848BD71F8DAB2469" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) is not funded in the budget of the President for the fiscal year as submitted to Congress pursuant to section 1105 of title 31; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H114AD6DEC7E24E9D9CDA5C17CD948E5C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) is for infrastructure or a system related to necessary modernization or sustainment of the air traffic control system; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E4BA7E697114D50A32EB49C386A0422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) is listed for any year in the most recent National Airspace System Capital Investment Plan of the Administration; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H398EB8D085BB4E64830B2D048D942AAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) would have been recommended for funding through the budget referred to in subparagraph (A) by the Administrator if— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE1B41759C5A4AE096F805AD1D659832" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) additional resources had been available for the budget to fund the program, activity, or mission requirement; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBFC8E07225C540BDB1143778C6C451A9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the program, activity, or mission requirement has emerged since the budget was formulated. .

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA63AE901892D41FD85B4A9802FF32EFC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Prioritization of requirements The briefing required under subparagraph (A) shall present unfunded capital investment needs in overall urgency of priority. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA8CF06D1F20479CA046706E798C4403" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Unfunded capital investment need defined In this paragraph, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">unfunded capital investment need means a program that— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5B1D7620C19B4204848BD71F8DAB2469" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) is not funded in the budget of the President for the fiscal year as submitted to Congress pursuant to section 1105 of title 31; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H114AD6DEC7E24E9D9CDA5C17CD948E5C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) is for infrastructure or a system related to necessary modernization or sustainment of the air traffic control system; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E4BA7E697114D50A32EB49C386A0422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) is listed for any year in the most recent National Airspace System Capital Investment Plan of the Administration; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H398EB8D085BB4E64830B2D048D942AAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) would have been recommended for funding through the budget referred to in subparagraph (A) by the Administrator if— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE1B41759C5A4AE096F805AD1D659832" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) additional resources had been available for the budget to fund the program, activity, or mission requirement; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBFC8E07225C540BDB1143778C6C451A9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the program, activity, or mission requirement has emerged since the budget was formulated. .

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8238422F516B479A9425F60D550E21D9" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 216. PEER REVIEW OF OFFICE OF WHISTLEBLOWER PROTECTION AND AVIATION SAFETY INVESTIGATIONS Section 106(t) of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2DDB27A3FC6F4B4BB948714A8B3763E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by striking paragraph (7); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD87F371BE8A94394ACA0D4FC651DDA69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by inserting after paragraph (6) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H1A1D0DECB211431CA80DCF1509A36A4D" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2E78903346DE44C6A9F9F0F84E5595E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Department of Transportation Office of the Inspector General peer review <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H980676F0EA694F49982CA60FF505A891" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, and every 5 years thereafter, the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall perform a peer review of the Office of Whistleblower Protection and Aviation Safety Investigations. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD33DFA790514A7A8E53D32B25C11CEF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Peer review scope In completing the peer reviews required under this paragraph, the inspector general shall, to the extent appropriate, use the most recent peer review guides published by the Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency Audit Committee and Investigations Committee.
