<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD87F371BE8A94394ACA0D4FC651DDA69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by inserting after paragraph (6) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H1A1D0DECB211431CA80DCF1509A36A4D" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2E78903346DE44C6A9F9F0F84E5595E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Department of Transportation Office of the Inspector General peer review <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H980676F0EA694F49982CA60FF505A891" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, and every 5 years thereafter, the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall perform a peer review of the Office of Whistleblower Protection and Aviation Safety Investigations. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD33DFA790514A7A8E53D32B25C11CEF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Peer review scope In completing the peer reviews required under this paragraph, the inspector general shall, to the extent appropriate, use the most recent peer review guides published by the Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency Audit Committee and Investigations Committee. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6BEBD057F9D47FD956AAA3B57B49097" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Reports to congress Not later than 90 days after the completion of a peer review required under this paragraph, the inspector general shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a description of any actions taken or to be taken to address the results of the peer review.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2DD268DF0DE847B3A3970A22A3E0B0A9" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 217. CYBERSECURITY LEAD <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H65ED4DA8054C47B7A6A94CAD06CE2F6D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator shall designate an executive of the FAA to serve as the lead for the cybersecurity of FAA systems and hardware (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Cybersecurity Lead). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3D5FAB482464703B185F3D69ECFA8AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Duties The Cybersecurity Lead shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Administrator, including the management of activities required under subtitle B of title III.

CYBERSECURITY LEAD <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H65ED4DA8054C47B7A6A94CAD06CE2F6D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator shall designate an executive of the FAA to serve as the lead for the cybersecurity of FAA systems and hardware (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Cybersecurity Lead). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3D5FAB482464703B185F3D69ECFA8AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Duties The Cybersecurity Lead shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Administrator, including the management of activities required under subtitle B of title III. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H275BD30190D44241933FD3C94BE4F323" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Briefing Not later than 1 and 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Cybersecurity Lead shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the implementation of subtitle B of title III.

SAFETY AND EFFICIENCY THROUGH DIGITIZATION OF FAA SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77D4BBCAD2C1475D895B001E54143392" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0D40531819F74D2D914B9C0258F13BDC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) identify, at the discretion of the Administrator, not less than 3 processes of the FAA that result in a certification and require paper-based information exchange between external entities and the FAA or offices within the FAA (such as an aircraft certification, aircraft registration, or airmen certification) or authorization, an exemption, or a letter of authorization; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2F288AF632C44994802AE1B8DA0ED522" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) initiate the digitization of such processes.

; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H126FEB47DCD74482BDA5846A74BAD9D8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H0B4ED4F8B33143F1A134B7D5A0158A2C" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H811AFE028A6D47FDA94FFAED7794B974" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) The date of service made by an electronic or facsimile method is— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H020524009C064121A885DF0184ABB55C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date an electronic or facsimile transmission is sent; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H53E5CF346EA9440D9BB665C5FD6CB67F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the date a notification is sent by an electronic or facsimile method that a notice, process, or action is immediately available and accessible in an electronic database. ; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30239F7F92FD4131A3A2018AD904D907" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in subsection (c) by striking the first sentence and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Service on an agent designated under this section shall be made at the office or usual place of residence of the agent or at the electronic or facsimile address designated by the agent.. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H10C037202EE74ADF9FCCA8FD7D7DCA20" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 220. SAFETY AND EFFICIENCY THROUGH DIGITIZATION OF FAA SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77D4BBCAD2C1475D895B001E54143392" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0D40531819F74D2D914B9C0258F13BDC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) identify, at the discretion of the Administrator, not less than 3 processes of the FAA that result in a certification and require paper-based information exchange between external entities and the FAA or offices within the FAA (such as an aircraft certification, aircraft registration, or airmen certification) or authorization, an exemption, or a letter of authorization; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2F288AF632C44994802AE1B8DA0ED522" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) initiate the digitization of such processes.

citations.text: Section 46301(a) of title 49, United States Code
citations.context: <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7F514BC8778B491DB22403CB09BB4046" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Briefing to Congress Not later than 2 years after the date on which the Administrator initiates the digitization under subsection (a)(2), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the progress of such digitization. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD1B6231DDC1A40AD8B3718DD6A8E82C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definition of digitization In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">digitization means the transition from a predominantly paper-based system to a system centered on the use of a data management system and the internet. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2CB4204E698F4CD59246F7DE13CFB8EB" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 221.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD1B6231DDC1A40AD8B3718DD6A8E82C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definition of digitization In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">digitization means the transition from a predominantly paper-based system to a system centered on the use of a data management system and the internet. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2CB4204E698F4CD59246F7DE13CFB8EB" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 221. FAA TELEWORK <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC989B03FDED4C64A8EBD27B3E81BD88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40774DD5A17D4C4391D9454FEC12F2D2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may establish telework policies for employees of the FAA that allow for the Administrator to reduce the office footprint and associated expenses of the FAA, if appropriate, increase workforce retention, and provide flexibilities that the Administrator demonstrates increases efficiency and effectiveness of the Administration, while requiring that any such policy— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94D4B050D9A44D84BB07ED504B68F01A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) does not adversely impact the mission of the FAA; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43E850C917B24CA59D8B11FAEE48AE5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not reduce the safety or efficiency of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H310A19622020430DB68016D509338C7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) for any employee that is designated as an officer or executive in the FAA Executive System or a political appointee (as such term is defined in section 106 of title 49, United States Code)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82B49BA2853A480687892FDB0E3EE081" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) maximizes time at a duty station for such employee, excluding official travel; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6BF29958F574102849F88302AD11CB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) may include telework provisions as determined appropriate by the Administrator, commensurate with official duties for such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7CDCAE2D70124ADF8599F99022BB4A92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) provides for on-the-job training opportunities for FAA personnel that are not less than such opportunities available in 2019; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H513763D170654F67948F41AEFA3CDC7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) reflects the appropriate work status of employees based on the job functions of such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77EC46A06A13435BBB54DD46ADBA7F61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) optimizes the work status of inspectors, investigators, and other personnel performing safety-related functions to ensure timely completion of safety oversight activities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13E114E9C245422EB6E14E550F8EE7B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) provides for personnel, including such personnel performing work related to aircraft certification and flight standards, who are responsible for actively working with regulated entities, external stakeholders, or other members of the public to be— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E35C46677B4B7E9A6A7A12C4BFFA50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) routinely available on a predictable basis for in-person and virtual communications with external persons; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H614812E5CAE7444F9CACCE8E0AB57B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not hindered from meeting with, visiting, auditing, or inspecting facilities or projects of regulated persons due to any telework policy; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC126DDAD04241C58CA099E21AF52447" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, shall evaluate and address any telework policies in effect on the day before such date of enactment to ensure that such policies meet the requirements of paragraph (1).

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2CB4204E698F4CD59246F7DE13CFB8EB" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 221. FAA TELEWORK <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC989B03FDED4C64A8EBD27B3E81BD88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40774DD5A17D4C4391D9454FEC12F2D2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may establish telework policies for employees of the FAA that allow for the Administrator to reduce the office footprint and associated expenses of the FAA, if appropriate, increase workforce retention, and provide flexibilities that the Administrator demonstrates increases efficiency and effectiveness of the Administration, while requiring that any such policy— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94D4B050D9A44D84BB07ED504B68F01A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) does not adversely impact the mission of the FAA; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43E850C917B24CA59D8B11FAEE48AE5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not reduce the safety or efficiency of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H310A19622020430DB68016D509338C7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) for any employee that is designated as an officer or executive in the FAA Executive System or a political appointee (as such term is defined in section 106 of title 49, United States Code)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82B49BA2853A480687892FDB0E3EE081" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) maximizes time at a duty station for such employee, excluding official travel; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6BF29958F574102849F88302AD11CB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) may include telework provisions as determined appropriate by the Administrator, commensurate with official duties for such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7CDCAE2D70124ADF8599F99022BB4A92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) provides for on-the-job training opportunities for FAA personnel that are not less than such opportunities available in 2019; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H513763D170654F67948F41AEFA3CDC7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) reflects the appropriate work status of employees based on the job functions of such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77EC46A06A13435BBB54DD46ADBA7F61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) optimizes the work status of inspectors, investigators, and other personnel performing safety-related functions to ensure timely completion of safety oversight activities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13E114E9C245422EB6E14E550F8EE7B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) provides for personnel, including such personnel performing work related to aircraft certification and flight standards, who are responsible for actively working with regulated entities, external stakeholders, or other members of the public to be— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E35C46677B4B7E9A6A7A12C4BFFA50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) routinely available on a predictable basis for in-person and virtual communications with external persons; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H614812E5CAE7444F9CACCE8E0AB57B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not hindered from meeting with, visiting, auditing, or inspecting facilities or projects of regulated persons due to any telework policy; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC126DDAD04241C58CA099E21AF52447" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, shall evaluate and address any telework policies in effect on the day before such date of enactment to ensure that such policies meet the requirements of paragraph (1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2CB4204E698F4CD59246F7DE13CFB8EB" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 221. FAA TELEWORK <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC989B03FDED4C64A8EBD27B3E81BD88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40774DD5A17D4C4391D9454FEC12F2D2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may establish telework policies for employees of the FAA that allow for the Administrator to reduce the office footprint and associated expenses of the FAA, if appropriate, increase workforce retention, and provide flexibilities that the Administrator demonstrates increases efficiency and effectiveness of the Administration, while requiring that any such policy— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94D4B050D9A44D84BB07ED504B68F01A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) does not adversely impact the mission of the FAA; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43E850C917B24CA59D8B11FAEE48AE5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not reduce the safety or efficiency of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H310A19622020430DB68016D509338C7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) for any employee that is designated as an officer or executive in the FAA Executive System or a political appointee (as such term is defined in section 106 of title 49, United States Code)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82B49BA2853A480687892FDB0E3EE081" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) maximizes time at a duty station for such employee, excluding official travel; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6BF29958F574102849F88302AD11CB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) may include telework provisions as determined appropriate by the Administrator, commensurate with official duties for such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7CDCAE2D70124ADF8599F99022BB4A92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) provides for on-the-job training opportunities for FAA personnel that are not less than such opportunities available in 2019; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H513763D170654F67948F41AEFA3CDC7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) reflects the appropriate work status of employees based on the job functions of such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77EC46A06A13435BBB54DD46ADBA7F61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) optimizes the work status of inspectors, investigators, and other personnel performing safety-related functions to ensure timely completion of safety oversight activities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13E114E9C245422EB6E14E550F8EE7B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) provides for personnel, including such personnel performing work related to aircraft certification and flight standards, who are responsible for actively working with regulated entities, external stakeholders, or other members of the public to be— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E35C46677B4B7E9A6A7A12C4BFFA50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) routinely available on a predictable basis for in-person and virtual communications with external persons; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H614812E5CAE7444F9CACCE8E0AB57B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not hindered from meeting with, visiting, auditing, or inspecting facilities or projects of regulated persons due to any telework policy; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC126DDAD04241C58CA099E21AF52447" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, shall evaluate and address any telework policies in effect on the day before such date of enactment to ensure that such policies meet the requirements of paragraph (1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies.

and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13E114E9C245422EB6E14E550F8EE7B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) provides for personnel, including such personnel performing work related to aircraft certification and flight standards, who are responsible for actively working with regulated entities, external stakeholders, or other members of the public to be— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E35C46677B4B7E9A6A7A12C4BFFA50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) routinely available on a predictable basis for in-person and virtual communications with external persons; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H614812E5CAE7444F9CACCE8E0AB57B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not hindered from meeting with, visiting, auditing, or inspecting facilities or projects of regulated persons due to any telework policy; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC126DDAD04241C58CA099E21AF52447" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, shall evaluate and address any telework policies in effect on the day before such date of enactment to ensure that such policies meet the requirements of paragraph (1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2CB4204E698F4CD59246F7DE13CFB8EB" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 221. FAA TELEWORK <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC989B03FDED4C64A8EBD27B3E81BD88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40774DD5A17D4C4391D9454FEC12F2D2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may establish telework policies for employees of the FAA that allow for the Administrator to reduce the office footprint and associated expenses of the FAA, if appropriate, increase workforce retention, and provide flexibilities that the Administrator demonstrates increases efficiency and effectiveness of the Administration, while requiring that any such policy— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94D4B050D9A44D84BB07ED504B68F01A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) does not adversely impact the mission of the FAA; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43E850C917B24CA59D8B11FAEE48AE5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not reduce the safety or efficiency of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H310A19622020430DB68016D509338C7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) for any employee that is designated as an officer or executive in the FAA Executive System or a political appointee (as such term is defined in section 106 of title 49, United States Code)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82B49BA2853A480687892FDB0E3EE081" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) maximizes time at a duty station for such employee, excluding official travel; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6BF29958F574102849F88302AD11CB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) may include telework provisions as determined appropriate by the Administrator, commensurate with official duties for such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7CDCAE2D70124ADF8599F99022BB4A92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) provides for on-the-job training opportunities for FAA personnel that are not less than such opportunities available in 2019; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H513763D170654F67948F41AEFA3CDC7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) reflects the appropriate work status of employees based on the job functions of such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77EC46A06A13435BBB54DD46ADBA7F61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) optimizes the work status of inspectors, investigators, and other personnel performing safety-related functions to ensure timely completion of safety oversight activities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13E114E9C245422EB6E14E550F8EE7B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) provides for personnel, including such personnel performing work related to aircraft certification and flight standards, who are responsible for actively working with regulated entities, external stakeholders, or other members of the public to be— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E35C46677B4B7E9A6A7A12C4BFFA50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) routinely available on a predictable basis for in-person and virtual communications with external persons; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H614812E5CAE7444F9CACCE8E0AB57B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not hindered from meeting with, visiting, auditing, or inspecting facilities or projects of regulated persons due to any telework policy; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC126DDAD04241C58CA099E21AF52447" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, shall evaluate and address any telework policies in effect on the day before such date of enactment to ensure that such policies meet the requirements of paragraph (1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9614CF8A60AF4A04924ED31EC88CFF9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation If the Administrator determines that telework agreements need to be updated to implement the requirements of subsection (a), the Administrator shall, prior to updating such agreements, consult with— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H905E5D2663554F6C8FF48CD9C16C261F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) exclusive bargaining representatives of air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9337CF3E2D364FAFA5D102977EE973BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) labor organizations certified under such section as the exclusive bargaining representative of airway transportation systems specialists and aviation safety inspectors and engineers of the FAA. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43F2918800AB42F9B96F17E769010200" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 222. In compiling such final report, the Secretary shall describe opportunities for— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF01D73BB84F74ECA9F56A474BF8E6308" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) consolidation of offices within a reasonable distance, as determined by the Senior Real Property Officer of the Department of Transportation, from one another; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11609DC594B54E89B079EA30A9A04510" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the collocation of regional or satellite offices of separate modes of the Department, including the costs and benefits of shared amenities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11EA993347DF43ABABA06C8E343C1466" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the use of coworking spaces instead of permanent offices.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H178511185242470B94B9676E8D0D4FA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 4 months after completing the review under subsection (a), the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a final report that proposes opportunities to optimize the domestic office footprint of the FAA (and associated costs). In compiling such final report, the Secretary shall describe opportunities for— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF01D73BB84F74ECA9F56A474BF8E6308" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) consolidation of offices within a reasonable distance, as determined by the Senior Real Property Officer of the Department of Transportation, from one another; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11609DC594B54E89B079EA30A9A04510" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the collocation of regional or satellite offices of separate modes of the Department, including the costs and benefits of shared amenities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11EA993347DF43ABABA06C8E343C1466" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the use of coworking spaces instead of permanent offices. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H59A31CB065134D77AF0C906D934D4C72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Domestic office footprint defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">domestic office footprint means buildings, offices, facilities, and other real property rented, owned, or occupied by the FAA or Department— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H83B99DC87DB14D34BF99AF7735407F37" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in which employees report for permanent or temporary duty that are not FAA Airport Traffic Control Towers, Terminal Radar Approach Control Facilities, Air Route Traffic Control Centers, and Combined Control Facilities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H839C4D1668FF46E6BAC910E6B11C0988" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) which are located within the United States.

In compiling such final report, the Secretary shall describe opportunities for— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF01D73BB84F74ECA9F56A474BF8E6308" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) consolidation of offices within a reasonable distance, as determined by the Senior Real Property Officer of the Department of Transportation, from one another; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11609DC594B54E89B079EA30A9A04510" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the collocation of regional or satellite offices of separate modes of the Department, including the costs and benefits of shared amenities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11EA993347DF43ABABA06C8E343C1466" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the use of coworking spaces instead of permanent offices. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H59A31CB065134D77AF0C906D934D4C72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Domestic office footprint defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">domestic office footprint means buildings, offices, facilities, and other real property rented, owned, or occupied by the FAA or Department— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H83B99DC87DB14D34BF99AF7735407F37" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in which employees report for permanent or temporary duty that are not FAA Airport Traffic Control Towers, Terminal Radar Approach Control Facilities, Air Route Traffic Control Centers, and Combined Control Facilities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H839C4D1668FF46E6BAC910E6B11C0988" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) which are located within the United States. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7938B151E9B54C909E6A9D67E88409EC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 223.

In compiling such final report, the Secretary shall describe opportunities for— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF01D73BB84F74ECA9F56A474BF8E6308" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) consolidation of offices within a reasonable distance, as determined by the Senior Real Property Officer of the Department of Transportation, from one another; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11609DC594B54E89B079EA30A9A04510" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the collocation of regional or satellite offices of separate modes of the Department, including the costs and benefits of shared amenities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11EA993347DF43ABABA06C8E343C1466" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the use of coworking spaces instead of permanent offices. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H59A31CB065134D77AF0C906D934D4C72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Domestic office footprint defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">domestic office footprint means buildings, offices, facilities, and other real property rented, owned, or occupied by the FAA or Department— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H83B99DC87DB14D34BF99AF7735407F37" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in which employees report for permanent or temporary duty that are not FAA Airport Traffic Control Towers, Terminal Radar Approach Control Facilities, Air Route Traffic Control Centers, and Combined Control Facilities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H839C4D1668FF46E6BAC910E6B11C0988" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) which are located within the United States. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7938B151E9B54C909E6A9D67E88409EC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 223.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7938B151E9B54C909E6A9D67E88409EC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 223. RESTORATION OF AUTHORITY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46D103F488CB418CACC18566F0873C32" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Chapter 401 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 40118 the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H3A8522C9FE554F2B8911F7C94D2744D3" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF6F18ABBC7F4FBE904CAC17EFF639C4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 40119. SENSITIVE SECURITY INFORMATION <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5EA13201AF2E444C88F3286BF95C10A1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Disclosure <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9FD7E7F4D5784289BC1CC3CCA99C2D2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Regulations prohibiting disclosure Notwithstanding the establishment of a Department of Homeland Security, the Secretary of Transportation, in accordance with section 552(b)(3)(B) of title 5, shall prescribe regulations prohibiting disclosure of information obtained or developed in ensuring security under this title if the Secretary of Transportation decides disclosing the information would— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3EABB91A54C408D82F59473A042CD5D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) be an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H511D8FB9F535441DB1A8416CB2CB8844" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reveal a trade secret or privileged or confidential commercial or financial information; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEE7762280674425C80AEFEB566E6CBC1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) be detrimental to transportation safety.

SENSITIVE SECURITY INFORMATION <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5EA13201AF2E444C88F3286BF95C10A1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Disclosure <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9FD7E7F4D5784289BC1CC3CCA99C2D2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Regulations prohibiting disclosure Notwithstanding the establishment of a Department of Homeland Security, the Secretary of Transportation, in accordance with section 552(b)(3)(B) of title 5, shall prescribe regulations prohibiting disclosure of information obtained or developed in ensuring security under this title if the Secretary of Transportation decides disclosing the information would— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3EABB91A54C408D82F59473A042CD5D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) be an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H511D8FB9F535441DB1A8416CB2CB8844" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reveal a trade secret or privileged or confidential commercial or financial information; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEE7762280674425C80AEFEB566E6CBC1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) be detrimental to transportation safety. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2BAB4B814EB64057B4ADFB988E44CC54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Disclosure to congress Paragraph (1) shall not be construed to authorize information to be withheld from a committee of Congress authorized to have such information. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55E5AF307FE84A7588CE7295E13FCF7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Rule of construction Nothing in paragraph (1) shall be construed to authorize the designation of information as sensitive security information (as such term is defined in section 15.5 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations) to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2752B1EA2E7C4B2C991AB63728338EF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conceal a violation of law, inefficiency, or administrative error; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0FD2518FE14E4E93B7FA18037337D29F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) prevent embarrassment to a person, organization, or agency; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2C6AA63C822049CC8FA4F971D778DB6E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) restrain competition; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE8E8B7449977415E8D187402948BC84A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) prevent or delay the release of information that does not require protection in the interest of transportation security, including basic scientific research information not clearly related to transportation security.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2BAB4B814EB64057B4ADFB988E44CC54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Disclosure to congress Paragraph (1) shall not be construed to authorize information to be withheld from a committee of Congress authorized to have such information. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55E5AF307FE84A7588CE7295E13FCF7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Rule of construction Nothing in paragraph (1) shall be construed to authorize the designation of information as sensitive security information (as such term is defined in section 15.5 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations) to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2752B1EA2E7C4B2C991AB63728338EF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conceal a violation of law, inefficiency, or administrative error; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0FD2518FE14E4E93B7FA18037337D29F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) prevent embarrassment to a person, organization, or agency; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2C6AA63C822049CC8FA4F971D778DB6E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) restrain competition; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE8E8B7449977415E8D187402948BC84A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) prevent or delay the release of information that does not require protection in the interest of transportation security, including basic scientific research information not clearly related to transportation security. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04CEA0406D64427AA780B1BECA1A90A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Law enforcement disclosure Section 552a of title 5 shall not apply to disclosures that the Administrator may make from the systems of records of the Federal Aviation Administration to any Federal law enforcement, intelligence, protective service, immigration, or national security official in order to assist the official receiving the information in the performance of official duties.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2BAB4B814EB64057B4ADFB988E44CC54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Disclosure to congress Paragraph (1) shall not be construed to authorize information to be withheld from a committee of Congress authorized to have such information. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55E5AF307FE84A7588CE7295E13FCF7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Rule of construction Nothing in paragraph (1) shall be construed to authorize the designation of information as sensitive security information (as such term is defined in section 15.5 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations) to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2752B1EA2E7C4B2C991AB63728338EF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conceal a violation of law, inefficiency, or administrative error; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0FD2518FE14E4E93B7FA18037337D29F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) prevent embarrassment to a person, organization, or agency; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2C6AA63C822049CC8FA4F971D778DB6E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) restrain competition; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE8E8B7449977415E8D187402948BC84A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) prevent or delay the release of information that does not require protection in the interest of transportation security, including basic scientific research information not clearly related to transportation security. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04CEA0406D64427AA780B1BECA1A90A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Law enforcement disclosure Section 552a of title 5 shall not apply to disclosures that the Administrator may make from the systems of records of the Federal Aviation Administration to any Federal law enforcement, intelligence, protective service, immigration, or national security official in order to assist the official receiving the information in the performance of official duties.

or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE8E8B7449977415E8D187402948BC84A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) prevent or delay the release of information that does not require protection in the interest of transportation security, including basic scientific research information not clearly related to transportation security. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04CEA0406D64427AA780B1BECA1A90A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Law enforcement disclosure Section 552a of title 5 shall not apply to disclosures that the Administrator may make from the systems of records of the Federal Aviation Administration to any Federal law enforcement, intelligence, protective service, immigration, or national security official in order to assist the official receiving the information in the performance of official duties. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE01B48B1DFD646839F6AD51D9D305DA6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Transfers of duties and powers prohibited Except as otherwise provided by law, a duty or power under this section may not be transferred to another department, agency, or instrumentality of the Federal Government.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04CEA0406D64427AA780B1BECA1A90A3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Law enforcement disclosure Section 552a of title 5 shall not apply to disclosures that the Administrator may make from the systems of records of the Federal Aviation Administration to any Federal law enforcement, intelligence, protective service, immigration, or national security official in order to assist the official receiving the information in the performance of official duties. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE01B48B1DFD646839F6AD51D9D305DA6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Transfers of duties and powers prohibited Except as otherwise provided by law, a duty or power under this section may not be transferred to another department, agency, or instrumentality of the Federal Government. .

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H79BD5D01A19044269B4721BEB66D60C4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Effective date The amendments made by this section shall be effective as of October 5, 2018, and all authority restored to the Secretary and the FAA under this section shall be treated as if such authority had never been repealed by the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H757E762CDBC0441193783ACFCFEE3CBF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Conforming amendment The analysis for chapter 401 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 40118 the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HF49FC7BC5FFF4607872C10394BA86534" style="OLC"> 40119. Sensitive security information.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0CAEA5E64BD44D09812D22A3F145297A" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 224. FAA PARTICIPATION IN INDUSTRY STANDARDS ORGANIZATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78961843C9344229AECD8ECA5A1800DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator shall encourage the participation of employees of the FAA, as appropriate, in the activities of recognized industry standards organizations to advance the adoption, reference, and acceptance rate of standards and means of compliance developed by such organizations by the Administrator. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H986205D181754E038AFA1E10E436395D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Participation An employee of the FAA directed by the Administrator to participate in a working group, task group, committee, or similar body of a recognized industry standards organization shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46CBB9C7D7004CB2AD21EF5583050F0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) actively participate in the discussions and work of such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H304F4223EE51404FBC85910F2A703D12" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) accurately represent the position of the Administrator on the subject matter of such discussions and work; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96405EF22BC6450B8823981DAD87CED5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) contribute to the development of work products of such organization, unless determined to be inappropriate by such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E55A864BE7D4F99A9B81B4410A19ACF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) make reasonable efforts to identify and make any concerns of the Administrator relating to such work products known to such organization, including through providing formal comments, as may be allowed for under the procedures of such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49EA1BAFD08F4A03BD24B265BC77DAF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) provide regular updates to other FAA employees and management on the progress of such work products; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8A82205B2361430EBCC0FC65F323930F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) seek advice and input from other FAA employees and management, as needed.

FAA PARTICIPATION IN INDUSTRY STANDARDS ORGANIZATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78961843C9344229AECD8ECA5A1800DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator shall encourage the participation of employees of the FAA, as appropriate, in the activities of recognized industry standards organizations to advance the adoption, reference, and acceptance rate of standards and means of compliance developed by such organizations by the Administrator. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H986205D181754E038AFA1E10E436395D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Participation An employee of the FAA directed by the Administrator to participate in a working group, task group, committee, or similar body of a recognized industry standards organization shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46CBB9C7D7004CB2AD21EF5583050F0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) actively participate in the discussions and work of such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H304F4223EE51404FBC85910F2A703D12" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) accurately represent the position of the Administrator on the subject matter of such discussions and work; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96405EF22BC6450B8823981DAD87CED5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) contribute to the development of work products of such organization, unless determined to be inappropriate by such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E55A864BE7D4F99A9B81B4410A19ACF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) make reasonable efforts to identify and make any concerns of the Administrator relating to such work products known to such organization, including through providing formal comments, as may be allowed for under the procedures of such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49EA1BAFD08F4A03BD24B265BC77DAF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) provide regular updates to other FAA employees and management on the progress of such work products; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8A82205B2361430EBCC0FC65F323930F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) seek advice and input from other FAA employees and management, as needed. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD60EB42812C244FA847FDEC7A795FC88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Recognized industry standards organization defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">recognized industry standards organization means a domestic or international organization that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H25A7D4BF0773416DBB2A525F0D3ED75E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) uses agreed upon procedures to develop aviation-related industry standards or means of compliance, including standards or means of compliance that satisfy FAA requirements or guidance; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCBD2B97C4F4F4E0F99BE9128AE23121B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) is comprised of members of the public, including subject matter experts, industry representatives, academics and researchers, and government employees; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF8DF8606F464958B386A1D22A6D2E08" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) has had at least 1 standard or means of compliance accepted by the Administrator or referenced in guidance material or a regulation issued by the FAA after the date of enactment of the Vision 100—Century of Aviation Reauthorization Act (Public Law 108–176).

and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF8DF8606F464958B386A1D22A6D2E08" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) has had at least 1 standard or means of compliance accepted by the Administrator or referenced in guidance material or a regulation issued by the FAA after the date of enactment of the Vision 100—Century of Aviation Reauthorization Act (Public Law 108–176).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H986205D181754E038AFA1E10E436395D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Participation An employee of the FAA directed by the Administrator to participate in a working group, task group, committee, or similar body of a recognized industry standards organization shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46CBB9C7D7004CB2AD21EF5583050F0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) actively participate in the discussions and work of such organization; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55DCF63C9F664FFDB7874E3858DF0990" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">and implemented and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">, implemented, and periodically updated; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D5668D71FD4155B240951F8B1110C4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in subparagraph (B) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Within and all that follows through <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the Administrator and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Administrator; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09950C59BDCE434CBFD7B4B9F97BFD27" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B9D36459300417C8DFD928A1AAE05CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) by inserting after paragraph (3) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H70A54DF568D34328B0C0310B35EBD61D" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12A3B62F7E6F45AB830246A788C06D99" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Commercial products and services In implementing and updating the acquisition management system pursuant to paragraph (1), the Administrator shall, whenever possible— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE479AA31F8794F809EA8107B757C11F8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) describe the requirements with respect to a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services in terms of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF69B6EB48FD4658961C4A3337645C69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) functions to be performed; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3B744F4D4354878BE26641DEEAE3435" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) performance required; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3F1F0E6C68947CCB50E814D6B66B946" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) essential physical and system characteristics; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB39C4F1A2ED4443B9E69B3662ADD86CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) ensure that commercial services or commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, ensure that nondevelopmental items other than commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75D3EC981A1A47299E25DF666CC9140A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide offerors of commercial services, commercial products, and nondevelopmental items other than commercial products an opportunity to compete in any solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE68C1F74069F45EEA6C6F73275AF47F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) revise the procurement policies, practices, and procedures of the Administration to reduce any impediments to the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5A69A36304049239909DA7089D01DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) ensure that any procurement of new equipment takes into account the life cycle, reliability, performance, service support, and costs to guarantee the acquisition of equipment that is of high quality and reliability resulting in greater performance and cost-related benefits; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H536F913356014123881E3437F22EE422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) ensure that procurement officials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDC3F25E02C548EC8E0027DBE502DEA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) acquire commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products to meet the needs of the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E9ECDAB5251429AA40E6C5FDB8860FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) in a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services, state the specifications for such supplies or services in terms that enable and encourage bidders and offerors to supply commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, to supply nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF1CB7835BDC4B76A0917B30BD5C5F9F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) require that prime contractors and subcontractors at all levels under contracts with the Administration incorporate commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products as components of items supplied to the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H434F4E26849943E996266F7C47474DF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) modify procurement requirements in appropriate circumstances to ensure that such requirements can be met by commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDE0FBCF44D54972AB24871D8A7EA0B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) require training of appropriate personnel in the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75D3EC981A1A47299E25DF666CC9140A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide offerors of commercial services, commercial products, and nondevelopmental items other than commercial products an opportunity to compete in any solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE68C1F74069F45EEA6C6F73275AF47F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) revise the procurement policies, practices, and procedures of the Administration to reduce any impediments to the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5A69A36304049239909DA7089D01DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) ensure that any procurement of new equipment takes into account the life cycle, reliability, performance, service support, and costs to guarantee the acquisition of equipment that is of high quality and reliability resulting in greater performance and cost-related benefits; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H536F913356014123881E3437F22EE422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) ensure that procurement officials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDC3F25E02C548EC8E0027DBE502DEA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) acquire commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products to meet the needs of the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E9ECDAB5251429AA40E6C5FDB8860FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) in a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services, state the specifications for such supplies or services in terms that enable and encourage bidders and offerors to supply commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, to supply nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF1CB7835BDC4B76A0917B30BD5C5F9F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) require that prime contractors and subcontractors at all levels under contracts with the Administration incorporate commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products as components of items supplied to the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H434F4E26849943E996266F7C47474DF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) modify procurement requirements in appropriate circumstances to ensure that such requirements can be met by commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDE0FBCF44D54972AB24871D8A7EA0B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) require training of appropriate personnel in the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services. .

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB39C4F1A2ED4443B9E69B3662ADD86CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) ensure that commercial services or commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, ensure that nondevelopmental items other than commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75D3EC981A1A47299E25DF666CC9140A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide offerors of commercial services, commercial products, and nondevelopmental items other than commercial products an opportunity to compete in any solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE68C1F74069F45EEA6C6F73275AF47F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) revise the procurement policies, practices, and procedures of the Administration to reduce any impediments to the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5A69A36304049239909DA7089D01DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) ensure that any procurement of new equipment takes into account the life cycle, reliability, performance, service support, and costs to guarantee the acquisition of equipment that is of high quality and reliability resulting in greater performance and cost-related benefits; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H536F913356014123881E3437F22EE422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) ensure that procurement officials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDC3F25E02C548EC8E0027DBE502DEA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) acquire commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products to meet the needs of the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E9ECDAB5251429AA40E6C5FDB8860FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) in a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services, state the specifications for such supplies or services in terms that enable and encourage bidders and offerors to supply commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, to supply nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF1CB7835BDC4B76A0917B30BD5C5F9F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) require that prime contractors and subcontractors at all levels under contracts with the Administration incorporate commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products as components of items supplied to the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H434F4E26849943E996266F7C47474DF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) modify procurement requirements in appropriate circumstances to ensure that such requirements can be met by commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDE0FBCF44D54972AB24871D8A7EA0B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) require training of appropriate personnel in the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services. .

and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55DCF63C9F664FFDB7874E3858DF0990" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">and implemented and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">, implemented, and periodically updated; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D5668D71FD4155B240951F8B1110C4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in subparagraph (B) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Within and all that follows through <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the Administrator and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Administrator; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09950C59BDCE434CBFD7B4B9F97BFD27" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B9D36459300417C8DFD928A1AAE05CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) by inserting after paragraph (3) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H70A54DF568D34328B0C0310B35EBD61D" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12A3B62F7E6F45AB830246A788C06D99" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Commercial products and services In implementing and updating the acquisition management system pursuant to paragraph (1), the Administrator shall, whenever possible— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE479AA31F8794F809EA8107B757C11F8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) describe the requirements with respect to a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services in terms of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF69B6EB48FD4658961C4A3337645C69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) functions to be performed; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3B744F4D4354878BE26641DEEAE3435" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) performance required; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3F1F0E6C68947CCB50E814D6B66B946" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) essential physical and system characteristics; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB39C4F1A2ED4443B9E69B3662ADD86CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) ensure that commercial services or commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, ensure that nondevelopmental items other than commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75D3EC981A1A47299E25DF666CC9140A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide offerors of commercial services, commercial products, and nondevelopmental items other than commercial products an opportunity to compete in any solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE68C1F74069F45EEA6C6F73275AF47F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) revise the procurement policies, practices, and procedures of the Administration to reduce any impediments to the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5A69A36304049239909DA7089D01DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) ensure that any procurement of new equipment takes into account the life cycle, reliability, performance, service support, and costs to guarantee the acquisition of equipment that is of high quality and reliability resulting in greater performance and cost-related benefits; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H536F913356014123881E3437F22EE422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) ensure that procurement officials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDC3F25E02C548EC8E0027DBE502DEA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) acquire commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products to meet the needs of the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E9ECDAB5251429AA40E6C5FDB8860FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) in a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services, state the specifications for such supplies or services in terms that enable and encourage bidders and offerors to supply commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, to supply nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF1CB7835BDC4B76A0917B30BD5C5F9F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) require that prime contractors and subcontractors at all levels under contracts with the Administration incorporate commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products as components of items supplied to the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H434F4E26849943E996266F7C47474DF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) modify procurement requirements in appropriate circumstances to ensure that such requirements can be met by commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDE0FBCF44D54972AB24871D8A7EA0B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) require training of appropriate personnel in the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services. .

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E25B840BAAE4648A1C521B6602076A7" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 229. ADVANCED AVIATION TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION STEERING COMMITTEE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD30F76420EF74CE398E741AF9C029D7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an Advanced Aviation Technology and Innovation Steering Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Steering Committee) to assist the FAA in planning for and integrating advanced aviation technologies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE76F6CDBCAF04E32815D9B0FEBEBDDEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Purpose The Steering Committee shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H187DA3B67F5546C5906E6C439CBCD5C0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) create and regularly update a comprehensive strategy and action plan for integrating advanced aviation technologies into the national airspace system and aviation ecosystem; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12C5D8FB9C394111A4D99ECE9AC2EAFF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) provide direction and resolution for complex issues related to advanced aviation technologies that span multiple offices or lines of business of the FAA, as needed.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E25B840BAAE4648A1C521B6602076A7" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 229.
