ADVANCED AVIATION TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION STEERING COMMITTEE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD30F76420EF74CE398E741AF9C029D7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an Advanced Aviation Technology and Innovation Steering Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Steering Committee) to assist the FAA in planning for and integrating advanced aviation technologies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE76F6CDBCAF04E32815D9B0FEBEBDDEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Purpose The Steering Committee shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H187DA3B67F5546C5906E6C439CBCD5C0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) create and regularly update a comprehensive strategy and action plan for integrating advanced aviation technologies into the national airspace system and aviation ecosystem; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12C5D8FB9C394111A4D99ECE9AC2EAFF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) provide direction and resolution for complex issues related to advanced aviation technologies that span multiple offices or lines of business of the FAA, as needed. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00B9C0982FD44BB28B5C797F4483E77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Chair The Deputy Administrator of the FAA shall serve as the Chair of the Steering Committee.

ADVANCED AVIATION TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION STEERING COMMITTEE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD30F76420EF74CE398E741AF9C029D7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Establishment Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an Advanced Aviation Technology and Innovation Steering Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Steering Committee) to assist the FAA in planning for and integrating advanced aviation technologies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE76F6CDBCAF04E32815D9B0FEBEBDDEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Purpose The Steering Committee shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H187DA3B67F5546C5906E6C439CBCD5C0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) create and regularly update a comprehensive strategy and action plan for integrating advanced aviation technologies into the national airspace system and aviation ecosystem; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12C5D8FB9C394111A4D99ECE9AC2EAFF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) provide direction and resolution for complex issues related to advanced aviation technologies that span multiple offices or lines of business of the FAA, as needed. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00B9C0982FD44BB28B5C797F4483E77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Chair The Deputy Administrator of the FAA shall serve as the Chair of the Steering Committee.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00B9C0982FD44BB28B5C797F4483E77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Chair The Deputy Administrator of the FAA shall serve as the Chair of the Steering Committee. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB264BB642D6D414CA25B4A772F9B4C6B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Composition In addition to the Chair, the Steering Committee shall consist of the Assistant or Associate Administrator, or the designee of such Administrator, of each of the following FAA offices: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78C1D70A9CB8449B885361905662ACEB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Office of Aviation Safety. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB112959EE1E54516918397315ECAAB07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Air Traffic Organization.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00B9C0982FD44BB28B5C797F4483E77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Chair The Deputy Administrator of the FAA shall serve as the Chair of the Steering Committee. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB264BB642D6D414CA25B4A772F9B4C6B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Composition In addition to the Chair, the Steering Committee shall consist of the Assistant or Associate Administrator, or the designee of such Administrator, of each of the following FAA offices: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78C1D70A9CB8449B885361905662ACEB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Office of Aviation Safety. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB112959EE1E54516918397315ECAAB07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Air Traffic Organization.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB23980DC2DC4AD48B74C3C22EF4E8E4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 231. IMPLEMENTATION OF ANTI-TERRORIST AND NARCOTIC AIR EVENTS PROGRAMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03BE955EC23846059C599302F7103FF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Implementation <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H156846A71DCC407BB629BBAD5103D379" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Priority recommendations Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Administrator shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA67DEE81E31426A9AC17B9BF7F06556" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) implement recommendations 6, 13, 14, and 15 as set forth in the Government Accountability Office report entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Aviation: FAA Needs to Better Prevent, Detect, and Respond to Fraud and Abuse Risks in Aircraft Registration, (dated March 25, 2020); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03AD2FA032A7429792593D0E0BCD979D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) to the extent that rulemaking is necessary to implement such recommendations, issue a notice of proposed rulemaking pursuant to the rulemaking authority of the FAA. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB2FC9933C95B42D9A16286A7219CBF6B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Remaining recommendations The Administrator shall implement recommendations 1 through 5 and 8 through 12 as set forth in the Government Accountability Office report described in paragraph (1) and, to the extent that rulemaking is necessary to implement such recommendations, issue a notice of proposed rulemaking pursuant to the rulemaking authority of the FAA, on the earlier of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB0330F84EA24125A3CB407339C69253" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date that is 90 days after the date on which the FAA implements the Civil Aviation Registry Electronic Services system; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3F1BDD7AEAC14117A1EBF86F0E94C1E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) January 1, 2026.

or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3F1BDD7AEAC14117A1EBF86F0E94C1E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) January 1, 2026. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H31C02D6D2A90461E82464D5A3F53501F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Reports <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13C1CA5A8BD74C9FB8A850A9AA4D8CE5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Priority recommendations Not later than 60 days after the date on which the Administrator implements the recommendations under subsection (a)(1), the Administrator shall submit to the Committees on the Judiciary and Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committees on the Judiciary and Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives, and the Caucus on International Narcotics Control of the Senate a report on such implementation, including a description of any steps taken by the Administrator to complete such implementation.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDAAABA4DD4CE4C3084084E399A80C835" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) The date of completion of the work performed at each such location. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0B2C5D9A0D8C4848BAEE1C09B463AEC5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) A list of all failures, malfunctions, or defects affecting the safe operation of such aircraft identified by the air carrier not later than 30 days after the date on which an aircraft is returned to service, organized by reference to aircraft registration number, that— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H69CE3E67C7D04864854D34FD6AC8F91E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) requires corrective action after the aircraft is approved for return to service; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H38A5D03A1301403B8860ED4CF7CB3050" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) results from such work performed on such aircraft. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H91DAFEEE7ABA4512B4F13ED521AB8685" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) The certificate number of the person approving such aircraft or on-wing aircraft engine for return to service following completion of the work performed at each such location.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDAAABA4DD4CE4C3084084E399A80C835" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) The date of completion of the work performed at each such location. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0B2C5D9A0D8C4848BAEE1C09B463AEC5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) A list of all failures, malfunctions, or defects affecting the safe operation of such aircraft identified by the air carrier not later than 30 days after the date on which an aircraft is returned to service, organized by reference to aircraft registration number, that— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H69CE3E67C7D04864854D34FD6AC8F91E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) requires corrective action after the aircraft is approved for return to service; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H38A5D03A1301403B8860ED4CF7CB3050" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) results from such work performed on such aircraft. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H91DAFEEE7ABA4512B4F13ED521AB8685" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) The certificate number of the person approving such aircraft or on-wing aircraft engine for return to service following completion of the work performed at each such location.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDAAABA4DD4CE4C3084084E399A80C835" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) The date of completion of the work performed at each such location. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0B2C5D9A0D8C4848BAEE1C09B463AEC5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) A list of all failures, malfunctions, or defects affecting the safe operation of such aircraft identified by the air carrier not later than 30 days after the date on which an aircraft is returned to service, organized by reference to aircraft registration number, that— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H69CE3E67C7D04864854D34FD6AC8F91E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) requires corrective action after the aircraft is approved for return to service; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H38A5D03A1301403B8860ED4CF7CB3050" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) results from such work performed on such aircraft. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H91DAFEEE7ABA4512B4F13ED521AB8685" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) The certificate number of the person approving such aircraft or on-wing aircraft engine for return to service following completion of the work performed at each such location.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H91DAFEEE7ABA4512B4F13ED521AB8685" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) The certificate number of the person approving such aircraft or on-wing aircraft engine for return to service following completion of the work performed at each such location. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE64DC2E9A0DD4BCAAD293F725E93487F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Analysis The Administrator shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4D5B0DEA8EFA44599564A6BDD376C16E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) analyze information provided under this subsection and sections 121.703, 121.705, 121.707, and 145.221 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, or any successor provisions of such title, to detect safety issues associated with heavy maintenance work on aircraft performed outside the United States; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8A5F0A360E64410C994E7477034B44C7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) require appropriate actions by an air carrier or repair station in response to any safety issue identified by the analysis conducted under subparagraph (A). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9DEBECE281ED4642843178F2D39D024B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Confidentiality Information provided under this subsection shall be subject to the same protections given to voluntarily provided safety or security related information under section 40123.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFADB42D6FC774C5D8E6DA21559063FE5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Exception Paragraph (1) shall not apply to an application for the renewal of a certificate issued under part 145 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC03A040BD1DF47E1986A7D87A747CFA1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Maintenance implementation procedures agreement The Administrator may elect not to enter into a new maintenance implementation procedures agreement with a country classified as Category 2, for as long as the country remains classified as Category 2. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3DB024B606D4CD896F43D18DF9CC131" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Prohibition on continued heavy maintenance work No part 121 air carrier may enter into a new contract for heavy maintenance work with a person located or headquartered in a country that the Administrator, through the International Aviation Safety Assessment program, has classified as Category 2, for as long as such country remains classified as Category 2.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD6AFE182B0446FD95C280DBEA37E86A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Minimum qualifications for mechanics and others working on U.S. registered aircraft <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB6D348302F64A4A86A72619BC35BC8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Administrator shall require that, at each covered repair station— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD3936974F6444ACA9E74DC951F85C77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) all supervisory personnel of such station are appropriately certificated as a mechanic or repairman under part 65 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, or under an equivalent certification or licensing regime, as determined by the Administrator; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C2411A6F3C94FC1BC66B198EAFA9007" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) all personnel of such station authorized to approve an article for return to service are appropriately certificated as a mechanic or repairman under part 65 of such title, or under an equivalent certification or licensing regime, as determined by the Administrator. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF95F4019669A4B0796C18C899D00D1A8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Available for consultation Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Administrator shall require any individual who is responsible for approving an article for return to service or who is directly in charge of heavy maintenance work performed on aircraft operated by a part 121 air carrier be available for consultation while work is being performed at a covered repair station. .

. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3AC6BAF82E924F5897936185AA678EB5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Definitions <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0F8DFCD0E1CB456AA2497931B7342CAF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Section 44733(j) of title 49, United States Code (as redesignated by this section), is amended— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H597A39766F574B43BB653C854A36B71E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">aircraft and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">aircraft (including on-wing aircraft engines); <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7396808030D04F46B83BE3C7206A4269" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (3) as paragraphs (2) through (4), respectively; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC662F2787EA46AD93A0A0EBC27796E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) by inserting before paragraph (2), as so redesignated, the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HBAA4151E629E4F1083283602E137230E" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0C92AB5C50D488081AB0EDB5A6C0F5B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Covered repair station The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered repair station means a facility that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35AE9C045F3943959D98D64A553472A5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) is located outside the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77991C39651B42498AC3E9EE5B3D2E60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) is a part 145 repair station; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1622C2144080480BA2768B153C4F01D4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) performs heavy maintenance work on aircraft operated by a part 121 air carrier. .

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H584B1468009C4D6FA258F2EF9BA90E3B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Alcohol and drug testing and background checks <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H971063AD67664BABB67684ADBCFAA304" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall issue a final rule carrying out the requirements of section 2112(b) of the FAA Extension, Safety, and Security Act of 2016 (49 U.S.C. 44733 note).

44733 note). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6A2F7AC046F47D89DF18942477BE7E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Rulemaking on assessment requirement With respect to any employee not covered under the requirements of section 1554.101 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, the Administrator shall initiate a rulemaking (or request that the head of another Federal agency initiate a rulemaking) that requires a covered repair station to confirm that any such employee has successfully completed an assessment commensurate with a security threat assessment described in subpart C of part 1540 of such title. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3243A56241F4C319812C9A462DE0835" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Definition of covered repair station For purposes of this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered repair station means a facility that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H751E8D41CD7A497883DEC1F5FED2AB06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) is located outside the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB0B2D2CC83643EAB61129FA16D1EB23" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) is certificated under part 145 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE98967A8EAFB4B05B99185D64ADB7A50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) performs heavy maintenance work on aircraft (including on-wing aircraft engines), operated under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.

44733 note). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6A2F7AC046F47D89DF18942477BE7E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Rulemaking on assessment requirement With respect to any employee not covered under the requirements of section 1554.101 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, the Administrator shall initiate a rulemaking (or request that the head of another Federal agency initiate a rulemaking) that requires a covered repair station to confirm that any such employee has successfully completed an assessment commensurate with a security threat assessment described in subpart C of part 1540 of such title. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3243A56241F4C319812C9A462DE0835" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Definition of covered repair station For purposes of this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered repair station means a facility that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H751E8D41CD7A497883DEC1F5FED2AB06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) is located outside the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB0B2D2CC83643EAB61129FA16D1EB23" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) is certificated under part 145 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE98967A8EAFB4B05B99185D64ADB7A50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) performs heavy maintenance work on aircraft (including on-wing aircraft engines), operated under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H80AE3319012E4564B5A9ED2E875577E9" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 304. TRAINING OF ORGANIZATION DELEGATION AUTHORIZATION UNIT MEMBERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFEB512C8056C4A06993BE139370A293C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Unit member annual ethics training Section 44736 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HC01B2272061E412CAB3279ABBD3EE014" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5B04D83AF6534B9EB6471B01914DA427" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Ethics training requirement for ODA holders <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93400A65A1904A9685BC74B2E594EE84" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall review and ensure each ODA holder authorized by the Administrator under section 44702(d) has in effect a recurrent training program for all ODA unit members that covers— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB7855D2564EA4079A86C6FD29D40FCBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) unit member professional obligations and responsibilities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC92E9371D414CE6BBECD17317B0A71A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the ODA holder’s code of ethics as required to be established under section 102(f) of the Aircraft Certification, Safety, and Accountability Act (49 U.S.C. 44701 note); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H63A98978A8FA4D24AC38782EF70888BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) procedures for reporting safety concerns, as described in the respective approved procedures manual for the delegation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96D415316E124F208619FF5CD9543A56" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the prohibition against and reporting procedures for interference from a supervisor or other ODA member described in section 44742; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H14AC44154BFC4D32A7A2131D46E00EE0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) any additional information the Administrator considers relevant to maintaining ethical and professional standards across all ODA holders and unit members.

TRAINING OF ORGANIZATION DELEGATION AUTHORIZATION UNIT MEMBERS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFEB512C8056C4A06993BE139370A293C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Unit member annual ethics training Section 44736 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HC01B2272061E412CAB3279ABBD3EE014" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5B04D83AF6534B9EB6471B01914DA427" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Ethics training requirement for ODA holders <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93400A65A1904A9685BC74B2E594EE84" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall review and ensure each ODA holder authorized by the Administrator under section 44702(d) has in effect a recurrent training program for all ODA unit members that covers— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB7855D2564EA4079A86C6FD29D40FCBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) unit member professional obligations and responsibilities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC92E9371D414CE6BBECD17317B0A71A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the ODA holder’s code of ethics as required to be established under section 102(f) of the Aircraft Certification, Safety, and Accountability Act (49 U.S.C. 44701 note); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H63A98978A8FA4D24AC38782EF70888BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) procedures for reporting safety concerns, as described in the respective approved procedures manual for the delegation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96D415316E124F208619FF5CD9543A56" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the prohibition against and reporting procedures for interference from a supervisor or other ODA member described in section 44742; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H14AC44154BFC4D32A7A2131D46E00EE0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) any additional information the Administrator considers relevant to maintaining ethical and professional standards across all ODA holders and unit members. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H85509B83A15D4A81B3BC89BA133D4150" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) FAA review <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB9CFCDB4434497FBB5EF91B9D94425B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Review of training program The Organization Designation Authorization Office of the Administration established under subsection (b) shall review each ODA holders’ recurrent training program to ensure such program includes— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0AE845E41C504A21952535A611D1C64E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) all elements described in paragraph (1); and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45B6F0B59F0F46479EBD5D4BA08826C7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) training to instill professionalism and clear understanding among ODA unit members about the purpose of and procedures associated with safety management systems, including the provisions of the third edition of the Safety Management Manual issued by the International Civil Aviation Organization (Doc 9859) (or any successor edition).

44701 note); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H63A98978A8FA4D24AC38782EF70888BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) procedures for reporting safety concerns, as described in the respective approved procedures manual for the delegation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96D415316E124F208619FF5CD9543A56" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the prohibition against and reporting procedures for interference from a supervisor or other ODA member described in section 44742; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H14AC44154BFC4D32A7A2131D46E00EE0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) any additional information the Administrator considers relevant to maintaining ethical and professional standards across all ODA holders and unit members. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H85509B83A15D4A81B3BC89BA133D4150" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) FAA review <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB9CFCDB4434497FBB5EF91B9D94425B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Review of training program The Organization Designation Authorization Office of the Administration established under subsection (b) shall review each ODA holders’ recurrent training program to ensure such program includes— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0AE845E41C504A21952535A611D1C64E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) all elements described in paragraph (1); and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45B6F0B59F0F46479EBD5D4BA08826C7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) training to instill professionalism and clear understanding among ODA unit members about the purpose of and procedures associated with safety management systems, including the provisions of the third edition of the Safety Management Manual issued by the International Civil Aviation Organization (Doc 9859) (or any successor edition). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06F45F7CD38C476FBF7107D46F1482EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Changes to program Such Office may require changes to the training program considered necessary to maintain ethical and professional standards across all ODA holders and unit members.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06F45F7CD38C476FBF7107D46F1482EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Changes to program Such Office may require changes to the training program considered necessary to maintain ethical and professional standards across all ODA holders and unit members. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE3674F58FC7942DAAB6B9F1E7971F12B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Training As part of the recurrent training program required under paragraph (1), not later than 60 business days after being designated as an ODA unit member, and annually thereafter, each ODA unit member shall complete the ethics training required by the ODA holder of the respective ODA unit member in order to exercise the functions delegated under the ODA. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4DF78433998E4490BA9AEB8812B9442B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Accountability The Administrator shall establish such processes or requirements as are necessary to ensure compliance with paragraph (3).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06F45F7CD38C476FBF7107D46F1482EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Changes to program Such Office may require changes to the training program considered necessary to maintain ethical and professional standards across all ODA holders and unit members. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE3674F58FC7942DAAB6B9F1E7971F12B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Training As part of the recurrent training program required under paragraph (1), not later than 60 business days after being designated as an ODA unit member, and annually thereafter, each ODA unit member shall complete the ethics training required by the ODA holder of the respective ODA unit member in order to exercise the functions delegated under the ODA. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4DF78433998E4490BA9AEB8812B9442B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Accountability The Administrator shall establish such processes or requirements as are necessary to ensure compliance with paragraph (3).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE3674F58FC7942DAAB6B9F1E7971F12B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Training As part of the recurrent training program required under paragraph (1), not later than 60 business days after being designated as an ODA unit member, and annually thereafter, each ODA unit member shall complete the ethics training required by the ODA holder of the respective ODA unit member in order to exercise the functions delegated under the ODA. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4DF78433998E4490BA9AEB8812B9442B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Accountability The Administrator shall establish such processes or requirements as are necessary to ensure compliance with paragraph (3). .

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA189C123FCA44EECA6789FC68594118B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Deadline An ODA unit member authorized to perform delegated functions under an ODA prior to the date of completion of an ethics training required under section 44736(g) of title 49, United States Code, shall complete such training not later than 60 days after the training program is approved by the Administrator pursuant to such section. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H83944498DAC54C259C8A4B4B949A9F7B" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 305.

SCALABILITY OF SAFETY MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS In conducting any rulemaking to require, or implementing a regulation requiring, a safety management system, the Administrator shall consider the scalability of such safety management system requirements, to the full range of entities in terms of size or complexity that may be affected by such rulemaking or regulation, including— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90A8181FB3FA4E30B10A5F76A0308C18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) how an entity can demonstrate compliance using various documentation, tools, and methods, including, as appropriate, systems with multiple small operators collectively monitoring for and addressing risks; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H70BD14E941DB496CB53EDDD09900A28A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a review of traditional safety management techniques and the suitability of such techniques for small entities; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAFD9F22FB9294FCD8452DB0CE131FECC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the applicability of existing safety management system programs implemented by an entity; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD044957343154FD5B74EAE6D14F7CB8B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the suitability of existing requirements under part 5 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, for small entities; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5099280596034BB6B8826801C6E14170" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) other unique challenges relating to small entities the Administrator determines appropriate to consider. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H178D4F98AC424F54A3E755655C1CF3C9" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 309. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC0FA9A50148E4497987D3EFE52B3FCA3" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 310. INDEPENDENT STUDY ON FUTURE STATE OF TYPE CERTIFICATION PROCESSES <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F4FE86AF23547AC9068A4BE559F82BD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Review and study Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall seek to enter into an agreement with an appropriate federally funded research and development center, or other independent nonprofit organization that recommends solutions to aviation policy challenges through objective analysis, to conduct a review and study in accordance with the requirements and elements in this section. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H613D749086BE448EA390D6347C302137" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The entity carrying out the review and study pursuant to subsection (a) shall provide analyses, assessments, and recommendations that address the following elements: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9AA1FDB916AE46C2945CCBB6E3713667" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) A vision for a future state of type certification that reflects the highly complex, highly integrated nature of modern aircraft and improvements in aviation safety.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFEFA414F2D844A7EA4D228455C9BA114" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) An assessment of digital tools, techniques, and software systems that allow for efficient and virtual evaluation of an applicant design, associated documentation, and software or systems engineering products, including in digital 3-dimensional formats or using model-based systems engineering design techniques. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE82327C229234A9DBD9587B7CD75B470" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) How the FAA could develop a risk-based model for type certification that improves the safety of aircraft. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93107C6C67564B05AA43270D3EAAA6DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) What changes are needed to ensure that corrective actions for continued operational safety issues, including software modifications, can be approved and implemented in a timely manner while maintaining the integrity of the type certification process.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE82327C229234A9DBD9587B7CD75B470" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) How the FAA could develop a risk-based model for type certification that improves the safety of aircraft. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93107C6C67564B05AA43270D3EAAA6DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) What changes are needed to ensure that corrective actions for continued operational safety issues, including software modifications, can be approved and implemented in a timely manner while maintaining the integrity of the type certification process. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84E19885584B4CEC86BC28C686107C8D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) What efficiencies and safety process improvements are needed in the type certification processes of the FAA to facilitate the assessment and integration of innovative technologies and advance aviation safety, such as conducting product familiarization, developing certification requirements, and demonstrating flight test safety readiness.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93107C6C67564B05AA43270D3EAAA6DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) What changes are needed to ensure that corrective actions for continued operational safety issues, including software modifications, can be approved and implemented in a timely manner while maintaining the integrity of the type certification process. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84E19885584B4CEC86BC28C686107C8D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) What efficiencies and safety process improvements are needed in the type certification processes of the FAA to facilitate the assessment and integration of innovative technologies and advance aviation safety, such as conducting product familiarization, developing certification requirements, and demonstrating flight test safety readiness. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC85B3261D7C24F83BFB8D25FB9587D33" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Best practices and tools used by other certification authorities outside of the United States that could be adopted by the FAA, as well as the best practices and tools used by the FAA which can be shared with certification authorities outside of the United States.

citations.text: section 102(2)(C) of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7DC0BD27E914D8684A0585E6B8F533C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Report Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the entity conducting the review and study pursuant to subsection (a) shall submit to the Administrator and the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the results of the review and study that includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5B7C99931BB4EBAB4CBA70EDDB055D3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the findings and recommendations of the entity; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE46CED9BBA3D4DEBA598229515E5D909" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an assessment of whether digital tools, techniques, and software systems could improve the coordination, oversight, or safety of the certification and validation activities of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2ACC2868D9484DC99EB3ADB66C2CA7FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Congressional briefing Not later than 270 days after the report required under subsection (e) is received by the Administrator, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H99BFA390B81B4A11935C03A7B0652E23" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) any actions the FAA proposes to take as a result of such findings and recommendations; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1797016AD0C04D4C991CA4EA790DE327" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the rationale of the FAA for not taking action on any specific recommendation, as applicable. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDE4301E0F4C44D093A5101C6809D42F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 311.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2ACC2868D9484DC99EB3ADB66C2CA7FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Congressional briefing Not later than 270 days after the report required under subsection (e) is received by the Administrator, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H99BFA390B81B4A11935C03A7B0652E23" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) any actions the FAA proposes to take as a result of such findings and recommendations; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1797016AD0C04D4C991CA4EA790DE327" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the rationale of the FAA for not taking action on any specific recommendation, as applicable. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDE4301E0F4C44D093A5101C6809D42F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 311. USE OF ADVANCED TOOLS AND HIGH-RISK FLIGHT TESTING IN CERTIFYING AEROSPACE PRODUCTS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7D0D6465C40443D493B00D74DD8F10F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Assessment Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall complete an assessment of the use of advanced tools during the testing, analysis, and verification stages of aerospace certification projects to reduce the risks associated with high-risk flight profiles and performing limit testing.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDE4301E0F4C44D093A5101C6809D42F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 311. USE OF ADVANCED TOOLS AND HIGH-RISK FLIGHT TESTING IN CERTIFYING AEROSPACE PRODUCTS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7D0D6465C40443D493B00D74DD8F10F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Assessment Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall complete an assessment of the use of advanced tools during the testing, analysis, and verification stages of aerospace certification projects to reduce the risks associated with high-risk flight profiles and performing limit testing. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDA6787744D8D4B4BAB7B8EB5FF7B289A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Considerations In carrying out the assessment under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consider— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C168E3ED82A400D8959C5D4ADD68A44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) instances in which high-risk flight profiles and limit testing have occurred in the certification process and the applicability of the data produced by such testing for use in other aspects of flight testing; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE0461B4433FA47B1AD416DB8AB8E16A8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the safety of pilots during such testing; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48604548B5CD45439006A1600F464A9B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the value and accuracy of data collected using the advanced tools described in subsection (a); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6B9C13DFB7CD4BE1823C1222A2617A2D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the ability to produce more extensive data sets using such advanced tools; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD21175B4758F44D3998737E0E40F04B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) any aspects of such testing for which the use of such advanced tools would not be valuable or applicable; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H64A64A6D5CA1499D9CCCB4FF562635B3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) the cost of using such advanced tools; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBE6C777A0E1C42ADBA4456DA31A332C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) the best practices of other international civil aviation authorities that permit the use of advanced tools during aerospace certification projects.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDE4301E0F4C44D093A5101C6809D42F" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 311. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6B9C13DFB7CD4BE1823C1222A2617A2D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the ability to produce more extensive data sets using such advanced tools; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD21175B4758F44D3998737E0E40F04B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) any aspects of such testing for which the use of such advanced tools would not be valuable or applicable; USE OF ADVANCED TOOLS AND HIGH-RISK FLIGHT TESTING IN CERTIFYING AEROSPACE PRODUCTS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7D0D6465C40443D493B00D74DD8F10F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Assessment Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall complete an assessment of the use of advanced tools during the testing, analysis, and verification stages of aerospace certification projects to reduce the risks associated with high-risk flight profiles and performing limit testing. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDA6787744D8D4B4BAB7B8EB5FF7B289A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Considerations In carrying out the assessment under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consider— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C168E3ED82A400D8959C5D4ADD68A44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) instances in which high-risk flight profiles and limit testing have occurred in the certification process and the applicability of the data produced by such testing for use in other aspects of flight testing; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE0461B4433FA47B1AD416DB8AB8E16A8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the safety of pilots during such testing; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48604548B5CD45439006A1600F464A9B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the value and accuracy of data collected using the advanced tools described in subsection (a); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6B9C13DFB7CD4BE1823C1222A2617A2D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the ability to produce more extensive data sets using such advanced tools; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD21175B4758F44D3998737E0E40F04B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) any aspects of such testing for which the use of such advanced tools would not be valuable or applicable; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H64A64A6D5CA1499D9CCCB4FF562635B3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) the cost of using such advanced tools; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBE6C777A0E1C42ADBA4456DA31A332C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) the best practices of other international civil aviation authorities that permit the use of advanced tools during aerospace certification projects. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D7AEB36D6894B1A90C1A21E9F5469A7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation In carrying out the assessment under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consult with— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD987E6D40C8545AEBDE6305B4B6F9FA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) aircraft manufacturers, including manufacturers that have designed and certified aircraft under— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE90E46099FCD46BE953308DD471BC586" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) part 23 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45BEA7291E36438FB184CF0E8F17F0F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) modifying any associated advisory circulars, guidance, or policy of the FAA. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD4F780A8323942E59F10A5CBE3396138" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements In taking actions under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall consider— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H743E6F6A59F342488F08524EADEF9321" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) developing validation criteria and procedures whereby data produced in high-fidelity engineering laboratories and facilities may be allowed (in conjunction with, or in lieu of) data produced on a flying test article to support an applicant’s showing of compliance required under section 21.35(a)(1) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97CD9D83EB0B4223BA6B5A94234AEEEC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) working with other international civil aviation authorities representing States of Design to— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA35BAF0BB0ED45128E3444E5651FD1D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) identify their best practices relative to high risk-flight testing; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9431234402094561AAFAF9AD9AE5AA3A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) adopt such practices into the flight-testing requirements of the FAA to the maximum extent practicable.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0C066AC08E684AD6AE4F9471E1E0F806" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Congressional report Not later than 60 days after the completion of the assessment under subsection (a), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the results of the assessment conducted under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H28779D73055B41B494D5F02239F9E717" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Required updates <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA8B44F5A2195446FB0AD677F85C05A2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall take necessary actions based on the results of the assessment under subsection (a), including, as appropriate— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC909783A64474404A32F111D44D8EC31" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) amending part 21 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H45BEA7291E36438FB184CF0E8F17F0F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) modifying any associated advisory circulars, guidance, or policy of the FAA. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD4F780A8323942E59F10A5CBE3396138" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements In taking actions under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall consider— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H743E6F6A59F342488F08524EADEF9321" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) developing validation criteria and procedures whereby data produced in high-fidelity engineering laboratories and facilities may be allowed (in conjunction with, or in lieu of) data produced on a flying test article to support an applicant’s showing of compliance required under section 21.35(a)(1) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3D6C1B20F4F14D4F91007F9FCB5EB12A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) developing criteria and procedures whereby an Organization Designation Authorization (as defined in section 44736(c)(5) of title 49, United States Code) may recommend that certain data produced during an applicant’s flight test program may be accepted by the FAA as final compliance data in accordance with section 21.35(b) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, at the sole discretion of the FAA; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97CD9D83EB0B4223BA6B5A94234AEEEC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) working with other international civil aviation authorities representing States of Design to— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA35BAF0BB0ED45128E3444E5651FD1D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) identify their best practices relative to high risk-flight testing; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9431234402094561AAFAF9AD9AE5AA3A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) adopt such practices into the flight-testing requirements of the FAA to the maximum extent practicable.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3ADA3C6E13D74FD4854833DFAF65BECD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Extension of the safety oversight and certification advisory committee Section 202(h) of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">shall terminate and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">shall terminate on October 1, 2028.. <title id="H60A8B41D626E4FE5B81B09400225627C" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> II FAA OVERSIGHT AND ORGANIZATIONAL REFORM <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF31D82A63E354D53B73480CB335AF737" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 201. FAA LEADERSHIP Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3A6DC6D9F4CC4F83881DE89BF00225E4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in subsection (a) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Federal and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> In general.—The Federal; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED59564A367448C8A779661A6A226D5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8EBA29800FFD496998192C64E0C68B8E" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCADD28EA98764509AB61E5C294400236" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Administration leadership <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H050221B56999403A8217E6BCD8AA9B18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Administrator <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08E8511A4807408FB720B1A801D49DE8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The head of the Administration is the Administrator, who shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDB16542E5B649CCB259AE45AC18BD32" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Qualifications The Administrator shall— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9792E0575D0C47AA919ECF544CA48E37" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) be a citizen of the United States; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD9293BBB91384D819B5EDE73B8A1554B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not be an active duty member of the Armed Forces; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7483CB604B314E7C9BC23D2AEF61B707" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) not have retired from the Armed Forces within the 7 years preceding nomination; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC03069DAD8894659A9E6D105F5CCCFE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation.

and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H9556A6EBA64D4BF7B7E2749E76929399" style="OLC"> a committee, board, council, or organization that is— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5C985EAEC0C04519900B1479AA0D18A0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) established by executive order; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6154096E56744DA8FE623C95D136D74" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) not explicitly directed by legislation to review the exercise of such duties, powers, and authorities by the Secretary or the Administrator. ; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0250FCB821A1442F8330219A36E0D72B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in paragraph (2)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HECD2849391F14BA190B7FD1E1B619A6A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) in subparagraph (A)(ii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the acquisition and all that follows through the semicolon and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the acquisition, establishment, improvement, operation, maintenance, security (including cybersecurity), and disposal of property, facilities, services, and equipment of the Administration, including all elements of the air traffic control system owned by the Administration;; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3A8375D253845D1A25CA950478B40ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in subparagraph (A)(iii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">paragraph (3) and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">paragraph (4); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H29481302E0B246BA853CD358A1014E79" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) in subparagraph (B) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">civil aviation, any matter for which the Administrator is the final authority under subparagraph (A), any duty carried out by the Administrator pursuant to paragraph (3), or the provisions of this title, or after <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">with respect to; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H722607FFC73743F0BB1C46976C717B2D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) in paragraph (3)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAAF3479A96044966972FEC961FECEBF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) in subparagraph (A)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE597B942BD8A418F82D412BDB6CCDBA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">In the performance and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HF538ADAC88714141BA937A613F01DBE4" style="OLC"> <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2692A31572C94EFB894632946321AA8E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Issuance of regulations In the performance ; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4DBECEED0F834C3AA21F1BA3A08A1A67" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Administrator shall act and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H05B9DB5D1BBC4C1BAB9357CC2910B24B" style="OLC"> <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE7D62365464B40EC930B40E2FD4E3A4A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Petitions for rulemaking The Administrator shall act ; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04ECFA626894417284CC8A93063FB44C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Administrator shall issue and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H3E8AC738CFD24F2FB7C8ABFD27C23FBB" style="OLC"> <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF8EF50128184AC39507868A29A604F7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Rulemaking timeline The Administrator shall issue ; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77643F2443104EDA94F95345A0097940" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">On February 1 and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H0F3A52816DD34A2483E2FC77A3F5089B" style="OLC"> <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A973A70E56545798C24A434183A5D22" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) Reporting requirement On February 1 ; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74A490C5D5F94EE2BAB1255586BF6FB3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) by striking subparagraphs (B) and (C) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H3C17212916014A6597C80D6E7534187D" style="OLC"> <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84CE890E4B68485884961B06E04A9F05" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Approval of Secretary of Transportation <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A426B2E514B4F599D51D77F4F6AB894" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) In general The Administrator may not issue, unless the Secretary of Transportation approves the issuance of the regulation in advance, a proposed regulation or final regulation that— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD20A92FE8F4B4A9DBD21481DACDE0DDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) is likely to result in the expenditure by State, local, and Tribal governments in the aggregate, or by the private sector, of $250,000,000 or more (adjusted annually for inflation beginning with the year following the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024) in any year; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6CF905C46B904E36AB1AED8113195CB3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) is significant. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H47EFA767861E43A1A4AB11A8A162D945" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Significant regulations For purposes of this paragraph, a regulation is significant if the Administrator, in consultation with the Secretary (as appropriate), determines that the regulation— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3811529FE95A4909BD4E3F770F2030C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) will have an annual effect on the economy of $250,000,000 or more (adjusted annually for inflation beginning with the year following the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024); <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE61527A5F57430F84CD39202C9C484E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) raises novel or serious legal or policy issues that will substantially and materially affect other transportation modes; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93E4A55C7B7047D6A99834E7CAA480F0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (III) adversely affects, in a substantial and material way, the economy, a sector of the economy, productivity, competition, jobs, the environment, public health or safety, or a State, local, or Tribal government or community.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9BB14008A8B45D3B124FE08BE859979" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) Review management Any periodic review of a regulation under this subparagraph shall be managed by the Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement, who may task an advisory committee or the Management Advisory Council established under subsection (p) to assist in performing the review. ; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H91C6F055249A48F2BFD074D7CFFCC782" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by redesignating paragraphs (3) and (4) as paragraphs (4) and (5), respectively; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A3071CB53244C9895742EC06C20E35B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) by inserting after paragraph (2) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H584BC9BE2FAE4263BD09E7D3E3E1AF52" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF176D3380D06434890A29F9F8E318D57" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Duties and powers of the Administrator <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H339EA350A98C4085A34C001132CE8887" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The Administrator shall carry out— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCBD51F39FA114EC586135E4E0BB32196" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the duties and powers of the Secretary under this subsection related to aviation safety (except duties and powers related to transportation, packaging, marking, or description of hazardous material) and stated in— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H367E0D5E183F4BFA815E752E9535C28B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) subsections (c) and (d) of section 1132; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H637AE7698F3A4ECD9EB34DF267617212" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) sections 40101(c), 40103(b), 40106(a), 40108, 40109(b), 40113(a), 40113(c), 40113(d), 40113(e), 40114(a), and 40117; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H20938912A94140A7BB0F32E9247773E8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (III) chapter 443; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6018D17B09164FD5B028FF6D461A3BC0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (IV) chapter 445, except sections 44502(a)(3), 44503, and 44509; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H17295150DC914595ACC73BF6742BBF44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (V) chapter 447, except sections 44721(b) and 44723; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H517F30AE128B4F30B5F039D37A392ED6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (VI) chapter 448; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB428EB0E0F7404CBCA746985824B527" qb-display-quote="yes"> (VII) chapter 451; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA588348B8BF4583A5B1AD1ED2227A57" qb-display-quote="yes"> (VIII) chapter 453; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9133CC1D282449AAC492CD742BE3F8E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (IX) section 46104; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9636476E331B4B0EAF07CD9689960996" qb-display-quote="yes"> (X) subsections (d) and (h)(2) of section 46301, section 46303(c), sections 46304 through 46308, section 46310, section 46311, and sections 46313 through 46320; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD40E92754F6041AE963B8CBFCC953FFB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (XI) chapter 465; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7F0313FB69A4994827A938633CF17E1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (XII) chapter 471; <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6DC78F305F9E4934B2C4184F138277E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (XIII) chapter 475; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBE61BEEC8CC7467287A86FA6F77F1EA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (XIV) chapter 509 of title 51; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3DE15292E41941A5A5CA9620B44A1887" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) such additional duties and powers as may be prescribed by the Secretary. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB6713DAD0C6445F9538E06048286804" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Applicability Section 40101(d) applies to the duties and powers specified in subparagraph (A).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB6713DAD0C6445F9538E06048286804" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Applicability Section 40101(d) applies to the duties and powers specified in subparagraph (A). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02B4E2B46CE4464FAED49FD0E80A249E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Transfer Any of the duties and powers specified in subparagraph (A) may only be transferred to another part of the Department if specifically provided by law or in a reorganization plan submitted under chapter 9 of title 5. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H98EE324E86A94F37BDC455F07AD419AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Administrative finality A decision of the Administrator in carrying out the duties or powers specified in subparagraph (A) is administratively final.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7B284C5EF2894CAC9158A71FCDE7BDCF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 205. REGULATORY MATERIALS IMPROVEMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F090A15861E4C5683A7A620CA6ADBDC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Internal regulatory process review <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6B3C5DFB3B964FEFAA2D602C20BF36ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H87ECAF35EA314C1382EAC8F87919809E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Review team The Administrator shall establish a regulatory process review team (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">review team) comprising of FAA employees and individuals described in paragraph (2) to develop recommendations to improve the timeliness, performance, and accountability of the development and promulgation of regulatory materials. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF622AA34190045DC9836B48E15F2BE4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Report The review team shall submit to the Administrator a report with recommendations in accordance with the deadlines specified in paragraph (5).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF622AA34190045DC9836B48E15F2BE4C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Report The review team shall submit to the Administrator a report with recommendations in accordance with the deadlines specified in paragraph (5). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6CC01E1402347AA857981D4C72279D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Other members; consultation <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFBCAA8CBA7D84AAEB2A470AA7CA2DDDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The review team shall include at least 3 outside experts and or academics with relevant experience or expertise in aviation safety and at least 1 outside expert with relevant experience or expertise in improving the performance, accountability, and transparency of the Federal regulatory process, particularly as such process relates to aviation safety. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H934223EEDC084CB5BE31D27DAC3DDD8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Consultation The review team may, as appropriate, consult with industry stakeholders.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H934223EEDC084CB5BE31D27DAC3DDD8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Consultation The review team may, as appropriate, consult with industry stakeholders. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5CA39CAC9C2403786C9F83411C9FEBE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Contents of review In conducting the review required under paragraph (1), the review team shall do the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBCF9A40FA4141718CFA71B9AB9B3668" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Develop a proposal for rationalizing processes and eliminating redundant administrative review of regulatory materials within the FAA, particularly when FAA-sponsored rulemaking committees and stakeholders have collaborated on the proposed regulations. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05DEC323439A46649739A838526F3D95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) With respect to each office within the FAA that reviews regulatory materials, assess— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23935AEC51AB4B3491DF48A0E831841E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the timeline assigned to each such office to complete the review of regulatory materials; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBEEDB39A86D74AC4BC9A156A1D3E6336" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the actual time spent for such review; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H055808870BAC45FC845B747C4B5EEE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) opportunities to reduce the actual time for such review; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A31E797F9C544C68AC43FE42B157165" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) whether clear roles, responsibilities, requirements, and expectations are clearly defined for each office required to review the regulatory materials.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19BD7D12F23046ABB9841C0C23CFC6FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements The Deputy Administrator shall ensure any portal established under this subsection asks questions that seek to gauge any shortcomings the FAA has in fulfilling the mission of the FAA or areas where the FAA is succeeding in meeting the mission of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F70983028545ECA6568B9CAA08D6B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Application This section shall apply to applications relating to— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0242AAA00D94386839316003C2B2CF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) an aircraft, aircraft engine, propeller, or appliance certification; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H25BC2D9CAC724792A99237E25FBED87F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an airman or pilot certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB8C20EDA5AE4FC8BF0AF56A5AAD4916" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a medical certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F02A76E402C4C11B205A2A25CCD458A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) an operator certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C85D57E668242BD93C391CFFFA6B911" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) when authority under chapter 509 of title 51, United States Code, is explicitly delegated by the Secretary to the Administrator, a license or permit issued under such chapter; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CB27E7FA47643868DF9DC04A3608AEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) an aircraft registration; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H769A176A674947C0BE9FC6909759786F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an operational approval, waiver, or exemption; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05EBF26D0C194EC2912785F3FBA34FF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) a legal interpretation; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCAD0AF6ABAE44FE2B58AEB785AD360A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) an outstanding agency determination; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBD706DA3B4FB444797090880B9A2E95B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) any certificate not otherwise described in this subparagraph that is issued pursuant to chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E90ECA6403445778A00541C8E3565B2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 209.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19BD7D12F23046ABB9841C0C23CFC6FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements The Deputy Administrator shall ensure any portal established under this subsection asks questions that seek to gauge any shortcomings the FAA has in fulfilling the mission of the FAA or areas where the FAA is succeeding in meeting the mission of the FAA. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F70983028545ECA6568B9CAA08D6B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Application This section shall apply to applications relating to— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0242AAA00D94386839316003C2B2CF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) an aircraft, aircraft engine, propeller, or appliance certification; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H25BC2D9CAC724792A99237E25FBED87F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) an airman or pilot certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB8C20EDA5AE4FC8BF0AF56A5AAD4916" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a medical certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F02A76E402C4C11B205A2A25CCD458A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) an operator certificate; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C85D57E668242BD93C391CFFFA6B911" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) when authority under chapter 509 of title 51, United States Code, is explicitly delegated by the Secretary to the Administrator, a license or permit issued under such chapter; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CB27E7FA47643868DF9DC04A3608AEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) an aircraft registration; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H769A176A674947C0BE9FC6909759786F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an operational approval, waiver, or exemption; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05EBF26D0C194EC2912785F3FBA34FF0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) a legal interpretation; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCAD0AF6ABAE44FE2B58AEB785AD360A4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) an outstanding agency determination; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBD706DA3B4FB444797090880B9A2E95B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) any certificate not otherwise described in this subparagraph that is issued pursuant to chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E90ECA6403445778A00541C8E3565B2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 209.

MANAGEMENT ADVISORY COUNCIL Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09747A53DFE6474DBC84E86F173EC77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by transferring paragraph (8) of subsection (p) to subsection (r) and redesignating such paragraph as paragraph (7); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB727E129A3C8450181C55E85630A93F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by striking subsection (p) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H12821348650E4AE6B58D9878B3F115DE" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF26CEE6F277645818D54BD9B7367ED59" qb-display-quote="yes"> (p) Management advisory council <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7873C8FE879A4E3E98287C5ACD10DFDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Establishment The Administrator shall establish an advisory council which shall be known as the Federal Aerospace Management Advisory Council (in this subsection referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Council). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF20BC5BC8A02433180EEC8843C557514" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Membership The Council shall consist of 13 members, who shall consist of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA4FC8B6F707C4B01AA4F6680A432C7EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a designee of the Secretary of Transportation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2C975F07332A40008A8338F83448A17E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a designee of the Secretary of Defense; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66152D5E1AA343B68DD654C525E03F60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) 5 members representing aerospace and technology interests, appointed by the Administrator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F1160076F644CD7B75608261E72E6CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) 5 members representing aerospace and technology interests, appointed by the Secretary of Transportation; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEB7A1021953042A5A9DCD65EF3A3E05C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) 1 member, appointed by the Secretary of Transportation, who is the head of a union representing air traffic control system employees.
