MANAGEMENT ADVISORY COUNCIL Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09747A53DFE6474DBC84E86F173EC77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by transferring paragraph (8) of subsection (p) to subsection (r) and redesignating such paragraph as paragraph (7); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB727E129A3C8450181C55E85630A93F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) by striking subsection (p) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H12821348650E4AE6B58D9878B3F115DE" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF26CEE6F277645818D54BD9B7367ED59" qb-display-quote="yes"> (p) Management advisory council <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7873C8FE879A4E3E98287C5ACD10DFDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Establishment The Administrator shall establish an advisory council which shall be known as the Federal Aerospace Management Advisory Council (in this subsection referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Council). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF20BC5BC8A02433180EEC8843C557514" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Membership The Council shall consist of 13 members, who shall consist of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA4FC8B6F707C4B01AA4F6680A432C7EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a designee of the Secretary of Transportation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2C975F07332A40008A8338F83448A17E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a designee of the Secretary of Defense; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66152D5E1AA343B68DD654C525E03F60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) 5 members representing aerospace and technology interests, appointed by the Administrator; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F1160076F644CD7B75608261E72E6CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) 5 members representing aerospace and technology interests, appointed by the Secretary of Transportation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAED00BA4C39B4B15A0FE05E461684A7D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Disclosure of commercial or proprietary data Any member of the Council who receives commercial or other proprietary data as provided for in this paragraph from the Administrator shall be subject to the provisions of section 1905 of title 18, pertaining to unauthorized disclosure of such information. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3E4BB88B9994025B520486289AE5D52" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Application of chapter 10 of title 5 Chapter 10 of title 5 does not apply to— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H325AC8FEC1B74C07818084C3EC927C36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Council; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF197614EBD1F48328A648A72ADAF53A6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) such aviation rulemaking committees as the Administrator shall designate; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC618DE87589548599612ABC9AE931D01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) such aerospace rulemaking committees as the Secretary shall designate. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7F3F9156DB604A35BB40CEBCF9D12463" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Administrative matters <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9000539856EF4BFC8B3C4800BA90B454" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Terms Members of the Council appointed under paragraph (2)(C) shall be appointed for a term of 3 years.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7F3F9156DB604A35BB40CEBCF9D12463" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Administrative matters <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9000539856EF4BFC8B3C4800BA90B454" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Terms Members of the Council appointed under paragraph (2)(C) shall be appointed for a term of 3 years. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8087BDA69419442093B4328F65F1909F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Term for air traffic control representative The member appointed under paragraph (2)(E) shall be appointed for a term of 3 years, except that the term of such individual shall end whenever the individual no longer meets the requirements of paragraph (2)(E). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0EFE75019DB47768E60FC3226D663AD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Vacancy Any vacancy on the Council shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment, except that any member appointed to fill a vacancy occurring before the expiration of the term for which the predecessor of the member was appointed shall be appointed for the remainder of that term.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8087BDA69419442093B4328F65F1909F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Term for air traffic control representative The member appointed under paragraph (2)(E) shall be appointed for a term of 3 years, except that the term of such individual shall end whenever the individual no longer meets the requirements of paragraph (2)(E). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0EFE75019DB47768E60FC3226D663AD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Vacancy Any vacancy on the Council shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment, except that any member appointed to fill a vacancy occurring before the expiration of the term for which the predecessor of the member was appointed shall be appointed for the remainder of that term. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3AB4E3154D44F1495E9C6A23DE79BFB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Continuation in office A member of the Council whose term expires shall continue to serve until the date on which the successor of the member takes office.

FAA TELEWORK <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC989B03FDED4C64A8EBD27B3E81BD88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40774DD5A17D4C4391D9454FEC12F2D2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may establish telework policies for employees of the FAA that allow for the Administrator to reduce the office footprint and associated expenses of the FAA, if appropriate, increase workforce retention, and provide flexibilities that the Administrator demonstrates increases efficiency and effectiveness of the Administration, while requiring that any such policy— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94D4B050D9A44D84BB07ED504B68F01A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) does not adversely impact the mission of the FAA; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43E850C917B24CA59D8B11FAEE48AE5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not reduce the safety or efficiency of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H310A19622020430DB68016D509338C7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) for any employee that is designated as an officer or executive in the FAA Executive System or a political appointee (as such term is defined in section 106 of title 49, United States Code)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82B49BA2853A480687892FDB0E3EE081" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) maximizes time at a duty station for such employee, excluding official travel; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6BF29958F574102849F88302AD11CB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) may include telework provisions as determined appropriate by the Administrator, commensurate with official duties for such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7CDCAE2D70124ADF8599F99022BB4A92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) provides for on-the-job training opportunities for FAA personnel that are not less than such opportunities available in 2019; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H513763D170654F67948F41AEFA3CDC7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) reflects the appropriate work status of employees based on the job functions of such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77EC46A06A13435BBB54DD46ADBA7F61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) optimizes the work status of inspectors, investigators, and other personnel performing safety-related functions to ensure timely completion of safety oversight activities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13E114E9C245422EB6E14E550F8EE7B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) provides for personnel, including such personnel performing work related to aircraft certification and flight standards, who are responsible for actively working with regulated entities, external stakeholders, or other members of the public to be— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E35C46677B4B7E9A6A7A12C4BFFA50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) routinely available on a predictable basis for in-person and virtual communications with external persons; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H614812E5CAE7444F9CACCE8E0AB57B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not hindered from meeting with, visiting, auditing, or inspecting facilities or projects of regulated persons due to any telework policy; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC126DDAD04241C58CA099E21AF52447" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, shall evaluate and address any telework policies in effect on the day before such date of enactment to ensure that such policies meet the requirements of paragraph (1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9614CF8A60AF4A04924ED31EC88CFF9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation If the Administrator determines that telework agreements need to be updated to implement the requirements of subsection (a), the Administrator shall, prior to updating such agreements, consult with— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H905E5D2663554F6C8FF48CD9C16C261F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) exclusive bargaining representatives of air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9337CF3E2D364FAFA5D102977EE973BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) labor organizations certified under such section as the exclusive bargaining representative of airway transportation systems specialists and aviation safety inspectors and engineers of the FAA.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9614CF8A60AF4A04924ED31EC88CFF9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation If the Administrator determines that telework agreements need to be updated to implement the requirements of subsection (a), the Administrator shall, prior to updating such agreements, consult with— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H905E5D2663554F6C8FF48CD9C16C261F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) exclusive bargaining representatives of air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9337CF3E2D364FAFA5D102977EE973BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) labor organizations certified under such section as the exclusive bargaining representative of airway transportation systems specialists and aviation safety inspectors and engineers of the FAA. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43F2918800AB42F9B96F17E769010200" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 222. REVIEW OF OFFICE SPACE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFFFABDE799C542ACBF89C601F230571B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) FAA review <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4ADF5482FB0F4EDABEBFD9619E718F29" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Initiation of review Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall initiate an inventory review of the domestic office footprint of the Department of Transportation.

12101 et seq. ); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA8EB2CC23B814E2996070D18A726E4C0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) determine the feasible occupancy of such space, and provide the methodology used to make the determination; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7BE328AD1E849119EF78C0AE4A22B3C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) determine the number of individuals who are full-time equivalent employees, other support personnel, or contractors that have each such unit as a duty station and determine how telework policies will impact the usage of such space; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC39EEAF2A87A4C3DB695793CED362888" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) calculate the amount of available, unused, or underutilized space in each such space; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD399775255B04397B64F03CD1A204372" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) consider any lease terms for leased space contained in the domestic office footprint, including cost and effective dates for each such lease; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB901C584F724478699636FD827CC77B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) based on the findings in paragraphs (2) through (6), and any other metrics the Secretary determines relevant, provide recommendations for optimizing the use of office space across the Department in consultation with appropriate employee labor representatives. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H178511185242470B94B9676E8D0D4FA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 4 months after completing the review under subsection (a), the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a final report that proposes opportunities to optimize the domestic office footprint of the FAA (and associated costs).

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0CAEA5E64BD44D09812D22A3F145297A" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 224. FAA PARTICIPATION IN INDUSTRY STANDARDS ORGANIZATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78961843C9344229AECD8ECA5A1800DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator shall encourage the participation of employees of the FAA, as appropriate, in the activities of recognized industry standards organizations to advance the adoption, reference, and acceptance rate of standards and means of compliance developed by such organizations by the Administrator. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H986205D181754E038AFA1E10E436395D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Participation An employee of the FAA directed by the Administrator to participate in a working group, task group, committee, or similar body of a recognized industry standards organization shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46CBB9C7D7004CB2AD21EF5583050F0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) actively participate in the discussions and work of such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H304F4223EE51404FBC85910F2A703D12" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) accurately represent the position of the Administrator on the subject matter of such discussions and work; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96405EF22BC6450B8823981DAD87CED5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) contribute to the development of work products of such organization, unless determined to be inappropriate by such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E55A864BE7D4F99A9B81B4410A19ACF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) make reasonable efforts to identify and make any concerns of the Administrator relating to such work products known to such organization, including through providing formal comments, as may be allowed for under the procedures of such organization; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49EA1BAFD08F4A03BD24B265BC77DAF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) provide regular updates to other FAA employees and management on the progress of such work products; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8A82205B2361430EBCC0FC65F323930F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) seek advice and input from other FAA employees and management, as needed.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H678DBA61B9104447BEBB7C77E2F985BE" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 228. COMMERCIAL PREFERENCE Section 40110(d) of title 49, United States Code, is further amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB314E931DA534BE58D55B3A2D43FCE8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">and implement and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">, implement, and periodically update; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H911AFD52B72C408DAD9221712EC16726" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) in paragraph (2) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the new acquisition management system developed and implemented and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the acquisition management system developed, implemented, and periodically updated each place it appears; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD88A8646BD714E9081B59898A37C60D5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) in paragraph (3)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7AB6C5FB0B5E42B09B90F558BDC8B3B3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24F7D2AC49D0460FB9482D20BBF60A2B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">new; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55DCF63C9F664FFDB7874E3858DF0990" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">and implemented and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">, implemented, and periodically updated; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D5668D71FD4155B240951F8B1110C4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in subparagraph (B) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Within and all that follows through <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">the Administrator and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">The Administrator; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09950C59BDCE434CBFD7B4B9F97BFD27" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B9D36459300417C8DFD928A1AAE05CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) by inserting after paragraph (3) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H70A54DF568D34328B0C0310B35EBD61D" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12A3B62F7E6F45AB830246A788C06D99" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Commercial products and services In implementing and updating the acquisition management system pursuant to paragraph (1), the Administrator shall, whenever possible— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE479AA31F8794F809EA8107B757C11F8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) describe the requirements with respect to a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services in terms of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF69B6EB48FD4658961C4A3337645C69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) functions to be performed; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3B744F4D4354878BE26641DEEAE3435" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) performance required; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3F1F0E6C68947CCB50E814D6B66B946" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) essential physical and system characteristics; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB39C4F1A2ED4443B9E69B3662ADD86CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) ensure that commercial services or commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, ensure that nondevelopmental items other than commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75D3EC981A1A47299E25DF666CC9140A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide offerors of commercial services, commercial products, and nondevelopmental items other than commercial products an opportunity to compete in any solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE68C1F74069F45EEA6C6F73275AF47F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) revise the procurement policies, practices, and procedures of the Administration to reduce any impediments to the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5A69A36304049239909DA7089D01DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) ensure that any procurement of new equipment takes into account the life cycle, reliability, performance, service support, and costs to guarantee the acquisition of equipment that is of high quality and reliability resulting in greater performance and cost-related benefits; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H536F913356014123881E3437F22EE422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) ensure that procurement officials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDC3F25E02C548EC8E0027DBE502DEA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) acquire commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products to meet the needs of the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E9ECDAB5251429AA40E6C5FDB8860FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) in a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services, state the specifications for such supplies or services in terms that enable and encourage bidders and offerors to supply commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, to supply nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF1CB7835BDC4B76A0917B30BD5C5F9F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) require that prime contractors and subcontractors at all levels under contracts with the Administration incorporate commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products as components of items supplied to the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H434F4E26849943E996266F7C47474DF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) modify procurement requirements in appropriate circumstances to ensure that such requirements can be met by commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDE0FBCF44D54972AB24871D8A7EA0B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) require training of appropriate personnel in the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services. .

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFADB42D6FC774C5D8E6DA21559063FE5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Exception Paragraph (1) shall not apply to an application for the renewal of a certificate issued under part 145 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC03A040BD1DF47E1986A7D87A747CFA1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Maintenance implementation procedures agreement The Administrator may elect not to enter into a new maintenance implementation procedures agreement with a country classified as Category 2, for as long as the country remains classified as Category 2. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3DB024B606D4CD896F43D18DF9CC131" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Prohibition on continued heavy maintenance work No part 121 air carrier may enter into a new contract for heavy maintenance work with a person located or headquartered in a country that the Administrator, through the International Aviation Safety Assessment program, has classified as Category 2, for as long as such country remains classified as Category 2.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD6AFE182B0446FD95C280DBEA37E86A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Minimum qualifications for mechanics and others working on U.S. registered aircraft <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB6D348302F64A4A86A72619BC35BC8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Administrator shall require that, at each covered repair station— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD3936974F6444ACA9E74DC951F85C77C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) all supervisory personnel of such station are appropriately certificated as a mechanic or repairman under part 65 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, or under an equivalent certification or licensing regime, as determined by the Administrator; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C2411A6F3C94FC1BC66B198EAFA9007" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) all personnel of such station authorized to approve an article for return to service are appropriately certificated as a mechanic or repairman under part 65 of such title, or under an equivalent certification or licensing regime, as determined by the Administrator. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF95F4019669A4B0796C18C899D00D1A8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Available for consultation Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Administrator shall require any individual who is responsible for approving an article for return to service or who is directly in charge of heavy maintenance work performed on aircraft operated by a part 121 air carrier be available for consultation while work is being performed at a covered repair station. .

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF95F4019669A4B0796C18C899D00D1A8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Available for consultation Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Administrator shall require any individual who is responsible for approving an article for return to service or who is directly in charge of heavy maintenance work performed on aircraft operated by a part 121 air carrier be available for consultation while work is being performed at a covered repair station. . <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3AC6BAF82E924F5897936185AA678EB5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Definitions <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0F8DFCD0E1CB456AA2497931B7342CAF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Section 44733(j) of title 49, United States Code (as redesignated by this section), is amended— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H597A39766F574B43BB653C854A36B71E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">aircraft and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">aircraft (including on-wing aircraft engines); <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7396808030D04F46B83BE3C7206A4269" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (3) as paragraphs (2) through (4), respectively; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC662F2787EA46AD93A0A0EBC27796E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) by inserting before paragraph (2), as so redesignated, the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HBAA4151E629E4F1083283602E137230E" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0C92AB5C50D488081AB0EDB5A6C0F5B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Covered repair station The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered repair station means a facility that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35AE9C045F3943959D98D64A553472A5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) is located outside the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77991C39651B42498AC3E9EE5B3D2E60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) is a part 145 repair station; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1622C2144080480BA2768B153C4F01D4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) performs heavy maintenance work on aircraft operated by a part 121 air carrier.

. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3AC6BAF82E924F5897936185AA678EB5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Definitions <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0F8DFCD0E1CB456AA2497931B7342CAF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Section 44733(j) of title 49, United States Code (as redesignated by this section), is amended— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H597A39766F574B43BB653C854A36B71E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">aircraft and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">aircraft (including on-wing aircraft engines); <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7396808030D04F46B83BE3C7206A4269" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (3) as paragraphs (2) through (4), respectively; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC662F2787EA46AD93A0A0EBC27796E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) by inserting before paragraph (2), as so redesignated, the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HBAA4151E629E4F1083283602E137230E" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0C92AB5C50D488081AB0EDB5A6C0F5B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Covered repair station The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered repair station means a facility that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35AE9C045F3943959D98D64A553472A5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) is located outside the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77991C39651B42498AC3E9EE5B3D2E60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) is a part 145 repair station; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1622C2144080480BA2768B153C4F01D4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) performs heavy maintenance work on aircraft operated by a part 121 air carrier. .

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5510089FE9134EDBABD05952C3746364" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 103. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H95BA8DA81EA845E1A855C705747DBCE5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) $13,055,000,000 for fiscal year 2025; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H053FBFE9B63648EC998176415BC8D06F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) $13,354,000,000 for fiscal year 2026; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H279D0DA452BA4611A9A846A36EE88510" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Deputy Administrator <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1CD25C1BFE924AB787B200B4A047104A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The Administrator has a Deputy Administrator, who shall be appointed by the President. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6099CCF3FC249F49EDDCE23488498A5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Qualifications The Deputy Administrator shall— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC2FD6E987A124ABC85939A310478ED69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) be a citizen of the United States; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7DA736C34CFD46B7A835870F6FC24A19" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H603F281CFEAE42719C6B0BBD049BF622" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Fitness In appointing an individual as Deputy Administrator, the President shall consider the fitness of the individual to carry out efficiently the duties and powers of the office, including the duty to act for the Administrator when the Administrator is absent or unable to serve, or when the office of Administrator is vacant.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED975EAB84BC49C198C4D40FADAB0C79" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) Compensation <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H58AF39B7FBE84B68925D21B1E22A1187" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Annual rate of basic pay The annual rate of basic pay of the Deputy Administrator shall be set by the Secretary but shall not exceed the annual rate of basic pay payable to the Administrator. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H71182F8C33444ACBB4A23D08B7BF8E48" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Exception A retired regular officer of the Armed Forces serving as the Deputy Administrator is entitled to hold a rank and grade not lower than that held when appointed as the Deputy Administrator and may elect to receive— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA46AB1BC07A24CDAB2D89E618768B2AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) the pay provided for the Deputy Administrator under clause (i); or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5777A7AAAF9942C2A4171E67AA17DB95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the pay and allowances or the retired pay of the military grade held. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A49748CD1EC4A11BB62EB80B2CA3C02" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Reimbursement of expenses If the Deputy Administrator elects to receive compensation described in clause (ii)(II), the Administration shall reimburse the appropriate military department from funds available for the expenses of the Administration.

<subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE61527A5F57430F84CD39202C9C484E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) raises novel or serious legal or policy issues that will substantially and materially affect other transportation modes; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93E4A55C7B7047D6A99834E7CAA480F0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (III) adversely affects, in a substantial and material way, the economy, a sector of the economy, productivity, competition, jobs, the environment, public health or safety, or a State, local, or Tribal government or community.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E90ECA6403445778A00541C8E3565B2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 209. SENSE OF CONGRESS ON FAA ENGAGEMENT DURING RULEMAKING ACTIVITIES It is the sense of Congress that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF3FC303AAA548C7B6D9A1478D0B938C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Administrator should— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB618FAAC5E149A397A6BBECC6D06852" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) engage with aviation stakeholder groups and the public during pre-drafting stages of rulemaking activities and use, to the greatest extent practicable, properly docketed ex parte discussions during rulemaking activities in order to— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB8781836EA304038A1C6D1BCD4201D54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) inform the work of the Administrator; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D6392519F5B4E5F910F7C6C6582BEF9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) assist the Administrator in developing the scope of a rule; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FA4F47902454B96BC5B59768A507DED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) reduce the timeline for issuance of proposed and final rules; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB22F89D01CE34F96905CE8350D5704A2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) rely on documented data and safety trends when determining whether or not to proceed with a rulemaking activity; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB598A60622CF4A7AA571299AE9FF8635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) not consider a rulemaking activity required in statute, for the purposes of ex parte communications, as having been established on the date of enactment of the related public law, but rather upon obtainment of a regulation identifier number; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H01D3DCFD8C984E97BCA5AC8AF720D729" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) when it would reduce the time required for the Administrator to adjudicate public comments, the Administrator should publicly provide information describing the rationale behind a regulatory decision included in proposed regulations in order to better allow for the public to provide clear and informed comments on such regulations. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCE6AE9D632C042F19C4C288AC3B3CEF8" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 210.

and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66D2E895CB1B46CCA1D96206EB489042" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in subparagraph (E) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">shall be appointed for the remainder of that term and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">may be appointed for either the remainder of the term or for a full term; FAA TELEWORK <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC989B03FDED4C64A8EBD27B3E81BD88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40774DD5A17D4C4391D9454FEC12F2D2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may establish telework policies for employees of the FAA that allow for the Administrator to reduce the office footprint and associated expenses of the FAA, if appropriate, increase workforce retention, and provide flexibilities that the Administrator demonstrates increases efficiency and effectiveness of the Administration, while requiring that any such policy— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94D4B050D9A44D84BB07ED504B68F01A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) does not adversely impact the mission of the FAA; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43E850C917B24CA59D8B11FAEE48AE5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not reduce the safety or efficiency of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H310A19622020430DB68016D509338C7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) for any employee that is designated as an officer or executive in the FAA Executive System or a political appointee (as such term is defined in section 106 of title 49, United States Code)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82B49BA2853A480687892FDB0E3EE081" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) maximizes time at a duty station for such employee, excluding official travel; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6BF29958F574102849F88302AD11CB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) may include telework provisions as determined appropriate by the Administrator, commensurate with official duties for such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7CDCAE2D70124ADF8599F99022BB4A92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) provides for on-the-job training opportunities for FAA personnel that are not less than such opportunities available in 2019; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H513763D170654F67948F41AEFA3CDC7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) reflects the appropriate work status of employees based on the job functions of such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77EC46A06A13435BBB54DD46ADBA7F61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) optimizes the work status of inspectors, investigators, and other personnel performing safety-related functions to ensure timely completion of safety oversight activities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13E114E9C245422EB6E14E550F8EE7B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) provides for personnel, including such personnel performing work related to aircraft certification and flight standards, who are responsible for actively working with regulated entities, external stakeholders, or other members of the public to be— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E35C46677B4B7E9A6A7A12C4BFFA50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) routinely available on a predictable basis for in-person and virtual communications with external persons; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H614812E5CAE7444F9CACCE8E0AB57B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not hindered from meeting with, visiting, auditing, or inspecting facilities or projects of regulated persons due to any telework policy; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC126DDAD04241C58CA099E21AF52447" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, shall evaluate and address any telework policies in effect on the day before such date of enactment to ensure that such policies meet the requirements of paragraph (1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9614CF8A60AF4A04924ED31EC88CFF9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation If the Administrator determines that telework agreements need to be updated to implement the requirements of subsection (a), the Administrator shall, prior to updating such agreements, consult with— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H905E5D2663554F6C8FF48CD9C16C261F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) exclusive bargaining representatives of air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9337CF3E2D364FAFA5D102977EE973BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) labor organizations certified under such section as the exclusive bargaining representative of airway transportation systems specialists and aviation safety inspectors and engineers of the FAA.

FAA TELEWORK <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC989B03FDED4C64A8EBD27B3E81BD88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The Administrator— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40774DD5A17D4C4391D9454FEC12F2D2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) may establish telework policies for employees of the FAA that allow for the Administrator to reduce the office footprint and associated expenses of the FAA, if appropriate, increase workforce retention, and provide flexibilities that the Administrator demonstrates increases efficiency and effectiveness of the Administration, while requiring that any such policy— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94D4B050D9A44D84BB07ED504B68F01A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) does not adversely impact the mission of the FAA; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43E850C917B24CA59D8B11FAEE48AE5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not reduce the safety or efficiency of the national airspace system; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H310A19622020430DB68016D509338C7F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) for any employee that is designated as an officer or executive in the FAA Executive System or a political appointee (as such term is defined in section 106 of title 49, United States Code)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82B49BA2853A480687892FDB0E3EE081" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) maximizes time at a duty station for such employee, excluding official travel; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6BF29958F574102849F88302AD11CB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) may include telework provisions as determined appropriate by the Administrator, commensurate with official duties for such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7CDCAE2D70124ADF8599F99022BB4A92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) provides for on-the-job training opportunities for FAA personnel that are not less than such opportunities available in 2019; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H513763D170654F67948F41AEFA3CDC7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) reflects the appropriate work status of employees based on the job functions of such employee; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77EC46A06A13435BBB54DD46ADBA7F61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) optimizes the work status of inspectors, investigators, and other personnel performing safety-related functions to ensure timely completion of safety oversight activities; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13E114E9C245422EB6E14E550F8EE7B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) provides for personnel, including such personnel performing work related to aircraft certification and flight standards, who are responsible for actively working with regulated entities, external stakeholders, or other members of the public to be— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE5E35C46677B4B7E9A6A7A12C4BFFA50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) routinely available on a predictable basis for in-person and virtual communications with external persons; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H614812E5CAE7444F9CACCE8E0AB57B17" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) not hindered from meeting with, visiting, auditing, or inspecting facilities or projects of regulated persons due to any telework policy; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC126DDAD04241C58CA099E21AF52447" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, shall evaluate and address any telework policies in effect on the day before such date of enactment to ensure that such policies meet the requirements of paragraph (1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional update Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9614CF8A60AF4A04924ED31EC88CFF9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Consultation If the Administrator determines that telework agreements need to be updated to implement the requirements of subsection (a), the Administrator shall, prior to updating such agreements, consult with— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H905E5D2663554F6C8FF48CD9C16C261F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) exclusive bargaining representatives of air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9337CF3E2D364FAFA5D102977EE973BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) labor organizations certified under such section as the exclusive bargaining representative of airway transportation systems specialists and aviation safety inspectors and engineers of the FAA.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09950C59BDCE434CBFD7B4B9F97BFD27" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B9D36459300417C8DFD928A1AAE05CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) by inserting after paragraph (3) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H70A54DF568D34328B0C0310B35EBD61D" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12A3B62F7E6F45AB830246A788C06D99" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Commercial products and services In implementing and updating the acquisition management system pursuant to paragraph (1), the Administrator shall, whenever possible— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE479AA31F8794F809EA8107B757C11F8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) describe the requirements with respect to a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services in terms of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF69B6EB48FD4658961C4A3337645C69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) functions to be performed; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3B744F4D4354878BE26641DEEAE3435" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) performance required; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3F1F0E6C68947CCB50E814D6B66B946" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) essential physical and system characteristics; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB39C4F1A2ED4443B9E69B3662ADD86CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) ensure that commercial services or commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, ensure that nondevelopmental items other than commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75D3EC981A1A47299E25DF666CC9140A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) provide offerors of commercial services, commercial products, and nondevelopmental items other than commercial products an opportunity to compete in any solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE68C1F74069F45EEA6C6F73275AF47F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) revise the procurement policies, practices, and procedures of the Administration to reduce any impediments to the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5A69A36304049239909DA7089D01DFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) ensure that any procurement of new equipment takes into account the life cycle, reliability, performance, service support, and costs to guarantee the acquisition of equipment that is of high quality and reliability resulting in greater performance and cost-related benefits; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H536F913356014123881E3437F22EE422" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) ensure that procurement officials— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDC3F25E02C548EC8E0027DBE502DEA5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) acquire commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products to meet the needs of the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E9ECDAB5251429AA40E6C5FDB8860FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) in a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services, state the specifications for such supplies or services in terms that enable and encourage bidders and offerors to supply commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, to supply nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF1CB7835BDC4B76A0917B30BD5C5F9F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) require that prime contractors and subcontractors at all levels under contracts with the Administration incorporate commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products as components of items supplied to the Administration; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H434F4E26849943E996266F7C47474DF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) modify procurement requirements in appropriate circumstances to ensure that such requirements can be met by commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDE0FBCF44D54972AB24871D8A7EA0B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) require training of appropriate personnel in the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services. .

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H31C02D6D2A90461E82464D5A3F53501F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Reports <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13C1CA5A8BD74C9FB8A850A9AA4D8CE5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Priority recommendations Not later than 60 days after the date on which the Administrator implements the recommendations under subsection (a)(1), the Administrator shall submit to the Committees on the Judiciary and Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committees on the Judiciary and Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives, and the Caucus on International Narcotics Control of the Senate a report on such implementation, including a description of any steps taken by the Administrator to complete such implementation. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4487703E99EC466282BB0A39C012CFDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Remaining recommendations Not later than 60 days after the date on which the Administrator implements the recommendations under subsection (a)(2), the Administrator shall submit to the Committees on the Judiciary and Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committees on the Judiciary and Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives, and the Caucus on International Narcotics Control of the Senate a report on such implementation, including a description of any steps taken by the Administrator to complete such implementation. <title id="H2443098F967740F8BA6581F79EFB1D44" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> III AVIATION SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS <subtitle id="H96D6058959F348C7BB613D4D6B1E2BAD" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> A General Provisions <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD28D52DB282B4FC491DC4ABFC4FC8E47" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 301.
